loans.name: Ernelle Carole

texts.fr: Mlle Ernelle Carole, est une jeune camerounaise âgée de 31 ans;résidant dans la ville de Douala très ambitieuse, elle souhaite obtenir ce crédit pour acheter plus de sacs et emballages afin exerce le commerce en gors dans l'avenir. le bénéfice de ce commerce lui permet par ailleurs d'assurer la scolarité de ses enfants en bas age
texts.en: Ms. Ernelle Carole is a young Cameroonian, 31 years old, and a resident of Douala City. A very ambitious woman, she would like to obtain this loan in order to purchase bags and wrapping materials for operating in bulk in the future. The profits from this business will enable her, such as to cover the schooling costs for her young children.

loans.use: to purchase bags and wrapping materials

loans.name: Aita

texts.es:
Aita tiene 60 años, vive con su esposo e hijo en el distrito de Nueva Arica perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque.  Este distrito se encuentra ubicado a 1 hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la provincia de Lambayeque.

Aita se dedica desde hace 5 años a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Esta actividad le sirve para adquirir ingresos adicionales con los cuales solventa sus gastos familiares. Aita cría animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona frecuentemente.

Aita desea incrementar su inventario, quiere comprar muchos más animales para poder venderlos y obtener mayores ingresos.  Es por ello que ha solicitado un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Aita is 60 years old, and she lives with her husband and son in the Nueva Arica district of the Lambayeque province. This district is located one hour from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque province. 

Aita has made a living during the past five years raising and selling small animals. Aita raises the small animals in pens behind her home. When they have reach a certain stage in their development, she sells them to business people who visit the area frequently. 

Aita hopes to increase her business. She wants to buy more animals to be able to sell them and generate a greater income. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy animals to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente y con 03 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su familia en el Caserío Monteverde Bajo, perteneciente al Distrito de Tambogrande. Marco vive en la parte rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.

La actividad que desarrolla Marco, es la crianza de ganado menor (ovino, porcino y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar pero y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el en mercado local. Los animales los cría en la parte posterior de su domicilio.  También tiene 1.0 ha de terreno agrícola, en donde tiene mango y limón en producción. También arrienda 0.50 ha para sembrar arroz y maíz. Complementariamente es trabajador en los fundos agrícolas del caserío, en donde le pagan diariamente. Cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en la ganadería y agricultura.  Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades cubre sus gastos y los de su familia.

Marco desea brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.  Él ha decidido arreglar la fachada de su vivienda, comprar alimento balanceado para su ganado y fertilizantes para su cultivo de limón.  Para lograr lo que se ha propuesto ha decidido obtener un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Marco is 34 years old. He's in a common law marriage and has three children under his care. He lives with his family in a house he owns in the settlement of Monteverde Bajo, which belongs to the district of Tambogrande. Marco lives in the rural area of the district, but he does have electricity.
Marco's business is raising small animals (sheep, pigs and corral poultry). When they reach the ideal weight and size, he sells them at the local market. He raises the animals in the back of his house. He also owns a plot of land of one hectare where he grows magoes and lemons. Besides, he rents out half an hectare for growing rice and corn. In addition, he works for the farms located in the settlement, and he receives a daily pay. He has five years' worth of experience in raising animals and farming. With the income he earns from these activities he can afford his own expenses as well as his family's.
Marco wishes to improve his family's living conditions. He has decided to fix up the front of his house and to purchase balanced feed for his animals as well as fertilizers for his lemon crop. In order to accomplish what he has set out to do, he decided to get a loan for 3000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to fix up the front of his house and to purchase balanced feed for his animals as well as fertilizers for his crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mary Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables and spices business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Mary Grace is borrowing 40000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional vegetables and spices to sell in her business.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 42 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school. 

Emma is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. Emma has been raising pigs for ten years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Merle requested a loan of 25000 PHP through NWTF to buy stocks of items like eggs, soft drinks, toothpaste, spices, etc. to sell in her general store. Merle has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Merle would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stocks of eggs, soft drinks, toothpaste, spices, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 40 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Rachel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soap, sugar, and coffee.

Rachel has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from raising livestock. Rachel aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soap, sugar, and coffee

loans.name: Diomary

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 36,750 pesos, Diomary ha podido comprar productos para el cuidado del pelo, así como zapatos y ropa interior de mujer para su salón de belleza y una pequeña tienda que tiene en éste. Ya Diomary tiene 6 años con su salón de belleza y con el paso del tiempo fue notando que sus clientas siempre buscaban quien les vendiera artículos y accesorios como los que ella vende, por lo que decidió aprovechar el espacio extra en el salón y el público cautivo que tenía en sus clientas e instalar una pequeña tienda donde ofrecer estos productos a las mismas.
Diomary es casada, su esposo es camarero en un restaurante. Tienen 3 hijas de 29,27 y 21 años. La mayor terminó sus estudios universitarios y las dos más pequeñas aún están estudiando. 
El deseo de Diomary es poder mudar el salón a un local más amplio, donde pueda tener más espacio para exhibir mejor la mercancía que vende en el mismo
texts.en:
With a 36,750 peso loan, Diomary has been able to buy hair care products as well as shoes and women’s underwear for her beauty salon and small store she has in it.  Diomary has 6 years’ experience with her beauty salon and as time went by she noticed that her customers were always looking for someone to sell them items and accessories like the ones she sells so she decided to use the extra space in her salon and the captive audience her clientele was to install a small store to sell them these products.  

Diomary is married and her husband is a hotel housekeeper.  They have three daughters who are 29, 27 and 21 years old.  The eldest completed her university studies and the two younger ones are still studying.  Diomary’s wish is to move the beauty salon to a more spacious location where she’ll have more space to better display the merchandise she sells there.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, shoes and underwear.

loans.name: Aurora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Aurora tiene 50 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hija menor de edad.  Vive junto a su familia en Nueva Arica, perteneciente a la Región Lambayeque.  Se encuentra ubicado a 1 hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
br>
Aurora desde hace 5 años se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos todo tipo de productos de consumo diario, siempre brindando una buena atención, con lo cual siempre se garantiza una buena acogida. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad son utilizados para sacar adelante a su familia y progresar juntos poco a poco.  Su esposo es trabajador jornalero, dedicándose a las labores agrícolas, esto le genera ingresos adicionales.

Aurora desea adquirir más mercadería para poder ampliar su nivel de venta y ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.
texts.en:
Aurora is 50 years old, lives with a partner, and has a young daughter. She lives together with her family in Nueva Arica, which belongs to the Lambayeque region. She is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past five years, Aurora has dedicated herself to the sale of basic necessities and groceries through a small shop in her house. She offers her neighbors all types of day-to-day products and always provides  to guarantee a good welcome. The income from this activity is used to move her family forward little by little. Her husband is a day laborer who dedicates himself to agricultural work. This generates additional income.

Aurora wishes to acquire merchandise so she can expand her sales and earnings. For this reason, she has found it helpful to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles to help achieve her goal.

loans.use: to buy basic necessities (rice, sugar, milk, noodles, etc)

loans.name: Eveling Del Socorro

texts.es:
Eveling del Carmen trabaja para una escuela pública en el municipio de la paz centro desde hace 12 años como profesora de primaria con lo que ha sacado adelante su familia quien la conforma ella y un hijo, es madre soltera brindándole estudio, alimentación y demás necesidades básicas de un hogar.

Actualmente solicita el segundo  crédito para mejoras de su casa de habitación, con la reparación del techo del cuarto, necesita conprar materiales de construccion como: zinc, perlines, clavos y pago de mano de obra, para darles una mejor condición de vida a su hijo. 
En la foto la señora Eveling esta impartiendo clase a sus alumnos quienes son niños de 10 a 12 años edad
texts.en:
Eveling del Carmen has worked for 12 years as an elementary schoolteacher for a public school in downtown La Paz. Throught her work she has gotten her family ahead. Her family is comprised of herself and a son; she's a single mother and provides him with education, food and other basic household necessities.
She currently requests her second loan for making improvements in her home, such as repairing the roof in the bedroom. She needs to buy construction supplies such as metal sheets, beams and nails, and to pay for labor. That way she can improve her son's living conditions.
In the photo, Eveling is with her class of students, who are children aged between 10 to 12.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as cement, bricks and metal sheets.

loans.name: Aldaida Nicolasa

texts.es:
Aldaida Nicolasa trabaja para una escuela pública en el municipio de la paz centro desde hace 27 años como profesora de primaria con lo que ha sacado adelante su familia quien la conforma ella y dos hijos brindándole estudio, alimentación y demás necesidades básicas de un hogar, es madre soltera.

solicita a ceprodel el segundo crédito para mejora de su casa de habitación con reparación del techo y separación de cuartos con la compra de zinc, cemento, ladrillos y pago de mano de obra para. sus sueños es tener un techo digno para ella y su familia.

En la foto la señora Aldaida sale con sus alumnos primaria impartiendo clase de educación física en la escuela donde ella trabaja
texts.en:
Aldaida Nicolasa has worked as an elementary school teacher in a public school in the town of La Paz Centro for 27 years to get her family ahead.  She's a single mother of two children, whom she has given an education, food, and the other basic necessities of a home.

She's requesting her second loan from CEPRODEL to buy corrugated metal, cement, and bricks, and to pay for labor to improve her house by repairing the roof and dividing the rooms.

Her dream is to have a decent roof for herself and her family.

In the photo, Aldaida is with her elementary students teaching a physical education class in the school where she works.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her house

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Трудное условие жизни заставляет человека направлять все свои усилия и мотивировать существующие ресурсы. Шахноза является одним из таких личностей, которая старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами.  Шахноза  решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес шитьем женской одежды, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  5000сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
A difficult living situation makes a person focus all their energy and use their existing resources.  Shahnoza is one of those people who tries to improve her living conditions and stimulate the economic state of her family.  She is married and has two children at home.  Her husband earns a small salary, which isn't enough to support the material needs of his family.  

Shahnoza decided to help her husband for the good of her family.  With this goal in mind, she attended the "Bring It On" course organized by the Association of Businesswomen and received a certificate.  Now she can really start a business and become successful in that sphere.  She wants to start a business sewing women's clothes, as she has experience in this type of work.  With the income she earns, she plans to provide her children with a good education and high-calorie food.  She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine so she can start her new business.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
This is Mary Ann, 41 and a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. Single, she manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Mary Ann operates a school/office supplies business. It is where one can buy school supplies like pens, bond paper, cartolina (heavy, colored paper) and the like without going to a bookstore. She gets the supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. She also has a variety store. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to purchase school supplies to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mary Ann dreams that her business will continue to grow through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of office and school supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his rice farm

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Remedios works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling footwear in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of footwear to sell. Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of footwear to sell

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.  Ruby has been in this business for 3 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Ruby has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is married and has two children. He is 29 years old and lives in Talairon, Oroquieta City. Leonardo is operating a general store, selling a variety of products to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for one year, and every month he earn PHP5,000 from this work. He has requested a loan of PHP18,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

In 2011, Leonardo joined GDMPC.  He hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Meyling Elieth

texts.es:
La señora Meyling Elieth es comerciante, Su negocio esta en Managua, Nicaragua, en el mismo tramo de su mama, su actividad venta de cosmético.
 Es casada, su esposo trabaja como conductor de equipo pesado, tienen un niño menor de edad, tienen casa propia son persona jóvenes con muchas ganas de superación y crecimiento en su negocio.

La actividad comercial a la que se dedica este cliente es venta de Cosméticos, solicita el financiamiento para  ingresar con un nuevo producto lo que es venta de ropa usada que tiene mucha demanda en la zona de San Rafael del sur.
Se siente muy bien trabajar con ceprodel  y kiva ya que son organismo que ayudan a los pequeños comerciante a salir adelante con su negocio e ir creciendo es su actividad comercial y así tener una mejor condición de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Meyling Elieth is a businesswoman. Her business is located in Managua, Nicaragua, and in the same section she has her business selling cosmetics.

She is married. Her husband works as a driver of heavy equipment. They have a son who is a minor. They have their own house. They are young people with a great desire to achieve and a desire for growth in her business.

The commercial activity in which she works is selling cosmetics. She is applying for the loan to begin with a new product, which is the sale of used clothing, for which there is much demand in the San Rafael del Sur area.

She feels very good to work with CEPRODEL and Kiva, since they are organizations that help small businesspeople to advance with their businesses and continue growing. With her commercial activity, she wants to have better living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy a bale of assorted used clothing to sell

loans.name: Flordelina

texts.en:
Flordelina is 62 years old, married and has nine children. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Flordelina requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Flordelina has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and she has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Flordelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Román

texts.en: Román (who is on the right in the photo, pictured with his wife, son and daughter)and his family have farmed the rolling plains of Tepeaca for generations. In recent years, rising energy and fertilizer costs have made it harder for their farm to generate a livable income. In order to reduce their expenses, Román will use a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to generate the energy required by his family. They will use renewable biogas in the kitchen and bathroom, to cook and to heat bath water, replacing their LP gas use. The biodigester will also convert their cow manure into a powerful fertilizer for use on their maize, beans, cilantro, and lettuce. This loan represents 52% of the total cost of Román's Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Poetas Group

texts.es: Guadalupe tiene 38 años de edad es originaria de un lugar lleno en riqueza histórica de México, también muy cerca de ahí se encuentra el santuario de la mariposa monarca donde año con año arriban las mariposas desde Canadá dando un espectáculo sin igual, se perfila como uno de los principales atractivos turísticos de Mexico al ofrecer bellos paisajes naturales, donde se respira un ambiente típico provinciano, donde se conservan tradiciones y costumbres y donde hay una gran variedad de gastronomía para deleitar al más exigente paladar. Lupita como de cariño le dicen es parte del grupo llamado Poetas, ella tiene un negocio de tortas desde hace un poco más de un año y dice que emprendió ese negocio para poder aportar algo a su hogar y que no le fuera tan difícil a su esposo apoyar a su hijo en su educación ya que estudia la secundaria y son gastos muy fuertes, tambien dice que lo puso para tener una actividad productiva donde ella se sintiera útil y es por eso que puso su torteria, ella esta pidiendo a Visión Fund un crédito para compara los insumos que le hacen falta en su negocio como, telera, mayonesa, crema, legumbres como aguacate, cebolla, jitomate, chiles en vinagre y un poco de refresco. Dice que si le hacen el crédito su negocio mejorara y asi podrá tener mejores ventas y eso la pone muy contenta ya que quiere mejorar para poder asi darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. La meta de Lupita es poner un lugar propio ya que donde vende es rentado y le cobran algo caro la renta por eso es que ella quiere un lugar propio. Los otros 12 integrantes del grupo se llaman Guadalupe, Rodrigo, Irma, Ricarda, Teresa, Eduardo, Beatriz, Elizabeth, María Alejandra, Pablo, Janet y Roberto ellos invertirán sus créditos en  material para estética, en refacciones para carro, en peletería, en productos de belleza por catalogo, en dulces y semillas para su venta, en frutas y legumbres de temporada para su venta, en ropa y zapatos por catalogo para su venta, etc.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 38 years old. She is originally from a place full of the rich history of Mexico. Also very close to there is the sanctuary of the monarch butterflies, where year after year the butterflies arrive from Canada, producing an unequaled spectacle.  Her area presents itself as one of the principal tourist attractions of Mexico, offering beautiful natural landscapes, where a typical provincial atmosphere can be experienced, where traditions and customs are preserved, and where there is a great variety of gastronomy to delight the most demanding palate. Lupita, as her friends call her, is part of the group called "Poetas" (Poets).

She has had a sandwich business for a little more than a year, and she says that she embarked on this business to be able to contribute something to her household and so that it would not be so difficult for her husband to support their son in his education, since he is in secondary school and the expenses are very substantial. She also says that she set up the business to have a productive activity where she would feel useful, and this is why she set up her sandwich shop. She is applying to Vision Fund for a loan to buy the ingredients that she needs in her business, such as rolls, mayonnaise, cream, vegetables such as avocados, onions, tomatoes, and peppers in vinegar, and some soda. She says that if she receives the loan, her business will improve and thus she will be able to have more sales, and this makes her very happy, since she wants to improve to thus be able to give her son a better quality of life. Lupita's goal is to set up her own location, since the place where she sells now is rented, and they charge her something dear for the rent. For this reason, she wants her own place. 

The other 12 members of the group are Guadalupe, Rodrigo, Irma, Ricarda, Teresa, Eduardo, Beatriz, Elizabeth, Maria Alejandra, Pablo, Janet, and Roberto. They will invest their loans in beauty products, car parts, fur production, catalog beauty products, sweets and seeds to sell, seasonal fruits and vegetables to sell, catalog clothing and shoes to sell, etc.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make sandwiches, such as rolls, mayonnaise, cream, vegetables such as avocados, onions, tomatoes, and chiles in vinegar, and some soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Union Y Amistad Group

texts.es: Marisol tiene 23 años de edad y está casada con José el cual trabaja en la industria de la construcción en la ciudad de México y tienen 2 niños; ella es parte del grupo "Unión y Amistad" y dice que le pusieron ese nombre a su grupo porque ellos son muy unidos y cuando alguien no puede hacer su pago ellos se ayudan entre sí para poder obtener su pago y no quedar mal. Desde hace mas de 4 años ella se dedica a vender ropa de bebe y ropa interior para dama así como también calcetas, tines para dama, dice que este negocio lo emprendió a raíz de que su suegra es partera y ella veía que las mujeres que llegaban de emergencia a consulta para que las apoyaran a dar a luz, no iban preparadas con ropa para el bebe y para ellas y no iban preparadas, entonces ella se le ocurrió empezar a vender ropa para bebes como cobijitas, pañales, calzoncitos, baberos, trajecitos para bebés, mamelucos, pañaleros, calcetitas y para dama pantaletas, pants, chamarras, calcetas, playeras, toallas sanitarias que ocupan cuando van a dar a luz, dice que le gusta mucho su negocio porque ella así puede estar al pendiente de sus pequeños niños y surte su ropa en la ciudad de Toluca y México en diferentes maquilas donde le dan precios mas bajos y así ella tiene mejores ganancia. Ella está pidiendo un crédito a Visión Fund para hacer crecer un poco  más su negocio y ya hasta vecinas de su comunidad van y le compran calcetas para la escuela de sus hijos, dice Marisol “me gusta lo que vendo por que así puedo aportar con algo y puedo comprarle lo que yo quiera a mis hijos y así ayudarle a mi esposo con los gastos, también estoy contenta por pertenecer a esta empresa ya que tengo varios ciclos trabajando y siempre nos tratan muy bien y es la que más bajos intereses tiene”. Los otros siete integrantes del grupo se llaman Lidia, Ofelia, Fabián, Gilberta, Sandra y Juan Carlos ellos invertirán en insumos para hacer diferentes platillos  para venderlos en cooperativa escolar, en la compra de material quirúrgico y medicina para su venta, para la compra de alimento y borregos, para la compra de abonos y plantas de durazno y aguacate para cultivo y para la compra de frutas y legumbres de temporada para su venta.
texts.en:
Marisol is 23 years old and married to José, and they have two children. He works in the construction industry in Mexico City. 

She is part of the group Union y Amistad [Unity and Friendship] and says that they chose this name for their group because they are very united, and when someone can't make their payment, they help each other to be able to get the payment and not lose face. 

For more than four years she has been selling baby clothing and women's underwear, as well as stockings and women's socks. She says that this business took root when she saw that the women who come to her mother-in-law, who is a midwife, for an emergency consultation for help giving birth, they didn't come prepared with clothing for the baby or for themselves. They weren't ready. So it occurred to her to start selling baby clothing like small blankets, diapers, pants, bibs, baby outfits, rompers, and socks, and women's panties, pants, jackets, shoes and sanitary napkins that are used when they're going to give birth. She says that she likes her job a lot, because this way she can be devoted to her small children. 

She stocks up on clothing in the cities of Toluca and Mexico in different stores where they give her lower prices, so she makes a better profit. 

She is requesting a loan from Visión Fund in order to grow her business a little more, and already even neighbors from her community come and buy socks for their children's school from her. Marisol says, "I like what I sell because this way I can contribute something and I can buy what I want for my children, and help my husband with the bills. Also I'm happy to belong to this group and already I have done several cycles; they always treat us very well and have the lowest interest rates." 

The other six members of the group are Lidia, Ofelia, Fabián, Gilberta, Sandra and Juan Carlos. They will invest in goods for different purposes: to sell in a school store; in the purchase of surgical material and medicine for sale; for the purchase of feed and lambs; for the purchase of fertilizer and peach and avocado plants to grow; and for the purchase of seasonal fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes like little blankets, diapers, pants, bibs, baby outfits, rompers, and socks, and women's panties, pants, jackets, socks, shoes and sanitary napkins.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is married and has a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now, and works hard to support her family. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell such as biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, milk, etc. In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell such as biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en: Ginalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her business. NWTF is relisting Ginalyn's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 48 years old and married. She has four children, two of whom are in school, Sally works very hard to provide for them.

Sally runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, noodles, groceries, etc. in her general store. She has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future, Sally would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, noodles, groceries, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia, 60, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Homer, a businessman, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Alicia operates a billiard pool table business. She has it for rental and payment is Php 50 per hour. She also has a tricycle and a boarding house for extra income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 900 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies and for operational needs of her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Alicia dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to have another tricycle. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for supplies and operational needs of her billiard pool business.

loans.name: San Miguel Arcangel (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Don  Gonzalo  es integrante del grupo San Miguel Arcángel, es casado con la señora Sara, ello ya tienen treinta años de casados y tienen un hijo  quien  estudia la secundaria y viven en una comunidad llamada "El Carmen" es un lugar muy angosto de camino y se entra caminando.
 
  A "don Chalo", como le nombran en su  comunidad, invertirá el préstamo  en la compra y venta de ganado como son vacas  y becerros en donde lleva trabajando  diez años y seis meses, también se dedica al campo a sembrar  maíz y frijol en las temporada en la que le da muy buenos resultados.

  Desde muy joven comenta que su papá le enseño a trabajar en el campo  por lo tanto cuando se casó dice que ya sabía su  responsabilidad de formar un hogar en el que sería muy feliz y ahora se siente muy agradecido con dios por la familia que le ha regalado.
 
  Lo que más desea de su negocio es que con el tiempo el pueda seguir trabajando apara apoyar a su hijo con sus estudios como también comprar un carro para poder transportar el ganado que compra y posteriormente  vuelve a venderlo.

   En este grupo se integra la señora: María del Socorro quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra café por grano molerlo y posteriormente venderlo  por kilo, la señora Romelia  invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes como son: huevo, aceite, y polvillos para la elaboración de marquesote y por último la señora  Yesenia Guadalupe invertirá en la compra de  frutas y legumbres.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is a member of the “San Miguel Arcángel” (St. Michael the Archangel) group.  He’s been married to Sara for 30 years and they have a son attending secondary school.  They live in a community called “El Carmen” which is a place with a very narrow access road; one must reach it by foot. 

“Don Chalo,” as he’s known in his community, will use the loan to buy and sell cattle like cows and calves.  He’s been in this business ten and a half years.  He also works in agriculture growing corn and beans in the season that produces very good results.

He comments that his father taught him to work in the fields when he was still a boy so that when he got married he already knew that he’d be responsible for forming a home where he’d be very happy.  He’s very grateful to God now for the family He’s given him.  What he most wants from his business is that in time he’ll be able to continue working to support his son with his schooling as well as to buy a vehicle to transport the cattle he buys and then to resell.

The other group members are María del Socorro who will use the loan to buy whole coffee beans to grind and then sell by the kilo, Romelia who will use the loan to buy ingredients like eggs, oil and baking powder to make ‘marquesote’ [traditional sweet bread] and lastly, Yesenia Guadalupe who will use the loan to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy cows and calves.

loans.name: Jovis

texts.en: Jovis is 37 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and a mother of three children. Jovis owns and operates a carpentry shop. She has a cabinet-making business with her husband. They make cabinets from wood, wardrobes, dressers, and storage chests. She has been in this business for seven years and earns PHP 10,000 per month from this business. Jovis has requested a loan of 14,000 at GDMPC to purchase materials for cabinet making. Jovis been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Jovis hopes to gain more profit from this business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for cabinet making.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es:
Don Alexis tiene 40 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una aldea de Peña Blanca, Cortes.
Don Alexis siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, tiene 20 años de cultivar café, el cual  lo vende el café en pergamino en el mercado local.
El esta solicitando un préstamo de 15,000 lempiras para compra de fertilizante y semillas para la siembra de viveros de café, ya que con esto aumentara sus cultivos y así podrá obtener una mejora en sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Don Alexis is 40 years old, married, and has three children.  He lives in the neighborhood of Peña Blanca, Cortes.  

Don Alexis has always been a farmer.  He has been growing coffee for 20 years and sells the coffee in its parchment at the local market.  Don Alexis is requesting a loan of 15,000 HNL so that he can buy fertilizers and seeds to begin planting his coffee nursery.  This will increase the number of plants so that he can generate better earnings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and coffee seeds.

loans.name: Sherlinda

texts.en:
Sherlinda is 51 years old, married, and has three children. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Sherlinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Sherlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 27 years old and is married.  She has two children between 2 and 5 years old. Her business is well organized, and she sells shoes. She has five years in this business and she works from 7 a.m to 6 p.m every day except on Sunday.

Francine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders through Vision Finance Company in order to buy more shoes for resale. With the profit from this loan, she will be able to reinvest in her business and she will be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Wilbroad

texts.en:
Wilbroad is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala South region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, he has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells soft drinks like sodas and beer. 

To help expand his business, Wilbroad has requested a loan of 2500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sodas and beer for resale, and will help Wilbroad to generate greater profits and expand his business. He hopes that in the future he will be able to become a wholesaler. 

Wilbroad is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Wilbroad who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sodas and beer for resale.

loans.name: Matza (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama matza y se integra de tres señoras quien cada una  tiene su actividad y vive en un pueblo llamado  ocotepec.  En donde celebran la fiesta de santo domingo en el mes de abril.

   La señora María Neria, es quien se le tomo le entrevista, tiene 29 años de edad, estudió  hasta el tercero de preparatoria  y  es la hija número cinco de sus padres. Está casada con el señor  Misael con quien  procreo tres hijos y que están a su responsabilidad.
 

Ella solicito el préstamo en fundación realidad para trabajarlo,  en la compra y venta de dulces de caramelos, en donde lleva trabajando  dos años  y seis meses en la que comenta que le va bien yaqué con ello,  logra cubrir algunos gasto que se generan es su hogar y con el apoyo de su  es poso don Misael es mucho mejor.

   Inicio con esta actividad para dedicar su tiempo libre y estar al pendiente de su familia y porque desde muy pequeña le gusta trabajar y  ayudar en su casa, desde que se caso es muy feliz ya que  su esposo la ayuda en seguir trabajando.

   Doña  segunda invertirá el préstamo en la compra de  insumos para la elaboración de tortillas y la señora Noemí  invertirá en la compra y venta de ropas como son: pantalones, playeras, camisas, entre otros.
texts.en:
The group is called “Matza” and it’s composed of three women each with her own activity.  They live in a town called Ocotepec where the feast day of Saint Dominick is celebrated in April.  María Neria was interviewed.  She is 29 years old.  She finished high-school and is her parents’ fifth daughter.  She’s married to Misael with whom she has three children who are still in her care.

She requested a loan from Fundación Realidad to use in her business buying and selling caramel candy; she’s been in business two and a half years and she comments that she does well because she’s able to cover some of her household expenses with income earned from it and with support from her husband, Misael, it’s even better.

She started this activity in order to do something with her free time while still watching over her family because she’s liked to work and help out at home since she was little.  She’s been very happy since getting married because her husband helps her continue to work.

Segunda will use the loan to buy ingredients to make tortillas and Noemí will use it to buy clothes like pants, t-shirts and shirts, among others to sell.

loans.use: to buy caramel candies.

loans.name: El Limon (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se integra en un lugar llamado el paraje ajilho en donde todas las personas que viven en dicho lugar son de una sola religión en la que  celebran la fiesta del santísimo  san Andrés en el mes de noviembre.

     Quien se le tomo la entre vista se llama María  quien tiene veinti cuatro años de edad  es casada con el señor Eduardo  de la edad de veinti ocho años, el es campesino  y a su responsabilidad tiene a  tres hijos y son: Jorge Antonio de ocho años, Erika Araceli  de de seis años y Héctor Eduardo  de un año y un mes.

    Ella es ama de casa y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra y venta de mantas bordas en donde lleva trabajando  diez años,  y comenta que le va bien ya qué con ello, sus ingresos han mejorado mucho y como también de  pequeña ella lo bien trabajando no  se le hace difícil ganar sus propios ingresos y sostener a su familia.

   Platica que aprendió a bordar desde pequeña  ya que su madre también se dedica a lo  mismo  y es con ello que las mujeres de ese lugar sacan adelante a su familia.
 
  Lo que más desea de su actividad es poder seguir adelante y en las ganancias que ella vaya obtenido comprar una máquina para costurar las blusas.

  Las personas que integran en el grupo el limón son: doña Juana quien se dedica a costura blusas de mantas, la señora Candelaria invertirá en la compra de mantas para bordar blusas y la señora  Manuela  invertirá en la compra de hilos, manta para poder bordar y elaborar las blusas de mantas.
texts.en:
This group is from a place called Paraje Ajilho where everyone in the community belongs to the same religion and where the feast day of Saint Andrew is celebrated in November.  María was interviewed.  She’s 24-years-old and married to Eduardo, 28, who is a farmer.  They have three dependent children: Jorge Antonio, 8, Erika Araceli, 6, and 13-month-old Héctor Eduardo.

She is a housewife who requested the loan to buy unbleached cotton to embroider.  She’s been doing this work for ten years and comments that she does very well with it.  Her income has improved very much.  Since she’s worked since she was little it’s not difficult for her to earn her own income and support her family.  She relates that she learned to embroider when she was little because her mother also is in the same occupation; this is how women in this community support their families.  What she wants most from her activity is to be able to continue forward and to use profits she earns to buy a machine to sew the blouses.

The people who make up this group are: Juana who sews unbleached cotton blouses, Candelaria who will buy unbleached cotton to embroider blouses and Manuela who will buy thread, unbleached cotton to embroider and make unbleached cotton blouses.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread to embroider.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel is from Upper Loboc, Oroquieta. He is 57 years old and is married. He operates a specialized retail store selling SIM packs and pre-paid cell phone credits, through which he earns 3,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Gabriel joined GDMPC, and he is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more cell phone products and credits to resell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase cell phone products and credits to resell.

loans.name: Dorcy

texts.en:
This is Dorcy. She previously accessed a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Dorcy dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en: Rovelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of vegetables and spices. She has been in this business for 6 years, and earns additional income from a general store. Rovelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of her loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is from Eastern Poblacion, Lopez Jaena. She is 37 years old, married and has 5 children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a furniture manufacturing business. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns 16,000 PHP a month. Recently Josephine joined GDMPC, and she is now requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture new products and to pay for the cost of labor. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture new products and to pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 42 year old carpenter. He is married to Sarah, a mixed crop farmer, and they are blessed with 3 children. Julius has been in the carpentry business, with a secondary motorcycle transport business, for the past eleven years, and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to the organization by an existing KADET customer. Julius will use most of the money to buy more carpentry materials like timber and saws, and KES 5,000 will go toward fertilizer and seedlings for the farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will start dairy farming. His hopes and dreams are to educate his children, buy a piece of land, and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more carpentry materials like timber and saws, as well as fertilizer and seedlings for the farm.

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of four children, Rosina works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling fresh coconuts in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Rosina is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase more fresh coconuts to sell to customers.

Rosina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred is a 50 year old businesswoman. She is married to Johnson, who is a businessman, and they are blessed with two children. Winfred has been running a boutique business for the past ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. She will use the money to buy additional stock of new clothes. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to start a pig rearing business and to own a big boutique shop.

loans.use: To buy new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 52 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Vicenta runs an ambulant shop, vending grocery items in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 15000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, such as soap, shampoo, spices, canned goods, sugar, and milk. Vicenta has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Vicenta would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, such as soap, shampoo, spices, canned goods, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Segundo Octavio

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 34 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en una de las zonas marginales que conforman la zona de Lambayeque, una zona de mediano movimiento comercial situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Adicionalmente prepara y vente chicha de jora (bebida típica de la región preparada en base a maíz)junto a su esposa. Los ingresos que le proveen estas actividades le sirven para solventar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a sus menores hijos.

Segundo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de más animales y alimento para implementar su negocio, asimismo realizará mejoras en sus corrales y adquirirá insumos para seguir elaborando chicha. Gracias a este préstamo podrá agenciarse de más ingresos y salir adelante.

Segundo es una persona bastante entregada a su familia. Las personas que le conocen y sus vecinos le tienen mucha estima y respeto.
texts.en:
Segundo is 34 years old, is married, and lives together with his wife and their two children in one of the outlying zones that are part of Lambayeque, an area of average commercial traffic situated twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  

He works raising and selling small animals in corrals located in the back of his home.  He also prepares and sells chicha de jora (a typical Peruvian drink from the region prepared from a corn base) together with his wife.  The income that they receive from these activities help them to pay their expenses and to help their young children get ahead.  

Segundo is asking for a loan of 1200 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) from Edpyme Alternativa, a Kiva field partner.  He plans to use the loan to purchase more animals and feed in order to supply his business.  He will also make improvements to the corrals and will purchase ingredients in order to continue making chicha.  Thanks to this loan he will be able to make better income and move forward.

Segundo is very committed to his family.  People who know him and his neighbors have great respect and esteem for him.

loans.use: to purchase more animals and feed in order to supply his business.  He will also make improvements to the corrals and will purchase ingredients in order to continue making chicha.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 57 years old, a widow, and the mother of 3 children. She lives in Kahayagan, Kapatagan, where she has earned a living for the last 20 years by selling home and used products. She makes 6,000 PHP a month.

Elma is applying for a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee to sell in her store. 

Elma joined GDMPC in 2010 as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Sandy

texts.en:
This is Sandy, 35, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Jane, a housewife, and is a father to his children. He, together with his wife, manages his own business to be able to sustain their everyday expenses.

Sandy operates a tailoring business. He mainly offers uniforms and shirts. He also does repairs and alterations. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 200 Php (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and newspapers for patterns. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Sandy dreams to be able to give his children a good and high quality education through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials like thread, fabric and other things needed in his tailoring business.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 43 years old and lives in the town of Nebbi, in the Arua region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 5 children, with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Salome has been working hard to manage her small second-hand business, which sells clothing for children and adults. 

To help expand her business, Salome has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bails of different types of clothing, and will help Salome to generate greater profits and get her other children in school. Salome hopes that in the future she will be able to buy more clothing in all sizes. 

Salome is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Salome who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more bails of different types of clothing for children and adults.

loans.name: Juana Herenia

texts.es:
Juana es una madre de familia de 46 años de edad que reside junto a su hijo de 12 años de edad en unos de los centros poblados que conforman el distrito agrícola de Mocupe, situado a cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y a la crianza de animales menores en su domicilio. Estos ingresos le permiten sacar adelante a su menor hijo y solventar los gastos de su familia. En la zona, su buen trato al momento de atender a sus clientes le han hecho bastante conocida, además, dado que en donde reside no hay muchos centros de abasto de productos de primera necesidad, su negocio siempre cuenta con clientela estable.

Juana desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más mercadería como arroz, verduras y abarrotes, de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ingresos, ofreciéndole a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante honrada y responsable. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Juana is a 46 year old mother who lives together with her 12 year old son in a rural center in the agricultural district of Mocupe, located 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She works selling groceries and raising small animals in her home.  This income allows her to help her youngest child get ahead and to pay for family expenses.  In the zone, her good customer service has made her quite well known, and also since where she lives there are not many general stores, her business always has a stable client base.

Juana wants to grow her business by purchasing more merchandise like rice, vegetables, and snacks.  In this way she can increase her sales and make more money, offering her customers a greater variety of products.  For that reason she has thought it convenient to ask for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa.  

She is a trustworthy and responsible woman.  Previously she has had loans with Adpyme Alternativa and she has demonstrated her punctuality in her payments.

loans.use: to grow her business by purchasing more merchandise like rice, vegetables, and snacks.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is from Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 61 years old, married and has 10 children. Eufemia manufactures and sells bamboo products such as "banig" and "dingding" (floor and wall mats) to local businesses and community members. Eufemia has been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month from it. 

In 2007, Eufemia joined GDMPC. Eufemia is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business

loans.name: Carme

texts.en:
This is Carme, 43, a resident of Manila, in the Philippines. His wife is Liberty, a midwife. Together with his wife, Carme manages their household while operating a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns a profit by purchasing inventory at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house, and his regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 350 PHP in sales each day. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his family’s everyday expenses.

To help him continue operating his business, Carme is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. He will use the money to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages that will expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his income as he expands his business. He hopes to be able to expand further in the near future. He faithfully meets with his fellowship* co-members to share stories of his work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages that will expand his product inventory

loans.name: Miklon

texts.en:
Miklon, 19, is still single and is living with his parent. His father, Oce, 65 is a retiree. Since the retirement of his father, their family income was decreased as the pension received is smaller than the salary while Miklon still has 2 siblings who are still attending school. 

After graduated from senior high school, Miklon decided to work as a motor taxi driver and livestock seller to support his parent in meeting their family needs. The livestock market is only operated once a week. With the limited capital that he has, Miklon is only able to sell 1 pig or goat from a local farmer and resell it at the livestock market.

Miklon would like to sell more livestock and therefore requested a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. He hopes that that the loan would help him improve the business.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock i.e goat, pig etc

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane has been engaged in gardening for a long time. With her younger son’s and husband’s help, she cultivates corn for sale;  they also grow cucumbers, tomatoes, haricots, Oriental persimmons and apples for their family’s use. 

Gayane and her family intend to develop their gardening and start to grow apples and Oriental persimmons for sale as well. This will allow them to increase their family’s income in the future.

Gayane is seeking an 800.000 AMD loan to lay out an apple and Oriental persimmon garden.
   
Gayane lives in Sarigyugh village, Tavush region. She graduated from Yerevan State University, and she works as a physics teacher at the village school. Gayane is married and she has three children. Her elder children are married and they live separately from their parents. Gayane’s younger son graduated from Yerevan State University, but now he is jobless and he helps his parents with gardening. Gayane’s husband works as an inspector at State Inspectorate of Environmental Protection.

loans.use: to lay out an apple and Oriental persimmon garden

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. Wilma is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Wilma requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, soap, canned goods, soft drinks, spices, etc..

Wilma has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, soap, canned goods, soft drinks, spices, etc.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 54 years old, married, and has six children. He lives in the town of Kaloleni, a place that is known for being a commercial area and having people who are hardworking and responsible.
Josphat has a convenience store in his home where he sells basic grains, vegetables, sodas, juices, and sauces to his neighbors on a cash basis. His convenience store is located in his home and he has been in business for three years. 
He will invest his loan in merchandise so that he can restock his store with basic home products like rice, beans, flour, sodas, etc.  He is grateful for the hearts of Kiva lenders who provide assistance to people with limited resources so that they can earn a decent living and provide better living conditions for their families.

loans.use: to restock his store with basic home products like rice, beans, flour, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 42-year-old businessman. He is still selling second hand clothes in an open air market, which he has been doing for the past ten years. He used the previous loan well; he bought second hand clothes, farm manure and seedlings. He is glad both businesses are doing well and he made profit out of it.

He is applying for his fourth loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Peter will use the loan to buy more stock of second hand clothes. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children and start banana farming.

His hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop and improve his family living standard.

loans.use: To add more stock of second hand clothes

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
The desire to overcome and succeed is one of the dreams of this young 45-year old woman who lives with her family. She has a shop where she sells household goods like basic flour, detergents, milk, sweets, etc. Thanks for the last loan that helped her make improvements in her home and also her business. The shop is well-known in the neighborhood, and it has a clientele that likes the quality products, good prices, and excellent service. 

Kanze is a hard worker and is dedicated to working every day to build a better future away from the violence of the neighborhood where she resides. She does her best every day because she is happy with her work, and she does not want to disappoint her family. Kanze is requesting a new loan to increase inventory in her store. She will buy maize and wheat flour, sugar, grains, sweets, noodles, etc.

loans.use: to buy maize and wheat flour, sugar, grains, sweets, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy various goods such as: lotions, soaps, biscuits, sugar, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 56-year-old business lady.  She is a widow and has three adult children. She has been selling second hand clothes for the past twelve years, and earns a monthly income of KES. 20,000,  which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET LTD staff member. Beatrice will use the loan to buy more stock of second hand clothes for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will take good care of her children, and buy a dairy cow. Her hopes and dreams are to be able to sustain her family financially.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 66 years old and a business man. He is married to Elizabeth, a mixed crop farmer. They are blessed with two adult children. He has been running an agro vet business for the past six years, earning a monthly income of 30,000 KES, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his fifth loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Philip will use the new loan to buy more stocks of seedlings and agro chemicals to resell. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children and invest in farming. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and be a leading agro vet outlet in Matuu Town, in the eastern part of Kenya.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and agro chemicals to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different styles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 44 years old, married, and has six children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Elena has a fishing business in the Philippines. Elena requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF, to buy a fishing net and a new engine for her fishing.

Elena has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so that, in the future, she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and a new engine for her fishing.

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus has been in business, selling spare parts, for the past nine years.  He earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Onesmus will use the new loan to buy more stocks of spare parts to resell. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business by buying spare parts in large quantities, and to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to resell.

loans.name: Lemcel

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Lemcel works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income raising pigs. Lemcel is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy bamboo and fishing net for her fishing business.

Lemcel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bamboo and fishing net for her fishing business

loans.name: Eufemio

texts.en:
This is Eufemio. He previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that he used to purchase hogs and feed needed for his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his child and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for him to buy additional hogs and feeds needed in his business. His profits from the business will definitely help him sustain his daily needs and educational expenses of his child. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Eufemio dreams to give his family a good future. He also dreams that his child will finish his education. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feed and hogs needed in his business.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 36 years old and lives in the town of Nebbi in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past two years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells soft drinks, spirits and beer. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add valuable goods like soft drinks, spirits and beer to the business, and will help Godfrey to generate greater profits and bring more variety of drinks. Godfrey hopes that in the future he will be able to maintain his standard of business. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to add valuable goods like soft drinks, spirits and beer to the business

loans.name: Rosa Evelia

texts.es: Rosa Evelia de treinta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida; Ella se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y a la crianza y venta de pollos  tiene cinco años de trabajar en el rubro  y ha ganado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el terreno donde cultiva es de alta incidencia agrícola y esta muy cercano a su vivienda muy accesible para trabajar, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque siempre posee lo que necesitan, con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Rosa es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica y luchadora, todos los días se levanta dispuesta a lograr sus objetivos, se esfuerza al máximo pues sabe que así alcanzara el éxito que desea, en la ultima temporada no pudo obtener las ganancias esperadas por eso quiere recuperarse y realizar una nueva inversión para ello le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar pollos, semilla de maíz, insecticida, herbicida, herramienta, etc. Rosa Evelia tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa Evelia, 37 years old, lives with her life partner. She makes a living growing corn, as well as raising and selling chickens. She has been working in this area for five years, and her experience has taught her how to make the work more profitable. The land that Rosa cultivates is high-yielding and is located very close to her home, making it an easily accessible place to work. Rosa does business in all parts of her community and she already has some loyal customers that prefer buying from her because she is always able to supply what they need. She always offers quality products at competitive prices, with excellent service. 

Rosa is very dedicated, she is energetic and hardworking. Every day she gets up ready to meet her goals and do all that she can to achieve the success she desires. In the last growing season, she was not able to achieve the earnings she hoped to, so now she is looking to make up for that and invest again in her business. Rosa is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy chickens, corn seeds, insecticide, weedkiller, tools, etc. She has good payment references and assures that she can pay off her debt. She has faith that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: chickens, corn seeds, insecticide, and weedkiller.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a 22-year-old business lady.  She is married to Cleophus, a business man. They are blessed with two children. She has been running a green grocer business for the past three years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,500, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced to KADET by an existing KADET client member. Tabitha will use the loan to buy vegetables and fruits to sell in her business.  

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her grocery store and provide her family with better future.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits to sell in her business.

loans.name: Wishes Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 28-year-old Bridget from Mutare. She is married with two children, one attending school. She also cares for one dependent. Bridget runs an agriculture business producing mainly poultry, but also clothing. She says the main challenge she faces is customers do not always pay on time, especially in mid-month. Bridget has requested a loan of 400 USD to buy additional stock for the business. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve general family welfare. In the future Bridget plans to have her own shop.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for their business

loans.name: Tiger Group

texts.en: This is 48-year-old Mavis from Mutare, the capital of Minicaland province in Zimbabwe. She is married with six children, two attending school. She also cares for two dependents. Mavis runs a food business selling dried and fresh fish. She says the main challenges faced are fresh fish is perishable and it is difficult at times to sell it before it goes bad. Mavis has requested a loan of $400 to purchase fresh fish and dried fish from Kariba for resale in Mutare. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the family's general welfare. In the future Mavis plans to become a supplier to major shops.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish and dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Baasandemberel

texts.en:
Baasandemberel is 41 years old. She lives with her husband, two daughters, and younger son in a small house in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar. Her husband, Tsedevvanchig, is 42 years old and manages a transportation service business. Her oldest daughter goes to university, and her two other children attend secondary school. 

Baasandemberel started her business, selling coal and firewood, in 2006. She buys her goods from Nalaikh district, where there is coal mining and the price for coal is a lot lower than in the capital city. Her business is stable. She has built close relationships with her customers, and is popular because of her welcoming and friendly manner. 

She is asking for 2,500,000 MNT to cover her daughter's university tuition fees. She is a hard-working, diligent, and friendly woman.

loans.use: to cover her daughter's university tuition fees

loans.name: Fatina

texts.en:
Fatina is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the region surrounding Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 4 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 8 years, Fatina has been working hard to manage her Irish potato business, which sells Irish potatoes wholesale. 

To help expand her business, Fatina has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more Irish potatoes for resale, and will help Fatina to generate greater profits and increase her earnings. Fatina hopes that in the future she will be able to have more storage room for the potatoes.
