Fatina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fatina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more Irish potatoes for resale

loans.name: Rose Of Sharon Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 29-year-old Paida from Mutare. She is single with two children, one attending school. She also cares for one dependent. Paida runs a manufacturing business producing coffins. The business has been in operation for 6 years. She says the main challenge faced is difficulty in collecting credit sales. Paida has requested a loan of $400 to purchase material to produce coffins. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of the family. In the future, Paida plans to open her own shop.

loans.use: to buy material to produce coffins

loans.name: Tatenda Stars Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 44-year-old Emma from Mutare. She is married with two children. Emma runs an agriculture business producing poultry. The business has been in operation for 13 years. She says the main challenge faced is difficulty in collecting credit sales, especially mid-month. Emma has requested a loan of $400 to purchase more poultry stock. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of the family. In the future Emma plans to open her own shop and buy a truck for the business.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry stock

loans.name: Nenyasha Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! Forty-four-year-old Judith, from Mutare, is married and has four children, three of them attending school. She cares for three additional dependents. 

Judith runs a food business, producing peanut butter. The business has been in operation for one year. Judith says the main challenge she faces is stiff competition from other peanut butter producers. Judith has requested a loan of $400 to purchase more peanuts for making peanut butter. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve general family welfare. 

Judith plans to expand the business, and to purchase a car for making deliveries of her product, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more peanuts for making peanut butter

loans.name: Better Woman Group

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Sibusisi from Mutare, the capital of Minicaland province in Zimbabwe. She is married with three children, one attending school.  Sibusisi runs a business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for just over 1 year. She says the main challenges faced are lost payments from customers who didn't pay her in full. Sibusisi has requested a loan of $400 to purchase clothes in Harare for resale in Mutare. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to help buy her a stand from which she can sell clothes.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Step Up Woman Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 33-year-old Saliwe from Mutare. She is married with two children, both attending school. Saliwe runs a retail business selling kitchenware. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenge faced is lost payments from customers who don't pay. Saliwe has requested a loan of $400 to purchase a greater variety of kitchenware products. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to move into her own stand. In the future, Saliwe plans to expand into buying and selling kitchen machinery.

loans.use: to purchase kitchenware products for resale

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is a 36-year-old business man, married to Esther, a business lady. They are blessed with three children. He has been selling cereals for the past one year, earning a monthly income of 13,000 KES, which he used to support his family. 

He is applying for his second business loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Raphael will use the loan to buy bags of dried maize, beans and wheat to resell. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. 

Raphael's hopes and dreams are to expand his business and improve the family's living standard.

loans.use: To buy bags of dried maize, beans and wheat

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
This is Felix. He previously accessed a 17,000 PHP loan that he used to buy frozen products needed for his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children, as well as for their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Felix would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy more frozen food for his business. Displaying more items at the store will result in better profits. The profits from his business will help him sustain his family's daily needs and provide educational expenses for his children. He looks forward to the financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Felix dreams of being able to give all of his children access to a high quality education through his hard work. He also hopes to have his family and community with him as he continues to serve the Lord Almighty through his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for processed and frozen meat products for his business.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is 49 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the south region of Kampala, Uganda. He is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past six years, Jacob has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells soda, beer and spirits. 

To help expand his business, Jacob has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock of soda, beer and spirits and will help Jacob to generate greater profits and increase his income. Jacob hopes that in the future he will be able to open a hardware store. 

Jacob is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jacob who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soda, beer and spirits to sell at his bar

loans.name: Aems

texts.en:
Aems is 41 years old and lives in the town of Arua Hill in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has six children with two of them currently in school. For the past five years, Aems has been working hard to manage his clothes shop, where he sells clothes and shoes. 

To help expand his business, Aems has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and shoes that will increase his capital, and help Aems generate greater profits and expand his business. Aems hopes that in the future he will be able to be self-employed. 

Aems is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aems who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes to increase his capital.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kireka, in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has four children; two of the children are currently in school. For the past six years, Frank has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, maize flour, and cooking oil. 

In order to help expand his business, Frank has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. He will use the loan to buy more stock, such as cooking oil, sugar, and maize flour, to resell in his business.  This use of the loan will help Frank to generate greater profits with his business. Frank hopes that in the future he will be able to open a bigger business. 

Frank is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Frank, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more stock, such as cooking oil, sugar, and maize flour, to resell in his business

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 40-year-old businessman. He is married to Nelius, a businesswoman. They are blessed with two children. He has been running an auto spare parts business for the past ten years, with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his third loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Wilson will use the loan to buy more stock of spare auto parts for his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and improve the family living standards.

loans.use: To buy spare auto parts

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 48 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children, with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 8 years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his poultry farm, where he raises chickens. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more poultry products to sell and will help Joseph to generate greater profits and increase on his source of income. Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to hopes to open a wholesale business. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry products to sell

loans.name: Chiedza Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is the Chiedza Group. 43 year old Lizzie from Mutare is a member of the group. She is married with three children, all of whom are attending school. She also cares for three other dependents. Lizzie runs a clothing business but also has a side-business in poultry. She says the main challenges faced are high customs duties at the border as well as unreliable electric supply. Lizzie has requested a loan of $400 to purchase material for sewing clothes. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's general welfare. In the future Lizzie plans to have more than one boutique shop.

loans.use: to purchase material for sewing clothes

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a 22 years old business man. He is single and he supports his parents. He has been running a barber shop for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 4,800; which he uses to cater for his basic needs and support his parents when needs arises. 

He is applying for his second loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Jacob will use the loan to buy a shaving machine. 

He will plough the anticipated profit back into the business. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy a shaving machine for his barber shop.

loans.name: Qrusum

texts.en:
Qrusum is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, whom are all currently in school. For the past seven years, Qrusum has been working hard to manage her boutique, in which she sells shoes and clothes. 

To help expand her business, Qrusum has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and shoes to sell, and help Qrusum generate greater profits to pay for her children's school fees. Qrusum hopes that in the future she will be able to open a poultry farm. 

Qrusum is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Qrusum who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama, 53, lives with her common-law husband and their children in the rural area of Kaloleni.

She has been selling charcoal at the market for five years. She is satisfied with this way of earning an income to contribute to her household finances. She is currently requesting a loan of 50,000 KES, which she plans to invest in the purchase of more sacks of charcoal to sell.

With the investment she will make, Dama hopes to satisfy the demands of her customers, increase her sales, and improve her earnings so that she can have economic growth.

loans.use: to purchase of sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Leonora

texts.en:
Ma. Leonora, 39 years old, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Santiago, a heavy equipment operator, and is a mother. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Ma. Leonora oversees operations of their jeepney transportation business (please see footnote). She has a one unit jeepney (14-16 person capacity), which is paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 PHP every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ma. Leonora dreams to expand her business and hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

- Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seat jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy enough for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, jeepneys are one of the things that make the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and maintain her jeepney

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a 36-year-old businesswoman who is married to Mwendwa, a businessman. They are blessed with two children. She has been selling fruits and phone chargers for the past five years, generating a monthly income of KES 3,800 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her second loan from KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Juliana will use the loan to buy phone accessories and fresh fruits to sell. She will invest the anticipated profit from the sales back into the business. 

Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business, educate her children and improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories and fresh fruits to resell

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is 39 years old and lives in the town of Najera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Gideon has been working hard to manage his small business, which makes bricks. 

To help expand his business, Gideon has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more firewood that will be used for baking bricks and to expand his business. This will help Gideon generate greater profits and increase his income. Gideon hopes that in the future he will be able to open other related businesses. 

Gideon is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gideon who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more firewood that will be used for baking bricks and to expand his business

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda is 35 years old. She is married and she has six dependent children. She lives in the Coast Province, Kenya. She runs a general store in her house, where she sells daily consumable products in small quantities, such as rice, sugar, oil, soap, coffee bags, shampoo and others.

Mwenda also has a store where she sells charcoal. She has started this activity to have a job to help paying for her household expenses. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her working capital and stock up her general store in order to satisfy her customers’ requests and to earn a better income. Some of the items she intends to buy include maize flour, sugar, and beans.

loans.use: to buy items including maize flour, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie, 36, lives in Buchanan, with her husband and two children between the ages of 7 and 10, who are currently in school. She received the initial capital to start in this business from her husband. She has a provision shop where she has been selling candy, salt, vita, bread, biscuits, slippers, washing soap, bath soap, hair grease, and many other items. She started this business with the amount of 10,000 LD (Liberian Dollars). She makes a profit when she sells, and with the profit she buys more goods, and contributes to the home. She is requesting a loan to purchase more peanuts, salt, washing soap, bread, and biscuits to increase her sales. Her future plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more peanuts, salt, washing soap, bread, and biscuits to increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy various goods such as lotions, soap, biscuits, cakes, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Runyenge Gamba Nokora Group

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 26-year-old active business farmer. He is married with two children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He trades in produce to get income to enable him to earn a living for his family. Godfrey started this business immediately after dropping out of school as a result of school-fees failure by his parents. He buys produce from rural areas and sells to town dwellers. 

Godfrey has the challenge of a small capital base as well price fluctuations and inflation, which leads to higher prices and hence, lower profits. 

He has a personal goal of building a permanent home for a residence and owning a food store that can sustainably supply his customers all year round. 

Godfrey intends to use the loan to buy maize and beans to sell. Some of the members in the group graduated to individual lending after accumulating enough capital, and this is the reason why there are fewer members than the previous loan cycle.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Beralis

texts.es: Beralis de treinta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos; Ella se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de café tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro  y ha ganado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno donde cultiva es de alta incidencia agrícola y esta muy cercano a su vivienda muy accesible para trabajar, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque siempre posee lo que necesitan, con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Beralis es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica y luchadora, todos los días se levanta dispuesta a lograr sus objetivos, se esfuerza al máximo pues sabe que así alcanzara el éxito que desea, en la ultima temporada de siembra no pudo obtener las ganancias esperadas por eso en este periodo de siembra quiere recuperarse y realizar una nueva inversión para ello le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de café, insecticida, herbicida, herramienta, etc. Beralis tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Beralis is 38 years old and lives with her life companion and their children. She is a farmer and has worked in the agricultural trade for many years. More specifically, she grows coffee and has gained plenty of experience that has helped her obtain better harvests. The land that she farms is located in an area that has a high frequency of agricultural activity and is close to her home, thus making it very accessible for her to get to work. Beralis sells her crops in all of the areas surrounding her community. She has acquired many customers who prefer to do business with her because she always has what they need. Her products are of good quality and offered at affordable prices, but most of all, she provides excellent service.

Beralis is an energetic and determined woman who is dedicated to her work. Every day she wakes up eager to achieve her objectives. She strives to give her best effort so that she can reach the level of success that she desires. During the last crop cycle, she did not achieve the level of earnings that she had hoped, so she wants to make up ground by the end of this planting season. For this reason, Beralis is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy coffee seeds, insecticides, herbicides, tools, and other supplies. She has good credit references who attest to her ability to repay this debt. Beralis has faith that she can provide her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds, insecticides, herbicides, tools, and other supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 37 years old  and a business lady. She is married to Joseph, a businessman. They are blessed with two children. She has been running a food stall as a primary business and doing mixed crop farming as a secondary business for the past two years with the monthly income of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings), which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD. after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Elizabeth will use the loan to buy more stock of foodstuffs and seedlings. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a butchery.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and seedlings

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold, 41, is a hard-working family man. He and his wife, who is employed, have three children; all are in school. Arnold operates an Internet cafe where he provides services like printing, browsing, photocopying, etc. He has operated the business for one year and is well-known locally for the quality of his work. 

He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy a printer for his business to provide better service to his customers. 

Arnold also operates a barbershop, which is also doing well so far.

loans.use: to buy a printer.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 53 years old and married with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. Seventeen years ago, he decided to venture into farming in order to sustainably support his growing family. Like most farmers, he is challenged by price fluctuations and unpredictable seasonal weather changes.

He has dreams of educating his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification and of buying more land for farming. Albert is requesting the loan to pay workers who are weeding his garden.

loans.use: to pay workers who are weeding his garden.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: Mavluda is not married and does not have children. She lives with her parents and has always wanted to help them have a good quality of life. Mavluda decided to start a new business sewing women’s dresses to generate an income she could contribute to her family's finances. She took a course, "To get ahead," through a women's organization and learned business skills. She is asking for a loan of 5000 TJS to buy a sewing machine and fabric for organizing her new business. She will get through, using the loan and earning income from her business so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement and sand for her house.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a hardworking married woman with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has been operating a retail shop for three years, and her main hardship is inadequate capital to meet the high demand. Her personal goals are building a good house and educating her children up to the university.

She is also a farmer and with the proceeds, she has been able to buy land and reinvest in the retail shop. Her business desire is to venture into modern farming methods and to own a wholesale shop. Zainabu intends to use the loan to buy crates of soda, beer, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy crates of soda, beer, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 31-year-old hard-working lady with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has been operating a retail shop for one year. With the proceeds she is able to meet her monthly rental fees for the business premises, pay school fees and re-invest in the business. She faces hardships of high license fees and price fluctuations. Nevertheless, she dreams of educating her children and owning a wholesale shop. Rose intends to use the loan to buy beer, soda, maize, cassava and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda, maize, cassava flour and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 35 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Jennifer has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, maize and other retail products. 

To help expand her business, Jennifer has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, maize and other retail products to expand her business and will help Jennifer generate greater profits and pay school fees. Jennifer hopes that in the future she will be able to continue providing for her family. 

Jennifer is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jennifer who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, maize and other retail products to expand her business.

loans.name: Rafig

texts.en:
Rafig is 48 years old, married and has two children. Rafig lives in the Absheron region with his wife and children. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the city of Fuzuli. He needs a loan of 1,800 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) to buy spare parts to repair his car. Rafig has been in the taxi business for the last nine years. He tries all the time to improve his monthly income  to support his family.
It is second loan from Rafig. He is very thankful to Kiva and to lenders for helping him.

loans.use: to buy spare car parts for his taxi business.

loans.name: Quita V.

texts.en:
Quita V. is running a shop in the area of New Kru Town, where she sells alcoholic drinks. She has run this business for the past three years; she makes lots of profit since she is the only one who sells alcoholic drinks in her community. The profits are used for house rent, feeding, school fees and to improves her saving account. A problem she faces is the rainy season. 

She started this business at her house just by selling soft drinks in the front yard, and this money was given to her by her husband who works with the government as an office assistant. They have four children that are in school and live at home. Quita V. is 30 years old. She was unfortunately unable to attend school, and her plan is to expand her business. 

Quita V. is requesting a loan to purchase more alcoholic drinks (Black Horses, Godfather, etc.) for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more alcoholic drinks (Black Horses, Godfather, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 30-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with four children. She has been a tailor for the past four years with the monthly income of 4,370 KES, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Elizabeth will use the loan to buy textile materials for dress making. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will reinvest into the business. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her dress making business and improve her family living standards.

loans.use: to buy textile materials for dress making.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a dedicated woman who has been operating a retail shop for the past year. She has been able to establish a good customer base. Her dream is to expand her business in order to own a bigger store some time. Nancy is a 39-year-old married mother of four and lives in her own house in the town of Kaloleni. She intends to buy flour, sacks of rice, cooking fat, and other small fast-selling items. Nancy is sure that she will be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy flour, sacks of rice, cooking fat, and other small fast-selling items.

loans.name: Sarapio

texts.en:
Sarapio is a 38-year-old married man. He has five children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop for three years and with the profits he has been able to buy land, pay his children's school fees and reinvest in the business. He hopes to provide his children university educations and to build a permanent house along with diversifying his business to trade stationery, despite the challenges of high operational costs and taxes.

Sarapio is requesting a loan to buy basins, soap, biscuits, books and cassava flour to resell.

loans.use: to buy basins, soap, biscuits, books and cassava flour to resell at his retail shop

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente y vive junto a su familia en Lambayeque, su comunidad se ubica en una zona rural dedicada principalmente a la agricultura. Se encuentra situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  

Juana se dedica al igual que la mayoría de su comunidad es la crianza y comercio de animales.  Los animales los cría en la parte posterior de su domicilio, los engorda y cuando ya han alcanzado su peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado de la zona a los comerciantes que visitan el lugar.  Con los ingresos que obtiene cubre sus gastos y los de su familia.  Adicionalmente trabaja en chacras y recibe un pago como jornal como también vende huevos que son de sus propios animales.

Juana desea mejorar su calidad de vida y la de los suyos, vendiendo más.  Es por ello que quiere comprar una mototaxi que le facilite el traslado de sus animales y especialmente de los huevos que vende.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 4000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Juana is 36 years old, is in a civil union and lives with her family in Lambayeque. Her community is located in a rural area where the main activity is agriculture. It is locate more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  

Juana makes her living just as the majority of her community, raising and selling animals. She raises the animals behind her home. She fattens them up and when they reach the ideal weight and size, she sells them in the area market where other venders go as well. With the income she makes she covers her and her family's expenses. She also works in the fields and receives pay as a day laborer as well as selling the eggs from her animals.

Juana wants to improve her quality of life and that of her family by selling more. This is why she wants to buy a motorcycle taxi that will help her in transporting her animals and especially the eggs that she sells. As a result she believes it would be a good idea to take a loan of 4,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Badalby

texts.en: Badalby is a widow and has 2 children. She always wanted to provide them with a good education but she doesn't have a job or enough income for it. She studied at a course of ‘To get ahead’ with a women's organization and got enough skills about business. Her children will help her with the business. She will be a very successful businesswoman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 3000 somoni to buy food items for organizing a new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy food items for organizing a new business

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 38 years old and single. This gentleman is from the area of Kaloleni, which is in the coastal region of the country. 

Lawrence works selling goats at the market. He has two years of experience. Currently, he has dreams and goals, which include expanding his business, which will increase his income.

Lawrence is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help provided he will be able to purchase more goats for sale and increase his earnings in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for sale

loans.name: Flutura

texts.en:
Flutura is a 34-year-old Roma and is a married mother of four, with the youngest child just two years old. She and her family live in the outskirts of a major city in central Albania and their living conditions have been unacceptable. About five years ago she even started selling used items in the hope of saving some money to build a better place, and indeed, she managed to offer the basics to her children and save some money.

Now, the house she started to build is not finished yet because there is not enough money. This is the reason why Flutura is asking for a loan to buy and install windows: so they can be installed before the cold mid-November starts. 

Flutura is seeking some understanding from Kiva's lenders in this regard and she hopes that she will get the financial support that she is seeking for from them.

loans.use: to buy and install new windows in her house

loans.name: Voice Of Kakabara Youth Assn Group

texts.en: John is a thirty-year-old hardworking married man with three school going children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a civil servant working with local government and also has a pub to supplement his meager salary. With the proceeds he is able to pay school fees for his children and meet the daily needs of the family. He has a dream of expanding this business into a big restaurant and expanding into new areas. He is a member of the above mentioned group where each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan. John is requesting a loan to buy soda and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a thirty-year-old lady from Kisumu City who is divorced from her spouse and therefore takes care of her four children aged between 10 to 17 years.

Millicent operates a grocery stall within Kisumu town, has been doing this for the last 10 years and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is now taking her second loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more stock of tomatoes, oranges, mangoes, onions and green vegetables. Her profits will be used add more stock to the business.

Her dream is to own a big grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy more stock of tomatoes, oranges, mangoes, onions and green vegetables

loans.name: Elmer Enrique

texts.es: Elmer Enrique de veintidós años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo, él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos maíz y frijol además a la crianza de ganado, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le ha regalado valiosa experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancia, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona apta para la siembra y cercano a la localidad donde reside, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad es muy conocido y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere por los buenos precios,  la calidad del producto y el excelente servicio; Elmer es un hombre enérgico, dedicado a su labor, amable y muy honesto, siempre esta en toda la disposición de salir adelante y buscar un futuro mejor, en la temporada pasada aumentaron las ganancias y en esta siembra quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, una vaca, etc. Elmer Enrique tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Elmer Enrique, age 22, lives with his life companion and their son. He grows basic grains, such as corn and beans, but he also raises cattle. Elmer has worked in agriculture for several years and has gained valuable experience that has allowed him to generate better earnings. The land on which he farms is situated in an area that is suitable for growing crops and is located in the town where he resides. He sells everything he produces in the areas surrounding his community. Elmer is well-known and has acquired many customers who prefer to do business with him because he offers good prices, quality products, and excellent service. He is an energetic, friendly, and honest man who is dedicated to his work. He is always willing to move forward in search of a better future.

Last season, he was able to increase his earnings. Now he wants to take advantage of this crop season by making a new investment, so he is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral. The money will allow him to buy corn and bean seeds, a cow, and other supplies. Elmer Enrique is responsible and has good credit references who can vouch for his ability to repay the loan. He has faith that he can achieve financial security for his household.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, a cow, and other supplies.

loans.name: Ramon De Jesus

texts.es: Ramón de Jesús de treinta años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia , él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener siempre la mejores cosechas, el terreno esta en un lugar accesible apto para el cultivo y con suelo fértil, todo lo que produce lo comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además se caracteriza por tener el mejor servicio; Ramón es un hombre decidido, responsable y muy trabajador, tiene muchas metas para el futuro y con empeño y constancia piensa alcanzarlas, en la ultima temporada de siembra tuvo algunas perdidas y quiere recuperarse pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le s solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, herbicida, abono, herramienta, etc. Ramón de Jesús tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura poder saldar la deuda y a la vez ofrecerle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Ramón de Jesús is 30 years old and lives with his life partner and children in their own home. He works growing corn and has worked for several years in agriculture and gained valuable experience that allows him to always have the best harvest. The land is in a suitably accessible area for tilling the fertile land and everything that he produces is sold all over the community. He has a lot of customers since people know that everything he sells is first rate and at accessible prices as well as having the best service. Ramón is a determined, responsible and hardworking man, he has a lot of goals for the future and with hard work and constancy he hopes to reach them. During the last harvest season he had some losses and hopes to recover but he doesn’t have enough capital, which is why he went to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy corn seeds, herbicide, manure, tools, etc. Ramón de Jesús has good payment references and is committed to paying his debt and to offer his family a fulfilling life.

loans.use: buy corn seeds, herbicide, manure, tools, etc.

loans.name: Wil

texts.en: Wil is a 33-year-old married man with four children and lives in Kasese,Uganda. He has been practicing farming, especially bananas and coffee, for five years and also has a soda and beer depot as an additional income source. Like most farmers in his area, he faces the challenges of soil exhaustion due to soil erosion on the slopes and unpredictable seasonal weather changes. He has dreams of using modern farming techniques and expanding his depot to new areas. Wil is requesting a loan for manure for his coffee and banana plantations.

loans.use: to buy manure for his coffee and banana plantations

loans.name: Rafael Arnoldo

texts.es: Rafael Arnoldo de veinticuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida, él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos especialmente el maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura pues desde pequeño aprendió el oficio junto a su padre, se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite poner el cien porciento en la labor, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de gran potencial agrícola y cercano a su vivienda, todo lo que produce lo vende en los alrededores de la comunidad ya tiene mucha clientela y las personas lo buscan porque siempre tiene buenos precios y producto de primera calidad además de un servicio excelente; Rafael es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, piensa que la perseverancia y la dedicación son la clave para llegar al éxito, y él quiere perseverar hasta el final, en esta temporada de siembra quiere aumentar la producción pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc. Rafael Arnoldo cuenta con buenas referencias de pago y uno moral intachable, tiene la certeza que cancelara la deuda al mismo tiempo le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rafael Arnoldo is 24 years old and lives with his life partner. He works harvesting basic grains, specifically corn and beans and has worked for several years in agriculture as he learned the job from his father as a young boy.  It has proved to be a very valuable experience that allows him to put a hundred percent to the job. The land is located in area of great agricultural potential and is close to his home. Everything that he produces is sold around the community since he has a lot of customers and people seek him because he always has the best prices and his product is first rate and provides excellent service. Rafael is an enterprising man with the drive to get ahead in life and hopes that perseverance and dedication will be the keys to achieving success and he wants to continue to the end. This harvest season, Rafael would like to increase his production but he does not have enough capital, which is why he went to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy corn and bean seeds, manure, insecticides, tools, etc. Rafael Arnoldo has good payment references, an untouchable moral character, and is certain that he will pay off his debt as well as giving his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy corn and bean seeds, manure, insecticides, tools, etc.

loans.name: Denis Antonio

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Achuapa una preciosa ciudad dedicado en sus actividades comerciales ubicado a 112 Km del departamento de León, el señor Denis Antonio  es conocido como una persona responsable, trabajador y honesto.
Es casado cuenta con un hijo bajo su cargo y sus principales  funciones es desempeñar el cargo de profesor de educación primaria.
 Denis mantiene a su familia y asegura que su hijo valla a la universidad con mucha necesidad por eso necesita un financiamiento  para pago de aranceles universitario, ha descubierto que Kiva y Ceprodel le puede dar este tipo de financiamiento.

De momento solo cuenta con su buena salud, su capacidad de trabajo y la honradez que en el pasado le ha permitido mantener un buen crédito, es por tal razón que solicita a kiva y Ceprodel que le financien este tipo de crédito para cumplir con sus sueños principales de Llegar a graduar a su hijo.

Anterior mente Ceprodel y kiva le financio un crédito, para la mejora de su vivienda, esto sería de mucha importancia para el desarrollo de su vida familiar, para así lograr sacar  adelante a su único hijo.
texts.en:
The municipality of Achuapa is a beautiful city that is known for its commercial activities and is located 112 kilometers from the Department of León. It is here that Sr. Denis Antonio has gained a reputation for being a responsible, hardworking, and honest person. He is married and has a son who is under his responsibility. His occupation is that of an elementary school teacher.

Denis supports his family and wants to ensure that his son attends the university. He needs a loan so that he can pay the university fees. Denis discovered that Kiva and CEPRODEL can provide him this type of financing.

At the moment, Denis only has his good health, his ability to work, and his honor. In the past, these distinctions have enabled him to maintain good credit. He is requesting that Kiva and CEPRODEL finance this type of loan so that he can fulfill his dream of seeing his son graduate.

CEPRODEL and Kiva financed a previous loan for Denis so that he could make home improvements. This loan was of great importance in helping his family develop and enabling his only son to get ahead.

loans.use: to pay for his son's university fees.

loans.name: Sitora

texts.ru: Ситора проживает в городе Исфара. Ей 25 лет. Она разведена. У нее двое детей. Ситора по специальности портниха. Она уже год как занимается шитьем. Ситора в основном занимается шитьем и вышивкой национальных платьев. Она берет кредит для приобретения модернизированной швейной машинки для вышивки платьев.
texts.en:
Sitora is a 25-year-old woman living in the city of Isfara. She is divorced and has two children. 

Sitora is a seamstress and has been working in this field for a year now. Generally, she sews and embroiders women's dresses in the Tajik national style. She is requesting this loan to purchase a modern sewing machine for embroidering dresses.

loans.use: to purchase a modern sewing machine for dress embroidering

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Don Raúl tiene 62 años de edad, casado, vive en una aldea del municipio de San Marcos, Santa Bárbara junto a su esposa y una hija.
Toda su vida se ha dedicado a realizar actividades agrícolas. Trabajó mucho tiempo como jornalero en una compañía azucarera y al quedar sin empleo decidió emprender su propio negocio. Hace un año comenzó a vender productos de consumo diario en su casa, como ser: sal, jabón, arroz, frijoles, maíz, huevos, manteca, azúcar,  churros, jugos y refrescos. El siempre cultiva maíz y frijoles y la pulpería la atiende también su esposa.
Con el préstamo que ha solicitado a ODEF, por 6000 Lempiras,  él quiere surtir con más productos y hacer crecer el negocio, comprara granos básicos, sal, café, jabón, detergente, huevos, manteca, azúcar, refrescos, golosinas, condimentos, pastillas y otros productos. 
Su meta es construir un cuarto anexado a su casa donde ubicar bien el negocio ya que lo tiene en la sala de su casa y así podrá brindar mejor servicio al cliente.
texts.en:
Don Raúl is 62 years old, married, and lives with his wife and daughter in a neighborhood in the town of San Marcos, Santa Barbara. His entire life has been devoted to farming activities. Raúl worked a long time as a laborer for a sugar company and then decided to establish his own business after he lost his job. A year ago, he began selling everyday consumer products such as salt, soap, rice, beans, corn, eggs, shortening, sugar, fried dough, juices, and soft drinks. He continues to grow corn and beans while his wife manages the convenience store.

With this loan of 6,000 HNL that he is requesting from ODEF, Raúl wants to grow his business by restocking it with more products. He plans to buy basic grains, salt, coffee, soap, detergent, eggs, shortening, sugar, soft drinks, snacks, condiments, medicines, and other products. His goal is to build an adjoining room to his house so that he can relocate his business, which is currently set up in his living room. This will enable him to provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, salt, coffee, soap, detergent, eggs, shortening, sugar, soft drinks, snacks, condiments, medicines, and other products.

loans.name: Kasagazi Twimukye Group

texts.en: Silvia, a pineapple grower in the rural Lyantonde, is married and has six children, who are all in school. She also looks after four orphans. She went into the business in 2009 because she wanted to get income to meet the growing demands of her extended family. She also rears pigs and goats, in addition to the pineapples, to ably support the family. Her dream is to build her family a decent house and to rear cows. Her main challenges so far are limited capital, inadequate market for the pineapples, and diseases. Silvia is hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To buy improved pineapple seeds

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a married man with four children in secondary school. He is 45 years old and lives in the Kyetume zone of the Sembabule District, where he grows coffee. He earns his income from agriculture, and he uses this income to take care of his family by paying school fees for his children. He intends to use this loan to buy organic fertilizer and better coffee seedlings so that he can improve his coffee plantation. His major customers include coffee exporters and coffee factories.

Wilson's major challenges are climate change and pests, both of which affect his productivity. Despite these challenges, Wilson is committed and determined to improve his agricultural productivity and thereby change his family's status. His dream is to become the best coffee farmer in the Sembabule District's Kyetume zone.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Jankai

texts.en: Jankai is a 24-year-old lady who lives in Airport. She is single and a high school graduate. For five years now, she has been involved in selling body creams, powder, spry, and bath soap. She was helped by her boyfriend to start her business, which is how she makes a living. She is requesting a loan to purchase more body creams, powder, spry, and bath soap for her business. She hopes to build a house and have children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more body creams, powder, spry, and bath soap to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 40-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been running a bridal shop business for three years and has banana and flower gardens as another source of income. With the profits, he has been able to promptly provide basics to his family and expand the business. His major challenge is the seasonal nature of the business. His business desire is to diversify and trade in other types of clothes and expand his flower business, which has also proven to be very lucrative.Joseph is requesting a loan to buy bridal clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy bridal clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 27-year-old lady from Kisumu City who is married to Joshua. They have three children who are 11, 9 and 5 years old.

Elizabeth operates a grocery stall in Nyaori area and has been doing this for the last three years. She makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is now taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stock of tomatoes, oranges, mangoes, onions and cereals. 

Her profits will be used to educate her children. Her dream is to own a big grocery business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, oranges, mangoes, onions and cereals.

loans.name: Katana

texts.en: For the past seven years, Katana has been running a goat meat business selling to the butcher shops. He says that it has been a profitable project that he has the urge to continue operating. He is a married man with eight children and lives in the coastal region of Kenya. He dreams of diversifying his areas of operation and the latest plan is to own a kiosk. Katana is currently requesting a loan in the amount of KSH 30,000 to buy more goats to sell. He is very sure that he will be able to earn a good income.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos dependientes.  Vive en el Caserío El Taymi en el distrito de Túcume, tierra llena de tradición, costumbres, riquezas arqueológicas y de invaluable historia, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Javier se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, cría patos, gallinas, pollos y pavos en su vivienda, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta en el mercado principal de la ciudad en donde vive. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para apoyar en el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.  Adicionalmente fabrica ladrillos para su posterior venta.

Javier quiere comprar animales y alimento para ellos.  Asimismo necesita materiales para la fabricación de más ladrillos.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 soles a Edpyme Alternativa para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Javier is 25 years old, single, and has no dependent children. He lives in the village of El Taymi in the District of Túcume, a land that is filled with tradition, customs, archaeological treasures, and a rich history. This area is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Department of Lambayeque.

Javier raises and sells animals such as ducks, hens, chickens, and turkeys from his home. When the animals have reached the appropriate level of development, he offers them for sale at the main market in the city where he lives. The profit that he generates from his business is used to maintain his family’s finances. In addition, Javier manufactures bricks for eventual sale.

Javier wants to buy animals and the appropriate feed. He also needs materials for making more bricks. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can achieve these objectives.

loans.use: to buy animals, animal feed, and materials for making bricks.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 31-year-old lady from Kisumu City and is married to Ibrahim. They have three children who are 12, 9 and 5 years old, respectively.

Linda operates a clothes selling business,. She hss been doing this business for the last 12 years and makes a monthly income of KES 20,000. She has applied for her second loan cycle from KADET LTD, to buy a stock of ladies tops, dresses and skirts. 

She plans to use the expected profits to repay her loan. Her dream is to have a big clothes selling business.

loans.use: To buy ladies tops, dresses and skirts.

loans.name: Sabur

texts.ru:
Сабур проживает в районе Хуросон. Ему 71 год. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Сабур имеет среднее образование. Он более 17 лет занимается животноводством. Сабур разводит скот у себя дома. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. 
Сабур берет кредит для закупа мелко – рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Sabur lives in the region of Khuroson. He is 71 years old, married and has five children. Sabur has secondary education. He has been in the animal husbandry business for more than seventeen years. He breeds cattle at home. Sabur has been making a living by breeding large horned cattle.

Sabur is taking out the loan to buy small horned cattle.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats.

loans.name: Muhammadi

texts.ru: Мухаммад проживает в районе Хуросон. Он женат. Ему 29 лет. У него двое детей. Мухаммад занимается животноводством. Он разводит мелко – рогатый скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности Мухаммад занимается три года. Он берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Muhammadi lives in the Khuroson region.  He is 29 years old and married with two children.  Muhammadi works in livestock; he raises goats and sheep on his farm.  He has been in this line of work for three years.  He is asking for a loan to buy larger livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows and bulls.

loans.name: Firuz

texts.ru: Фируз житель города Душанбе. Ему 24 года. Он холост. Фируз работает в агентстве при правительстве Республики Таджикистан. Он уже четыре года работает в этой области. Фируз вместе с отцом хочет открыт небольшую закусочную на рынке Корвон, где его отец будет руководить всем. Для того чтобы он вместе с отцом смог начать свою деятельность ему необходимо получить кредит. Фируз берет кредит для приобретения необходимого оборудования (аппарата для приготовления шаурмы).
texts.en: Firuz is a resident of the city of Dushanbe. He is 24 years old. He is not married. Firuz works in the government agency in the Republic of Tajikistan. He has been working in this field for four years now. Firuz wants to open a small cafe on the Kovron market together with his father where his father will be the administrator. He needs to receive a loan so that he and his father can start their business. Firuz is taking a loan to buy necessary equipment such as the appliance for making of shwarma.

loans.use: to purchase necessary equipment.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфие 30 лет. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Зулфия решила организовать свой бизнес для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей детской одеждой. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zulfiya is 30 years old. She is divorced and is raising two children. Zulfiya decided to organize her own business for well being of her family. She has taken a course for this purpose organized by the Association of Business Women "Achieve Success" and received a certificate. Now she can set up her business and become successful in this field. She wants to start a business buying and reselling children's clothing. She plans to use the income to provide her children with good education and high calorie food. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 3,000 somoni to buy goods to organize her new business. She is awaiting your generosity.

loans.use: to buy clothes to organize new business.

loans.name: Olmakhon

texts.ru: Олмахон очень трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет  4 детей. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат.  Олмахон планирует организовать свой бизнес для благо получения семьи. Она хочет организовать бизнес  купле продажей мужской одеждой и обувью. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить семью хорошим условием жизни. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  1000 долларов США для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Olmakhon is a very hard-working woman.  She is 35 years old and has four children at home.  She took the "Bring It On" course which was organized by the Association of Businesswomen and received a certificate.  Olmakhon plans to start her business for the sake of her family.  She wants to start a business buying and selling men's clothes and shoes.  With the proceeds from this business, she plans on improving her family's living conditions.  She is asking for a loan of $1,000 US dollars to buy goods to start her business.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy clothes to start her new business

loans.name: Kholniso

texts.ru: Холнисо молодая, красивая и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 27 лет.  Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Уже несколько лет Холнисо хотела организовать свой бизнес и быть  успешной в этой сфере. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес  купле продажей  индустриальных товаров, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3500 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Kholniso is a young, beautiful and purposeful woman. She is 27 years old. She is married and is raising two children. Kholniso has been wanting to organize her own business and be successful in this field for several years now. With this purpose she has taken a course "Achieve Success" organized by the Association of Business Women and has received a certificate. She wants to set up her business by buying and selling industrial goods as she already has experience in this kind of business. She plans to use the profit to provide her children with good education and high calorie foods. Kholniso is asking for a loan in the amount of 3,500 somoni to buy goods to start her business. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy industrious goods for organizing new business.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru: После окончания средней школы, Азиза поставила себе цель стать известным банкиром. С этой целью она поступила в Худжандский Государственный Университет факультет Финансы и кредит. Азиза студентка 1 курса. Она очень умная и трудолюбивая девушка. Учиться отлично и активно участвует на всех мероприятиях университета. Отец Азизы умер 3 года назад и семью кормит ее мама. У Азизы братик, который учится в средней школе. Ее мать не в состоянии оплатить за учебу своего ребенка. Азиза обратилась в Имон Интернешенл с целью получения займа для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: After graduating high school Aziza has created a goal for herself to become a known banker. With this purpose she has enrolled in the Khujand State University majoring in financing and loans. Aziza is a freshman student. She is very smart and hardworking young woman. She is receiving perfect grades and takes part in of all the university events. Aziza's father has passed away three years ago and her mother provides for the family now. Aziza has a young brother who goes to secondary school. Her mother is not able to pay for the eduction of her child. Aziza has come to IMON International with the goal to receive a loan to pay for her university tuition. She is awaiting your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Дилором имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она на протяжении одиннадцати лет преподает в школе. Также Дилором занимается растениеводством. В этой области она более 11 лет. Дилором выращивает овощи и сеет пшеницу, а также она сажает фруктовые деревья. Она берет кредит для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений, чтобы посеять пшеницу.
texts.en: Dilorom is a resident of the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 47 years old, married and has four children. Dilorom has a higher eduction in teaching. She has been teaching at school for eleven years. Dilorom also does plant cultivation. She has been in this business for more than eleven years. Dilorom grows vegetables and sows wheat as well as plants fruit trees. She is taking out the loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer to sow wheat.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for sowing of wheat.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es: José de  46 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa y sus hijos.  Él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos en especial frijoles, además legumbres comó rábano, cilantro, güisquil. Posee con esfuerzo dos terrenos, en los cuales realiza sus siembras, de esta forma brinda lo necesario a su familia.  Después de cultivar y lograr la cosecha pone a la venta cierta parte de esta y otra para poder suplir el consumo en su hogar. Esta es su principal fuente de ingresos. Muchas personas dan buenas referencias de él ya que es un hombre trabajador, responsable y honesto.  Cada día siente que las necesidades de su hogar son mayores por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL  para comprar los insumos necesarios como: semillas, abonos, fertilizante, pesticidas entre otros. Para incrementar su cosecha y así le permita sobrevivir  cada día ya que que no cuenta con otra  fuente de ingreso. Espera y confía en Dios todo poderoso que obtendrá resultados positivos y logrará su sueño de brindar a su querida familia mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
José is 46 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and kids. He makes a living growing grains, especially beans and other vegetables like radishes, cilantro, güisquil (a regional squash variety). With much hard work, José maintains two plots of land. On these he grows his crops in order to provide for his family. After sowing and reaping the harvest, José sells part of his yield and uses the rest to feed his family. This is his main source of income. José has many good references from the community. He is a hardworking, responsible, and honest man.

Each day, he feels like the necessities of his house are more and more. That is why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL: in order to buy supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc. He hopes to increase the yield from his crops, which will allow him to get by day to day, seeing as he has no other source of income. José is hopeful and trusts that God will help him obtain positive results, and that he will achieve his dream of offering is family a better financial situation.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, a 30-year-mother of three children aged 15, 13 and 9, lives in Kisumu City where she is married to Charles. For the past year Christine has been operating a potato-selling business, earning a monthly income of KES. 6,000.

Now requesting her second loan from KADET LTD to buy more potatoes in bulk to sell in her stall, she plans to use her profits to add more stock.

Christine's dream is to educate her kids.

loans.use: to buy potatoes in bulk for sale in her stall.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 32-year-old single mother of three children and one dependent who is an orphan. She runs a poultry feed shop from which she earns income to take the four children to school. Additionally, this money enables her to pay for other daily household expenses such as rent, medical expenses and food. 

Aisha requests a UGX 2,000,000 loan to buy construction materials to complete her first residential house. With the house complete, she will have survived the burden of renting and she will be able to save money to meet other needs. Aisha is a very hardworking woman.

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Yosofu

texts.en:
Yosofu is a 25-year-old, hardworking man who lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop for six months. He earned his startup capital from a coffee-sales business he still operates. He started the business to supplement his coffee business, which is seasonal and cannot sustain the needs of his family year round.

Yosofu dreams of educating his children and expanding his businesses to new areas. He faces business challenges such as stiff competition and price fluctuations. Yosofu is requesting a loan to buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 47-year-old, married man with six children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. He is a hardworking man who is involved in a number of businesses, including farming, rearing goats and transportation. He has been in business for 20 years.

Like most good fathers, Ali dreams of educating his children to attain degrees and securing a future for them by investing in a number of sustainable projects. Ali intends to use the loan to pay workers to weed his maize garden.

loans.use: to pay workers to weed his maize garden.

loans.name: Butenga Parents Group

texts.en:
Harriet is a widow with four children, all in secondary school, in addition to a dependant who is an orphan. She is 35 years old and lives in Kikunyu Zone, Mpigi District, running a grocery. She earns her income from the grocery and farming, which she uses to take care of her family's needs and to pay school fees for her children. Harriet’s major challenges are changes in market prices, competition and diseases that affect the crops. 

Harriet intends to use the borrowed money to rent a piece of land on which she will grow onions to sell to increase her income. Her customers mainly include the local community and passersby. Despite the challenges, Harriet envisions a bright future through agriculture. Her dream is to build a decent house for her family and some rentals that will fetch income when her children join university.

loans.use: to rent a piece of land to grow onions

loans.name: Mammadali

texts.en:
Mammadali is a married man with four children. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Agdam. He now lives in the Absheron region with his family. 

Mammadali has been engaged in agriculture for the last five years. He chose this business because it is profitable. With his cattle, he produces fresh milk, cheese and yogurt to sell. As these products are in high demand, Mammadali  wants to expand his business and produce more dairy products to meet market demand. 

Now Mammadali needs 2,000 AZN to buy cattle so he can improve his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Loranzo  S.

texts.en:
Loranzo S. is 57, married, and lives in the area of New Kru Town with his wife and three children. The children are in school and range in age from 14 to 28.

Loranzo S., a high school graduate, has been involved in business for the past seven years and currently runs a shop selling bathroom materials (sockets, bath tubs, etc.). Enjoying his business because of its profitability, his earnings pay for food and his children's education.

Now requesting a 100,000 LRD loan to buy more goods for his business, he plans to continue supporting his children's education and improving his business even more.

loans.use: to buy more goods for his business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 36-year-old, married man with four children. He and his family live in Kasese, Uganda. He sells clothes in different markets and also has a transportation business so he can earn additional income.

Since his business is viewed as a luxury more than a necessity in his community, Samuel faces the business challenge of seasonality. Most customers tend to buy his items during festive seasons and summer holidays only. However, he is determined to change his future and that of his family by educating his children and diversifying his business to include agriculture.

Samuel is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Fenekansi

texts.en: Fenekansi is a 37-year-old businessman who has been selling produce, mainly maize and beans, for four years. He started by growing tomatoes and then sold them for enough capital to start this business. Fenekansi faces problems of price fluctuations and inflation which erode most of his profits, as well as high fuel and transport costs. In the future, he would like to buy a car, diversify his business into processing, and buy land for growing crops. As with his previous loan, Fenekansi is requesting a new loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, a 33-year-old lady from Kisumu City, is married to Washington, and they have four children aged 11, 10 and 2 years. For the past year she has been operating a clothes-selling business, earning a monthly income of KES. 10,000.

Alice has applied for a business loan from KADET LTD to buy more stocks of jeans, bras, inner garments, skirts and socks to sell. She intends to use her profits to repay her loan.

Her dream is to open a big clothing business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of jeans, bras, inner garments, skirts and socks to sell.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.fr: Bernard est un homme âgé de 42 ans, célibataire et père de 03 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 07 et 14 ans et qui vont tous à l'école. il comme activité une vannerie dans un quartier de la ville depuis pratiquement 22 ans. il bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans cette activité. Initié par son papa, il tisse (ou fabrique) des meubles qu'il expose par la suite. il travaille également sur commande. il voudrait avec ce crédit acheter 14 feuilles de contre plaquet, 05 boites de vernis, et de la peinture aussi afin de renforcer son stock de matière pour pouvoir réaliser ses commandes à temps. Il a pour ambition de construire un atelier de travail et une grande salle d'exposition.
texts.en: Bernard is a 42-year old man, who is single and father to three children, whose ages range from seven to 14 years old and who all go to school. He has had a basketry business in one of the town's districts for almost 22 years and has good experience in this field. Introduced to this activity by his father, he weaves (or makes) pieces of furniture which he then displays. He also works to order. With this loan he would like to buy 14 pieces of plywood, five boxes of varnish, as well as paint, so he can boost his stock and finish orders on time. His ambition is to build a workshop and a large showroom.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: St Yowana Group

texts.en:
Proscovia is a thirty-five-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling salt for fourteen years. She also mines salt by herself and has salt pans on the lake. Her major challenge is the corrosive nature of the product leading to a high rate of wear and tear on the equipment, and that is why she prefers to buy from other salt miners. Proscovia intends to use the loan to buy salt to sell.

Like most responsible mothers she has dreams of educating her children up to the University and adding value to her business by processing the salt. She is a member of the group pictured above, where each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy salt to sell.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a twenty-one-year-old lady from Kisumu City, and she is single but supports her siblings. She operates a mobile money transfer service business, locally known as M-pesa. She has been doing this for the last five years and makes a monthly income of about KES 15,000. 

Jackline has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use as operating float for her M-pesa business. Her profits will be used to repay the loan. Her dream is to have more M-pesa outlets.

loans.use: To use as float for her money transfer service business (M-pesa).

loans.name: Maragaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a thirty-two-year-old lady from Kisumu City and is widowed but takes care of her three children, aged 13, 10 and eight years. Margaret operates a grocery stall in Kisumu town and has been doing this for the last three years. She makes a monthly income of about KES 10,000. 

She is now taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more stock of tomatoes, oranges, mangoes, onions and green vegetables. Her profits will be used add more stock to the business.

Her dream is to own a big grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy more stock of tomatoes, oranges, mangoes, onions and green vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy various goods such as beans, potatoes, shoes, sugar, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah, age 38, is a single lady who lives in the town of Kaloleni. She owns a business selling clothing for women, men and children to help with household expenses. 

She has had a lot of experience in retail, and this helps her to earn better profits. She works at the market center and already has a large client base that prefers her for the quality of her products, good prices, and above all her excellent service.

Serah is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work and is very motivated to get ahead in life. She is always waiting for new opportunities that will let her get one step closer to success, and she won't give in until she's succeeded 100%.

In recent weeks, demand has increased and she wants to make the most of it by making a new investment. That's why she is requesting a loan from Yehu that will allow her to buy bales of clothing to sell. Serah has good payment references and irreproachable morals. She is confident that she will be able to pay off the debt.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Gustave

texts.fr: Gustave est un homme de 58 ans, père de famille .  Il exerce une activité d'élévage (il achète les poussins, les élève ensuite revend) son activté fonctionne à merveille mais son capital n'est pas élévé alors, il est obligé à chaque fois d'attendre que le stock acheté pour élever grandisse, qu'il le vend avant de racheter de nouveaux poussins d'où la rupture de stock quotidienne qui cause l'insatisfaction de sa clientèle tout le temps. il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter en grande quantité des poussins et aussi la provende ce qui lui permettra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle déjà grandissante mais aussi de réaliser un plus gros profit. Le benéfice que lui apportera ce crédit l'aidera à agrandir son activité( augmenter le nombre de poussins) et aussi à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en:
Gustave is a 58-year-old man and a father with a family. He has a business raising livestock (he purchases chicks, raises them, and then sells them). His business is doing wonderfully, but his capital is not high, so he is always compelled to wait and fully raise his stock, which he sells, before he purchases new chicks again. Thus, the day-to-day shortage leads to dissatisfied customers, repeatedly.
