Gustave is requesting this loan to purchase large quantities of chicks, and also some feed, enabling him not only to satisfy his already-growing customer base but also to make a larger profit. The profits this loan will bring in will help him to expand his business (increase the number of chicks) and also to meet the everyday needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase 200 chicks and some feed

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Kasambya Group

texts.en: Matia is a married man, aged 48, who owns a produce store which he has run for a period of 15 years, having got start up capital from farming. Inadequate capital is affecting the business.  He would like to expand his business to other areas within the district and educate his six children to attain degrees as minimum qualification. Matia is requesting a loan to buy maize. He is a member of the above-mentioned group, where each member guarantees the others to access a loan.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To cultivate various food like beans, maize and sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a thirty-two-year-old lady from Kisumu City and is married to Kennedy. They have five children aged between 14 to 5 years. Veronica has been operating a food stall, a business she has been doing for the last six years. She makes a monthly income of about KES 10,000. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy foodstuffs needed in the food stall, like baking flour, sugar, green grams and other items. She plans to use her profits to educate her children. Her dream is to give her children the best education.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like baking flour, sugar, green grams and more items.

loans.name: Petronillah

texts.en:
Petronillah is a thirty-five-year-old lady from Kisumu City. She is a single mother of two children aged 14 and 10 years.

Petronillah operates a retail shop selling household items, a business she has been doing for the last year. She makes a monthly income of 30,000 KES. She is applying for her first loan from KADET; she will use this loan to buy more retail stock of sugar, cooking oil, milk, flour, and other items. She intends to save her profits, which she will later use to open another business.

Her dream is to buy a piece of land and build her own building.

loans.use: to buy more retail stock of sugar, cooking oil, milk, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is 50 years old and is married with three children, ages between 16 and 25. She sells second-hand clothes from 9 a.m until 7 p.m every day. 

Sharifa has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more second hand clothes for resale. She plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy her family's basic needs, to save money for her future, to reinvest in her business, and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a 30-year-old married man. He has 3 children, whose ages range from 1 year to 4 years. He describes himself to be a God-fearing and loving man. He provides transportation with a motorcycle he operates. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located at an urban area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high fuel prices. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His goal is to improve his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy another motorcycle. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM; he used the first loan to improve his grocery store business.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Regine

texts.fr: Régine est une femme de 48 ans commerçante, mère de famille. Elle a ouvert et gère un petit restaurant dans un quartier de la capital depuis deux ans déja. Ce restaurant lui permet de résoudre certains besoins quotidiens. Il fonctionne bien grace à son savoir faire, son expérience dans le domaine ainsi que les prix pratiqués, ce qui lui a permit d'augmenter sa clientèle au fil du temps. Mais la petitesse de son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire totalement sa clientèle, d'où  la nécessité de ce credit qui lui permettra d' augmenter le stock de vivres ( deux cartons de poulets, deux cartons de poisson, un sac de riz et le petit nécessaire pour les sauces) pour avoir plus de couverts et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Une partie de ce bénéfice sera reinvestie  dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Régine is a 48-year-old merchant and a mother with a family. She opened a small restaurant and has been running it in her district in the capital for two years already. This restaurant enables her to resolve certain day-to-day needs. It is doing well, thanks to her savoir-faire and experience in this domain, as well as practical prices. This has allowed her to increase her customer base over the course of time. But her low level of capital no longer allows her to satisfy them fully, thus the need for this loan for increasing her inventory of staple foods (2 box of chicken, 2 boxes of fish, a sack of rice, and sundry items for making sauces), so as to obtain silverware and to increase her profit margins. Part of the profits will be reinvest in her business to expand it, and the rest will enable her to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase staple foods (chickens, fish, rice, and sundry ingredients for making sauces).

loans.name: Rudina

texts.en:
Rudina is thirty-eight years old and married. She is a Roma mother of two (an ethnic group) and lives within her community in the suburbs of a major city. This is Rudina’s first application for a loan. She wants to use it to buy used items such as clothes, shoes, home appliances and kitchen ware to resell. 

Buying and selling used items has been her activity for the past twelve years and it has proved to be profitable, according to Rudina. She doesn’t sell only in the city’s market; she also sells in the villages around as well.

The loan she is asking for from both institutions, VisionFund Albania and Kiva, is 100,000 Albanian Lek.

loans.use: To buy used items to resell.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is 29 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children, with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Said has been working hard to manage his small food stall, which sells produce. 

To help expand his business, Said has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more foods like dry beans and maize flour, and will help Said to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. Said hopes that in the future he will be able to own a milling machine that will process the food. 

Said is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Said who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more food like dry beans and maize flour.

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr: Elise est une jeune Camerounaise âgée de 30 ans, mère de 04 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 01 et 16 ans et parmi lesquels 03 vont à l'école. elle vit en concubinage avec un homme et a en plus de ses propres enfants 02 autres à sa charge. elle a comme activité un petit restaurant qu'elle gère depuis 05 ans et elle voudrait ce crédit non seulement pour y faire des travaux d’aménagement afin de rendre son restaurant plus propre et attractif, mais aussi elle voudrait acheter 04 sacs de vivres (riz, haricot,), 10 régimes de plantain, du poisson, de la viande et 22 litres d'huile afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. elle a pour ambition d'agrandir son restaurant.
texts.en: Elise is a young woman from Cameroon, age 30. She has four children between the ages of 1 and 16, three of whom attend school. She lives with her partner, who has two children of his own. Elise has been running her own business, a small restaurant, for five years. She would like this loan not only for fixing up her restaurant in order to make it cleaner and more attractive, but also to buy four bags of food supplies (rice, beans), 10 bundles of bananas, fish, meat, and 22 litres of oil. This will allow her to better respond to customer demand. Her general income will help her to provide more for her family. Her ambition is to expand her restaurant.

loans.use: to fix up her restaurant and buy food products.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is Mamie, a 48-year-old from Torkpoi town, Bo Area Office. She is married, and has 5 children between the ages of 7 years and 24 years. Three of her children attend school. 

Mamie runs a local food business at her house; she sells peppers, garri, and palm oil. she has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m., 7 days per week. She also gets income from small-scale farming in the village. Mamie says that the main challenge to her business is that the road network is very poor.

Mamie has requested a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and bags of pepper for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and buy a generator to make her home more comfortable. In the future, she plans to open a big store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and bags of pepper for resale.

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Jeneba from Torkpoi town Southern area Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 18 and 24.

Jeneba runs a cosmetics and house-hold utensils business around her community; she sells clothing, food containers, cups, and slippers. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works from 7am until 6pm, 7 days per week. Her main income comes from this business.  She says that the main challenge to her business is people sometimes refuse to pay after they have purchased items on credit.

Jeneba has requested a loan in order to purchase to more general stock like clothing, food containers, cups, and slippers to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her installment quickly and educate her children. In the future, she plans to expand her business more and help her community. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase to more general stock such as clothing, food containers, cups, and slippers.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 30 years old and married with three children, ages 3 years and 8 years. She runs a clothing business around her environment in Moriba town, Bo, in the Southern area in Sierra Leone. She began this business because she wanted to generate income to support the home.

She has been in this business for five years. She sells wax cotton and clothing material. She also receives income from renting out a house. She describes her major challenge as a lack of enough capital to expand her business.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy different types of clothing for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she would like to see her business expand more. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy different types of cloth for resale.

loans.name: Saamuel

texts.fr: Samuel est un homme de 33 ans, fiancé père de deux enfants de 11 mois et 04 ans. l'un va à l'ecole. Il a une alimentation (petit commerce general)dans laquelle il commercialise le petit déjeuné , les friandises, et les petits produits de première necessité dans un quartier de la place. Il gere cette alimentation depuis 8 deja. Il a aquise et fidelise une clientele grace a sa bonne experience dans ce domaine de commercialisation de produit de consommation courante. Il sollicite ce credit pour augmenter son stock de marchandise(3 cartons de sardine, 10 alvéoles d'oeufs, cartons de sucre, de spaggetti, d'huile), afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientele de plus en plus grandissante. Ceci lui permettra d'augmenter ses benefices qui l'aideront a grandir son activite en achetant plus de produits et en subvenant a ces besoins et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en: Samuel is a 33-year-old man. He is engaged and has two children, ages 4 years and 11 months. The eldest is in school. Samuel has a mini grocery store (a small general store) where he sells breakfasts, candy, and small basic staples. He has had this business for eight years. He acquires and maintains loyal customers because of his extensive experience in the food sales business. He is requesting a loan to increase his stock (3 cartons of sardines, 10 cartons of eggs, boxes of sugar, spaghetti, oil) in order to better satisfy his increasing customer base. This will allow him to increase his profit, which will help him to expand his business and buy more products. This way, he will be able to provide for himself and his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of basic staples (3 cartons of sardines, 10 cartons of eggs, boxes of sugar, spaghetti, oil).

loans.name: Sophie

texts.fr: Sophie est une jeune Camerounaise âgée de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 06 et 14 ans, tous allant à l'école. elle a en plus de ses enfants une autre personne à sa charge. elle a comme activité un centre d'appels téléphonique où en plus des services d'appels elle va également des crédits de communication. elle propose aussi à sa clientèle des bonbons, biscuits, cigarette, whisky en sachet. elle voudrait avec ce crédit non seulement acheter des crédits de communication, mais aussi acheter des biscuits et bonbons. elle a pour ambition d'avoir une grande caisse bien achalandée et son souci majeur est la scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en:
Sophie is a young Cameroonian, 32 years old, married, and the mother of four children, who are from 6 to 14 years old and go to school. She also has another person to support in addition to her children. Sophie has a business, a telephone call center, where she sells communication credits in addition to providing phone services. She also sells candies, cookies, cigarettes, and whiskey in pouches. 

She would like to use this loan not only to purchase communication credits but also to purchase cookies and candies. Her ambition is to have a big well-stocked stall, and her main concern is her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase communication credits

loans.name: Kyabagamba Development Group

texts.en: Richard is a 34-year-old man who grows beans in rural Mpigi and drives a motorcycle during his free time to supplement his income. The purpose of the loan is to buy bean seeds and organic fertilizers. The area in which he is farming is rocky and may not yield much crop without being fertilized. It is for this reason that he wants to buy organic manure which will increase his productivity. With income from the sale of beans, he will be able to provide for his family and pay school fees. His main challenge is poor transportation to the market. Richard is a shrewd and hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds and organic fertilizers for his farm

loans.name: Saffiatu

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Saffiatu from Southern Torkpoi in Bo,  .She is married with 7 children between the ages of 13 and 30. She began this business to engage herself and to become self-reliant.

Saffiatu runs a foodstuffs business; she sells palm oil and wax cotton. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business from 7am until 6pm, 7 days per week. She also earns income with help from her elder daughter. She says that the main challenge to her business is people sometimes deliberately refuse to pay after they have purchased goods on credit.

Saffiatu has requested a loan in order to purchase more product like palm oil and waxed cotton. The extra income from this loan will allow her to expand her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to open a store. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more product like palm oil and waxed cotton.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Musu from Moriba town, Bo Southern area. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 8 and 18. Her children are currently attending school. 

Musu runs a general stock business at her house; she sells cloth, ice cubes, suitcases and soft drinks. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m., 7 days per week, and has two relatives that help her sell the ice cubes and soft drinks. Her business is the only source of income she has. Musu says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and the electrical power she needs to cool her drinks and ice cubes.  

Musu has requested a loan in order to purchase a larger variety of stock, like suitcases and clothing material. The extra income from this loan will allow her to sell more clothes. In the future, she plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase a larger variety of stock, like suitcases and clothing material.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Isatu from Moriba town, Bo Southern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 1 and 8.  One of her children is currently attending school. In 2003, Isatu established her shop selling clothes and perfumes. She began her business because she wants her family's life to improve. She works at the business every day, 13 hours per day. At present, she is faced with insufficient capital to expand her business.  She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation costs and competition in the market. 

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy similar items such as blouses, jeans, and perfumes to add to her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to start a savings account and increase her business. In the future, Isatu plans to expand her business and employ staff. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy items such as blouses, jeans, and perfumes for resale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 23-year-old Kadiatu from Moriba town, Bo, Southern area. She is a married mother of one child age 4 years. She began her business because she did not go to school, and her husband's income is not enough to support the home.

Kadiatu runs a local products business; she sells palm oil, native rice and pepper. She has been running this business for three years. She works at the business every day, 12 hours per day. Her other source of income comes from a small-scale business. Kadiatu says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to invest in her business and an improper business location.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and native rice. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her status. In the future, she plans to expand her business to a shop level. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and native rice.

loans.name: Saul

texts.en:
Saul is a Mexican artisan who specializes in ceramic sculptures. He would like to buy raw materials such as clay, wire and paint. He has been selling through NOVICA since 2009. This is his story: 

"I stepped into the world of ceramic arts when I was 12 years old. Back then, my family's economic situation was difficult, so after school, my brother David and I would learn this craft and get paid a small amount. However, we were immediately taken by the artistry and its techniques. There was a teacher from school who was also going through some financial difficulties, so he set up a little workshop in his house and that extra money helped him put his own children through school. Then I went to Juana Velazquez' workshop and that's when I really began to learn the art of ceramics. I stayed at this workshop for 12 years, but a year before I left this great artisan died of cancer. She was like family to us, and we stood by her husband during this difficult time. I started my own workshop when I was 27 years old, and here is where I practice all I learned, always enjoying the beauty of Mexican ceramic artistry. Thank you for your unconditional support through this microcredit. It allows artisans like me to keep growing."

Use the link below to view Saul's handcrafted ceramic sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=7067

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as clay, wires and paints.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 32 years old and married with 2 children, aged 2 and 10. She runs a food stand business Kandeh town, Bo Area Office, Southern Region in Sierra Leone. Her two children attend school. She started this business when her husband was very sick; she had no option other than to start this business so she could raise income to support her family.

She has been in this business for 6 years and sells foodstuffs in her neighborhood. Her husband is also a businessman, but his income alone is not enough to support the family. She says that the main challenges for her business are transportation costs and insufficient capital.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone in order to buy different foodstuffs, like oil, onions and bananas, for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children. In the future, she would like to see her business expand. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of food stock for resale.

loans.name: Dario

texts.en:
Dario is a Peruvian artisan who makes handcrafted jewelry. He hopes to invest in the purchase of silver and gemstones to continue his work.

Dario has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:

"I began helping out in a jewelry workshop when I was 15, during school vacations. Little by little, this activity became a passion. I realized how much I enjoyed working with meticulous details, and eventually found a great deal of satisfaction in creating jewelry that people liked. Beauty can be expressed in different forms and manners. The challenge for a country like Peru is to get ahead little by little, despite the many difficult circumstances that exist. It's important that people appreciate the art of jewelry, as many don't value the effort it requires.

"I'm very grateful for your support as I create my jewelry designs. This has been my passion since I was a young man, and it has brought me great satisfaction. It's wonderful to see how the simplest design becomes beautiful when worn by a woman. Thank you for your support!"

Use the link below to view Dario's silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=5621

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of silver and gemstones to continue his work.

loans.name: Matu

texts.en: Matu lives in New Kru Town. She is 29 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 6 and 14. They are in school and live at home. Matu stopped her education in the twelfth grade. She has other skills, such as business management. For the past four years, she has been running a shop where she sells lappa (traditional clothing). She started this business with a little funding from her husband, having learned this business from her mother. She says that she enjoys her business, because its has given her pride, and because she ready enjoys the interactions with her customers. She faces a problem when other people ask her for help to improve their lives, especially if she doesn't have the means to meet their requests. She is requesting a loan to purchase more lappa to expand her business. Her future plan is to expand her business and become an international investor.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa (traditional clothing) to expand her business.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Bernadette works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and farming sugar cane. She is requesting a loan for PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her fishing business. Bernadette has successfully expanded this business with 16 prior loans from NWTF and hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 31 years old and married with one child.

Eva works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, canned goods, and snack foods that she can resell in her store.

Eva has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns income from food vending.

Eva aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items for resale, such as shampoo, canned goods, and snack foods.

loans.name: Nazaria

texts.en:
Nazaria is 57 years old and married.

Nazaria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell at her store.

Nazaria has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Nazaria aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Shellie

texts.en: Shellie is 27 years old. She is married and lives in New Kru Town, along with her two children, aged 5 and 12, who are in school. Shellie is a high school graduate. She used the money that she received from her graduation program to establish her business. She manage her resulting small income to open a shop where she sells radios and other items. Shellie enjoys the respect and trust that her business has given her and, most importantly, she has a very happy home. She is requesting a loan to buy more radios and other items for her business. Her  future plan is to expand her business and build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more radios and other items for her business.

loans.name: Nelvyn

texts.en:
Nelvyn is 43 years old, married, and has one child.

Nelvyn earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Nelvyn has been raising pigs for six years, and she earns additional income from a bakery.

She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Yves

texts.fr: Yves un un jeune Camerounais âgé de 28 ans.  il est père de 03 enfants dont l'age varie entre 09 mois et 05 ans, deux allant à l'école.jeune dynamique, Yves fait dans la soudure métallique depuis 07 ans avec une clientèle fidèle et comblée. afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle, il souhaite acheter une meule électrique. il a pour ambition, ouvrir une autre structure et devenir plu tard une société.
texts.en: Yves is a young Cameroonian, 28 years old, and the father of three children, who are from 9 months to 5 years old and who go to school. Young and energetic, Yves has been a welder for seven years and has a complete and loyal customer base. To respond better to their needs, he would like to purchase an electric grinder. His ambition is to start another organization and to incorporate later on.

loans.use: to purchase an electric grinder

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa works hard to support her family. Ma. Luisa is married and has a buying and selling of spices/vegetables business in the Philippines.

Ma. Luisa requested a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional spices/vegetables to sell like tomatoes, onions, garlic, etc.

Ma. Luisa has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Ma. Luisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional spices and vegetables to sell like tomatoes, onions, garlic, etc.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Amelita works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling school and office supplies in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from food vending. Amelita is borrowing 17000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock, such as paper pads, ballpoint pens, crayons, plastic sleeves, etc., for her business.

Amelita has been sustaining her business activities through the past ten loans with loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, such as paper pads, ballpoint pens, crayons, plastic sleeves, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is a hard working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 14000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell in her business.

Emelita has been in this business for 20 years. Emelita earns additional income by growing rice.

Emelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.en:
Mahfirat is 37 years old and married. Her husband’s name is Bakhtier. They have 3 children for whom Mahfirat always wants to provide good living conditions.

She sells food items to earn a living. She has been in business for 6 years. Through the financial support of Imon International, she has managed to grow her business. She dreams of expanding her business even more and becoming prosperous in the future. She needs a loan to of 5000 TJS to widen the assortment of food items on sale in her store. She looks forward to your help.

loans.use: to widen the assortment of food items in her store.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a hard working entrepreneur who has an electronics shop in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials and equipment for her business.

Fatima has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from fish vending and by growing coconuts.

Fatima has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and equipment for her electronics shop.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.fr: Agnes est une dame âgée de 55 ans, célibataire et mère de 08 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 11 et 32 ans et parmi lesquels 04 vont encore à l'école. elle a comme activité un petit restaurant dans laquelle elle fait des beignets, haricots, bouillie depuis 10 ans. elle bénéficie de ce fait d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine, ce qui lui a permit de constituer un portefeuille clientèle considérable. elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter 02 sacs de farine, 20 litres d'huile raffinée, 03 sceaux de haricots afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. elle a pour ambition d'agrandir son restaurant.
texts.en: Agnes is a 55-year-old lady, unmarried, and the mother of eight children, from 11 to 32 years old. Four of the children are still in school. Agnes has had a restaurant for ten years where she makes beignets, beans, and porridge. She benefits from her good experience in this domain, and this has enabled her to build up a considerable customer base. She would like to use this loan to purchase 2 sacks of flour, 20 liters of fine oil, and 3 buckets of beans in order to respond better to the demands of her customers. The revenues generated will enable her to support her family better. Her ambition is to expand her restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase flour, oil, and beans for her restaurant

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Jasmin requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fish nets and other equipment for her business.

Jasmin has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Jasmin would like to save enough so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

loans.name: Jarieu

texts.en:
This is 60-year-old Jarieu  from Torkpoi, Sierra Leone. She is widowed with 5 children between the ages of 20 and 43. She began this business to have a permanent source of income 

Jarieu runs a general store at her house. She sells palm oil and charcoal. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business every day from morning to night, even when customers come to buy at night she will sell. She also receives financial support from her elder children. She says that the main challenge to her business is sometimes business is very slow.

Jarieu has requested a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and charcoal. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve level of living. In the future, she plans to open a shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Candace

texts.en:
Candace’s interest in ethnic cultures was first seeded by her African heritage. Her interest in various ethnic cultures and ethnic products further developed when she began to experience more and more various types of cultures while coordinating and participating in swap meets and yard sales.   

In 2009, Candace was put on work disability, and in order to supplement her income, she decided to combine her passion for retail and culture by opening Ethnicity’s Unique Boutique.  

Her home-based business began to grow and she tapped into business educational resources through the Entrepreneur Academy at the Southeastern Economic Development Corporation (SEDC).  Through the SEDC, Candace learned about Accion’s microloan program and was able to secure a loan to purchase a computer and additional inventory.   Since then, Candace has repaid her first Accion loan and has expanded her business into a retail storefront in San Diego.  

Candace would like to further expand her business by attracting new customers through a storefront improvement process and marketing campaigns. Candace will use her $10,000 Kiva loan to make much needed storefront improvements, design new marketing materials and build a website.   

She hopes that these improvements will allow her to continue to enhance her community’s rich cultural diversity through the unique ethnic art, home décor and accessories she offers at her store. 

Check out her Facebook page at: www.facebook.com/EthnicitysUniqueBoutiqueSanDiego

loans.use: to make storefront improvements, design new marketing materials and build a website.

loans.name: Lailanie

texts.en:
Lailanie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines.

Lailanie requested a loan of 18000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional dry goods to sell. She has been in this business for 11 years.

In the future, Lailanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a hard working entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29500 PHP through NWTF to purchase fishing materials for her business.

Loreta has been in this business for 2 years. She earns additional income from selling dried fish and from motorcycle transport.

Loreta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a jeepney transportation business in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a 11,000 PHP (Phillipines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy new tools, equipment and spare parts.

She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools, equipment and spare parts.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark is 30 years old. He is married and has a 12-year-old daughter. He owns a grocery shop and offers mobile money transfers in Mwandi, a village located in the southwestern corner of Zambia. 

Mark says he loves running his business because he likes bringing new products to his customers. One of the products he offers in his grocery shop is mobile money transfers. This is the sending and receiving of money. He has been offering this service for two years now.  His customers are mostly local fishermen and some officials from the king’s palace. 

Mark is very grateful for the opportunity to be on Kiva and possibly get his loan funded because he is not able to get a loan from a commercial bank. This is due to the fact that his hometown of Mwandi is under customary laws and therefore his shop has no title deed, which is a requirement for banks to issue loans.

When Mark gets his loan, he would like to expand his business by opening another grocery and mobile money transfer shop in a nearby village called Sichili. He is convinced that this will help him grow his business, because there are a lot of people who come to his shop wanting to send money to Sichili but there is no mobile money transfer outlet there. 

Mark thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To open another shop in a nearby village.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
This is Mary Grace, 29, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Rommel and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mary Grace operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mary Grace hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams to have a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 42 years old, married, and has four children.

Lilibeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell.

Lilibeth has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Lilibeth aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Sarana

texts.en:
Sarana is a hard working entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, such as shampoo, noodles, groceries, etc.

Sarana has been in this business for 5 years. She earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Sarana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, such as shampoo, noodles, groceries, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more meat to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Arematea

texts.en: Arematea is 61 years old, married and has four children. She works very hard to provide for them by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for six years and would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
This is Lilian. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase fertilizers and gardening inputs needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan she will be using the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and other tools for maintenance of the farm. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lilian dreams of growing her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, seeds and other tools for maintenance of the farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to use in making snacks.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa works hard to support her family. Celsa is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Celsa requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like noodles, canned goods, sugar, soap, etc., in her general store.

Celsa has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Celsa would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like noodles, can goods, sugar, soap, etc., in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages for her shop

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 60 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Clarita has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Clarita requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

Clarita has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Clarita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Maamuu

texts.en: Mr. Maamuu is 48 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a newly-built house in Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife works in a hospital as a housekeeper and his two children attend secondary school. He has been employed as woodman in a private company, but is now starting his own furniture-making company in a spare room of his house. He is very experienced at this trade and is well-known within the industry. He has already received orders worth 700,000 MNT, but doesn't yet have inventory and other tools. He is requesting a loan for 3,000,000 MNT to invest in his new business. He is a diligent and hardworking man who says that "I will try my best not to disappoint my customers."

loans.use: to invest in a new business making wooden furniture.

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: Louise est une dame âgée de 45 ans, célibataire et mère de deux enfants respectivement âgés de 19 et 21 ans. tous les deux vont à l'école. elle mène une activité de vente d'eau et de glace dans un marché de la ville depuis 05 ans déjà. concrètement elle achète de l'eau potable qu'elle transforme une partie en glace et conditionne l'autre dans des bouteilles plastiques et sachets qu'elle revend par la suite. elle voudrait ce crédit pour acheter des bouteilles et de plastiques d'emballage qu'elle utilise pour le conditionnement. elle compte ainsi mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants avec les revenus générés.
texts.en: Louise is a 45-year-old lady, unmarried, and the mother of two children, aged 19 and 21, who both go to school. Louise has been running a business selling water and ice at a market in town for five years already. In concrete terms, she purchases potable water and converts some into ice and refrigerates the rest in plastic bottles and pouches that she sells retail. She would like to use this loan to purchase bottles and plastic wrapping materials, which she uses for her products. She thus plans to do better in meeting the needs of her children with the revenues generated.

loans.use: to purchase wrapping material and plastic bottles

loans.name: Nelmalita

texts.en:
This is Nelmalita, 51, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Santos, a driver, and is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nelmalita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, it is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nelmalita dreams of having a good life through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Noselyn

texts.en:
This is Noselyn, 41, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Norberto, a worker abroad, and is a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Noselyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, it is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
This is Anecita, 53, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Gilbert, a carpenter and father to her children. She manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Anecita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Anecita hopes to expand her business and dreams of giving her children a high-quality education through all her hard work with her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. With them, she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Arnelfa

texts.en:
This is Arnelfa, 33, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Neil, a policeman, and she is a mother.  Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Arnelfa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP loan of 30,000. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Arnelfa hopes to expand her business, and dreams of having a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and she draws strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cassava chips to resell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
This is Elsa, 39, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Candelario and mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Elsa is a mineral water distributor. She buys mineral water in containers from wholesalers and then sells the containers (5 gallons per container) at a profit. Her regular customers for her mineral water are her neighbors and the local community.  She has a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of mineral water to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Elsa dreams of being able to give her all her children a high-quality education and hopes to have her own vehicle through all her hard work with her business. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that they study.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stocks of mineral water to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to resell

loans.name: Suzane Ceraphine

texts.fr: Suzanne est une femme de 39 ans mariée mère de 7 enfants, l'un d'entre eux va encore à l'école. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place depuis 15 ans déjà. Elle vend les vivres frais( maniocs,macabos, patates... )selon les saisons.la vente des plantains est une activité qui rapporte, mais la petitesse de son stock de marchandises entraine de nombreuses ruptures et ne lui permet pas de satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle. Ce crédit lui permettra alors de s'approvisionner en grande quantité afin de répondre à la demande de ses clients et de ce fait d'augmenter ses ventes et son bénéfice. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité afin de devenir grossiste dans la vente des plantains et l'autre pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (nutrition et éducation).
texts.en: Suzanne is a 39-year-old woman and the married mother of seven children, of whom one is still in school. Suzanne has been a merchant at a local market for fifteen years already. She sells staple foods (cassava, taro, sweet potatoes…) according to the season. The sale of plantains is a business that brings in money, but the low level of her inventory leads to numerous shortages preventing her from satisfy her customers appropriately. This loan will thus enable her to stock up on large amounts, so as to respond to customers demand and to increase her sales and profits. She will reinvest part of the profits in her business in order to become a wholesaler of plantains. And the rest is for meeting the needs of her family (nutrition and education).

loans.use: to purchase plantains to sell

loans.name: Tseveen

texts.en: Tseveen is 48 years old and lives with her two children in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her son Nyamsambuu, 20, is a university student and daughter Demberelm, 24, is helping her mother start a boot manufacturing business. Tseveen has been working for a private company for years and obtained much experience manufacturing traditional boots and shoes. She is starting her own business making traditional winter boots with her daughter in a spare room of her house. She is taking orders from customers and produces boots by order. She is now requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to purchase equipment and inventory to fill orders she already has received. She has a good record with her bank statement. She is a hardworking and honest person who says, "I want to expand my business and boost my profit to help my children to get educated and be able to live on their own.".

loans.use: to purchase equipment and inventory to meet orders she has already received.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita, who previously accessed a 14,000 PHP loan to purchase farm inputs needed in her ornamental plant-growing business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer, seed and tools for maintenance of the farm. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lolita hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Nazaria

texts.en:
Nazaria previously accessed a 27,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products for her retail business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in more profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nazaria hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
Richard, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de su mamá ocupando una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como conductor de un vehículo de pasajeros ayudando con los gastos de su hogar.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de repuestos como pastillas para frenos y líquidos de transmisión, de frenos y mantenimiento general de su vehículo.
El sueño de Richard es independizarse y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Richard is single and has no children. He lives in one of the rooms of his mother's home. The house is located in the Villa Nuevo Potosí area of the city of La Paz. He currently works as a driver of a passenger vehicle and helps out with the household expenses. 

He needs a loan to pay for parts like break pads and transmission and break fluids, as well as general maintenance of his vehicle. 

Richard's dream is to become independent and improve his quality of life. This is the first loan he has requested from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of maintenance and to purchase break and transmission fluids for his passenger transport vehicle.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Julienne est une dame âgée de 56 ans, mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont le moins âgé a 18 ans et parmi lesquels 03 vont encore à l'école. elle mène une activité de vente de produits alimentaires dans un marché de la ville depuis de 15 ans déjà, ceci elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. ce qui lui a permit d'avoir un portefeuille clientèle considérable dont la petitesse de ses fonds et par ricochet de son stock de marchandise n'arrivent plus à satisfaire les besoins. Elle voudrait ainsi avec ce crédit acheter 02 sacs d'arachide et 02 sacs de haricot afin de renforcer son stock. les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins scolaires de ses enfants. elle rêve d'avoir un jour un grand comptoir bien achalandé.
texts.en: Julienne is a 56-year-old lady and the married mother of ten children, of whom the youngest is 18 years old; three of them are still going to school. Julienne has been running a business selling food at a market in town for fifteen years already. She benefits from good experience in this domain, and this has enabled her to have a considerable range of customers. The low level of her funds and consequently her stock of merchandise no longer meets the need. She would thus like to use this loan to purchase 2 sacks of peanuts and 2 sacks of beans to bolster her stock. The revenues generated will allow her to meet the schooling needs of her children. She dreams one day of having a large well-stocked stall.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts and beans

loans.name: Leotina

texts.en:
This is Leotina, 49, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother. She manages the household while operating the business.  She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Leotina operates a buy and sell business. What she does is buy biscuits from a wholesaler, then sells them to customers for a profit.  She also has a rug-making business for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 350 in sales daily.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP loan of 15,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of biscuits to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Leotina hopes her business will grow in the coming years, and dreams of expanding her business through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and she draws strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of biscuits to expand the inventory in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jannette

texts.fr: Jannette est une femme  de 39 ans divorcée mère de 5 enfants font l'age varie entre 12 et 24 ans, 3 d'entre eux vont encore à l'école. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place depuis 4 ans déjà. Elle vend les vivres frais(plantains, maniocs, bananes et le manioc)selon les saisons.la vente des plantains est une activité qui rapporte, mais la petitesse de son stock de marchandises entraine de nombreuses ruptures et ne lui permet pas de satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle. Ce crédit lui permettra alors de s'approvisionner en grande quantité afin de répondre à la demande de ses clients et de ce fait d'augmenter ses ventes et son bénéfice. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité afin de devenir grossiste dans la vente des plantains et l'autre pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (nutrition et éducation).
texts.en: Jannette is a 39-year-old woman who is a divorced mother of five children, from 12 to 24 years old. Three of the children are still in school. Jannette has been a merchant at a local market for four year already. She sells fresh staple foods (plantains, cassava, and bananas) according to the season. Selling plantains is a business that brings in money, but the low level of her stock of merchandise leads to numerous shortage and no longer satisfies her customers appropriately. This loan will thus enable her to stock up on large amounts, so as to respond better to customer demands and to increase her sales and her profits. She will reinvest part of the profits in her business to become a wholesaler of plantains. And the rest will be for meeting the needs of her family (nutrition and education).

loans.use: to purchase plantains, cassava, and fruit

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is a 34-year-old woman, married and the mother of five children whose ages range from one to fifteen years old. Four of the children are already in school.

Fotima has been selling cattle at a local market for sixteen years. Thanks to her good experience in this field and her influence over her suppliers, she is able to obtain goods for retail but it brings in little income. It does not allow her to fully provide for the needs of her family and repair her house. Her family is large and is planning a big, new house.

This loan will help her buy building materials to repair her house. In this way she will provide a higher quality of living condition for her family and put an end to the problems with house.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing her house

loans.name: Byambajargal

texts.en:
Mr. Byambajargal is 25 years old, and lives with his mother and two siblings in Tosontsengel, Zavhan province of Mongolia. He has been managing cattle since 2011 with his mother. 

His mother takes care of the milking, and producing dairy products. His mother milks 30-40 liters per day. He handles the breeding of the cattle, and preparing the grass and food for the cattle, etc.

He is planning to expand his business into a bigger farm, and to own land to breed cattle and harvest grass to feed the cattle. He is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase forage (food) and grass (hay) for the cattle in preparation for the harsh Mongolian winter. He is a hardworking and welcoming person.

loans.use: To purchase forage and grass for cattle in preparation for the harsh Mongolian winter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Samad

texts.en: A kind man named Samad lives in a house in bad condition. He is 23 years old, not married, and lives with his parents. His parents are kind people who work at the local factory and have very small salaries.  Samad wants to marry this year, but first he must repair the roof of the home and then replace doors and windows. He is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to repair his house. He awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: to buy cement and wood for home repairs

loans.name: Tohir

texts.en: Tohir is married and has a child. He is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life to his children. Tohir began his own business dealing in animal husbandry five years ago. He requested a loan in the amount of 800 USD to increase the number of animals he has for sale. He hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan since it will be used to improve his family's income.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Adèle Téclaire

texts.fr: Adèle est une femme camerounaise âgée de 53 ans. célibataire et mère d'un enfants de 35 ans, adèle a à sa charge deux personnes.elle a un comptoir dans un marché de la place où elle vend des crevettes sèches, les arachides, le haricot et les épices. Elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine car initiée au commerce par sa mère dès le bas âge. elle voudrait avec ce crédit, acheter 02 sacs de crevettes et des épices. Adèle a comme ambition , avoir un grand comptoir bien achalandé et plu tard acheter un terrain.
texts.en: Adèle is a Cameroonian, 53  years old, unmarried, and the mother of one child, who is 35 years old. Adèle supports two persons. She has a table at a local market, where she sells dried shrimp, peanuts, beans, and spices. She benefits from good experience in this domain, since she was initiated in commerce at a young age by her mother. She would like to use this loan to purchase 2 sacks of shrimp and some spices. Adèle's ambitions include having a large well-stocked table and buying a plot of land later on.

loans.use: to bolster her stock of shrimp and spices to sell

loans.name: Juluis Kacha

texts.fr: Juluis est un jeune homme de 37 marié, père de 5 enfants dont l'age varie entre 1 et 18 ans.  4 de ses enfant vont à l'école, il a aussi deux autres personnes à sa charge.IL est commerçant et vend en même temps  pièces détachés pour motos dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 6 ans. Son petit commerce fonctionne mais il manque de capital pour augmenter les stocks de marchandises d'où la necessité de ce crédit qui lui permettra d'augmenter le stock des pièces détachées. Ceci augmentera ses ventes et donc son bénéfices qu'il épargnera pour réinvestir dans son activité pour l'agrandir et aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Julius is a 37-year old man, married and the father of five children ranging from one to 18 years of age. Four of his children are in school. He also has two other persons in his care. He is a vendor and has been selling spare motorcycle part in a district of the capital city for six years. His small business functions well, but he lacks capital to expand his merchandise stock, which is why he needs this loan in order to expand his stock of spare parts. This will increase his sales and thus his revenues, which he will use to reinvest in his business so as to grow it further and also to provide for family needs.

loans.use: to expand his stock of motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, tiene la edad 32 de  años, está casado y vive con la esposa actualmente. El  pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de concentrado  para el engorde de los mismos. El cuenta con varios cerdos a su poder y lo que pretende es reforzar el negocio y  darle alimentación con concentrado para su engorde más rápido. El quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y de la familia  y crecer con el proyecto de cerdos de engorde. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Carlos, 32, is married and currently lives with his wife.  With this loan, he plans to buy feed to fatten his pigs.  He owns a number of pigs, and with this loan he plans to strengthen his business by feeding them with concentrate so they will fatten more quickly.  He wants to get his animals to the ideal weight so that he can later sell them in the town market, or in the surrounding areas.  With this activity of raising pigs to fatten, he wants to generate more income for himself and for his family's welfare.  This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  Prior to this, he had not taken loans from the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan that has easier payments terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed for his pigs

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Faustino, es casado y tiene seis hijos de los cuales dos ya son independientes cuatro están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Alto Llojeta de la ciudad de la Paz.

El estudió solo hasta la primaria y actualmente trabaja por más de ocho horas al día, vendiendo ladrillos junto a su esposa ya que debe cubrir los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicio s básicos de su familia.

El crédito lo requiere para la compra de arena, cemento y ladrillos para el amurallado de su vivienda ya que desea dar más seguridad y comodidad a su familia.

El sueño de Faustino es construir más habitaciones para mejorar su calidad de vida.

Es la primera vez que tiene el crédito  con IMPRO y la primera con KIVA.
texts.en:
Faustino is married and has six children. Two of them are already independent and four of them are of school age. Faustino and his family live in their own home, which consists of two rooms that have brick walls and dirt floors. The house is located in the District of Alto Llojeta in the city of La Paz.

Faustino only has an elementary school education. He currently works more than eight hours a day selling bricks with his wife. This enables them to cover the cost of education, food, and basic services for their family.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy sand, cement, and bricks so that he can build a wall around his house. He wants to provide more security and comfort for his family.

Faustino’s dream is to build more rooms so that he can improve his family’s quality of life. This is the first time he has received a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bricks so that he can build a security wall around his home.

loans.name: Altanchimeg

texts.en: Mr. Altanchimeg lives with his wife and two children in a ger in Uvs province of Mongolia. He is married and his wife Tsetsgee is 46 years old. His two sons are secondary school students. His wife is a shoemaker in a private company. She has worked in the shoe manufacturing company for years so she has lot of experience in this industry. He is planning to manufacture traditional winter boots with his wife. He is going to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city, to purchase inventory and equipment for his newly starting business, and he needs 1,000,000 MNT to purchase raw materials and tools for this new business. He also is planning to rent a workplace. He is a hardworking and neat man.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and tools for his new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Ramon Armando

texts.es:
Ramón es un hombre de 45 años y cursó la escuela primaria, vive con su pareja Angela quien tiene 33 años y trabaja en los quehaceres del hogar, tienen 3 hijos que están cursando la escuela primaria Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una provincia de Ecuador que en los últimos años ha tenido un alto crecimiento sostenido. Su capital  es una ciudad en donde lo más atractivo y llamativo son sus deliciosas frutas, y la gastronomía que ofrecen en el lugar. También cuenta con un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Además cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos que acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Es por esto que la mayoría de sus habitantes han emprendido con alguna actividad comercial. 
Uno de estos emprendedores es Ramón que hace 4 años decidió dar el paso decisivo para ejercer la venta de artículos para el hogar y de uso personal, que aprendió de manera empírica y lo realiza desde hace 10 años de forma ambulante caminando por las principales calles y carreteras de la ciudad, en esta ocasión él desea también proveer al sector rural para incrementar sus clientes y generar más ventas. Ramón es cliente de Fundación Alternativa desde hace un año, él se siente satisfecho con la asesoría que le brindan y con la agilidad en la aprobación de los créditos, es por eso que ahora nuevamente requiere un préstamo para comprar mercadería que le permita diversificar la oferta de productos que tiene. Ramón espera que con este incremento de su negocio pueda obtener los ingresos suficientes para tener un ahorro para poder construir su casa con las seguridades adecuadas.
texts.en:
Ramón is a 45 year old man who went to elementary school and lives with his partner Angela who is 33 and works as a domestic laborer.  They have three children who are attending a primary school in Santo Domingo, the capital of the province of Santo Domingo of Tsáchilas, a province of Ecuador that has in recent years had a sustained population growth. The capital is a city where the most attractive and appealing of its benefits are its delicious fruits and the rich cuisine that can be found in this region.  It also has considerable trade, as it has become a commercial hub between the mountainous and coastal regions of the country.  The city also has many tourist attractions that together with its warm climate make this an attractive destination for both domestic and foreign tourists. That is why most of the residents engage in a commercial activity.

One of these entrepreneurs is Ramón, who more than 4 years ago decided to take the plunge to engage in the sale of household and personal care goods, and he learned how to do this work through practical experience, which he gained during the course of 10 years of door to door street sales, walking down the main streets and roads of the city.  At this time, he wants to also engage with the rural sector to increase his customer base and generate more sales.  Ramón has been a client of Fundación Alternativa for a year, and he is satisfied with the advice they give and the facility of gaining loan approval.  That's why he now requires a loan to buy merchandise that would allow him to diversify the types of products he carries. Ramón hopes that with this increase in his business, he will be able to gain enough revenue to build his savings and build a home with decent security.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
