Sebaco is a very important city in Nicaragua due to its high productivity and its geographical location. This is where Eva María lives. She is a woman who is always eager to overcome any financial adverse situations that may arise in life. She is a single mother with three children. Two of them are in high school and are studying hard.

Eva is a brave, enterprising, and charismatic woman and all of these positive traits make her a good person. She currently works for a local company as a caretaker. She has been covering her family's expenses with her salary for over seventeen years.

She will use this loan to purchase sand and cement and pay for labor. She needs to make improvements in her home because it is a bit damaged but she wants to thank Ceprodel and Kiva for supporting her with this loan. It will be of great help to her because she will be able to provide more comfort and safety for her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like sand and cement and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 44 años de edad, es casada, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y a sus hijos. La zona en donde viven en un caserío ubicado a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque. La provincia de Lambayeque se encuentra a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La actividad que realiza es la crianza y venta de animales, ella cría cerdos, ovejas, cabras y aves de corral, los cuales negocia quincenalmente en los  mercados de Chiclayo y Lambayeque. Yolanda cría sus animales en corrales ubicados en la parte exterior de su domicilio. Su esposo trabaja como agricultor y con los ingresos que ambos obtienen tratan de sacar adelante a su familia

Yolanda desea comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales de modo que pueda agenciarse de mayores ingresos, sobretodo en esta temporada, que es cuando sus ventas aumentan debido a la proximidad de las fiestas navideñas.  Para lograr su objetivo, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Yolanda ya ha tenido créditos financiados a través de Kiva anteriormente, con ellos pudo sacar adelante su negocio y con sus ganancias, realizó algunas mejoras en su vivienda. Ella se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que le apoyaron en aquella oportunidad y agradece de antemano a las personas que le ayudarán ahora.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 44, is married living in her own house with her husband and children.  The zone they live in is a settlement located ten minutes from the city of Lambayeque.  Lambayeque Province is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Her activity is raising animals to sell; she raises pigs, sheep, goats and barnyard fowl that she sells bi-weekly in markets in Chiclayo and Lambayeque.  Yolanda raises her animals in corrals located in her yard.  Her husband works in agriculture and with the income they both earn they try to move their family forward.

Yolanda wants to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed so that she can earn higher income above all this season when sales increase due to the approaching Christmas festivities.  To reach her objective, she’s thought it convenient to request a 1,500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

Yolanda has had previous loans through Kiva and was able to move her business ahead with them and used profits to do some home improvements.  She’s quite grateful to the people who supported her on that occasion and gives thanks in advance to those who will help her now.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Juana Emérita

texts.es:
Juana tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo en la zona urbana del distrito de Mochumí, un distrito predominantemente agrícola y que se encuenta conformado por varios caseríos considerados como rurales, lo cual indica que su población no cuenta con servicios básicos.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio desde hace seis años, en donde ofrece al público en general diversos productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes, productos de belleza y carne de animales que ella misma cría. El negocio provee a sus vecinos y pobladores de la zona de productos de consumo diario por lo que siempre cuenta con clientela estable. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para apoyar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Juana se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles que le permitan seguir adquiriendo productos para mantener su negocio, asimismo desea realizar algunas mejoras en su local. Ella agradece de antemano a las personas que le apoyan a lograr este objetivo a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Juana is 54 years old and married. She lives with her husband in the urban area of Mochumí, which is a predominantly agricultural district comprising several communities which are considered rural, which indicates their inhabitants don't have basic services.

She has had a grocery store set up in her home for six years, where she offers the public a variety of essential goods, groceries, beauty products, and meat from the animals she raises herself. Her business supplies her neighbors and the local residents with their basic staples, so she always has a stable customer base. The income she obtains from her business allows her to help her husband provide for their household.

Juana is requesting a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles, which will allow her to continue purchasing products to maintain her business. She also wants to make improvements to her store. She wants to thank in advance all of the people who are helping her achieve this goal through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to expand her business and improve her store.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres actualmente. Con el crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos, fumigantes, y a su vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. El piensa dar mantenimiento a las plantaciones de café con productos especiales, y contratar personal para que le colaboren con la labores de asistencia, para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y asi con su proyecto cafetalero poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia. Luis, un hombre sobresaliente y caracterizado en su pueblo por tener un gran espíritu trabajador,  no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ni dichos contratos, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Luis, 20, is single and currently lives with his parents.  With the loan he plans to buy supplies such as fertilizer and fumigants, as well as help pay for labor.  He plans to maintain his coffee crops with special products and hire workers to help with the labor so the crop suffers no harm or loss.  This way his coffee-producing project will be able to generate more income to help his family.

Luis is an outstanding man known in his town for his great hardworking spirit.  He doesn't have the necessary capital for his purchase or for labor because he has a low income and no way to get the necessary money.  This is why he requested a loan, and it's the first one he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He had not had other loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the coffee crop

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru:
Малохат жительница города Худжанд. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж вместе со старшим сыном находятся на заработках за рубежом. Сноха Малохат портниха, она занимается шитьем. 
Малохат занимается животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Малохат создала условия для разведения скота, также она закупила корм для скота. Животноводством Малохат занимается пятнадцать лет. На сегодняшний день у нее дома одна корова, которая обеспечивает семью молоком. Кроме того у Малохат 1 гектар плодородной земли, где она сеет пшеницу для продажи.  
Малохат берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en:
Malohat is a resident of the city of Khujand. She is 48 years old and married. She has three children. Her husband together with her oldest son are migrant workers abroad. Malohat's daughter-in-law is a dressmaker, she works with sewing.

Malohat is engaged in livestock breeding. She breeds cattle at her home. Malohat created conditions for breeding cattle, and further she purchased fodder for cattle. She has been working in livestock breeding for 15 years. She currently has a cow, which provides the family with milk, at her home. Apart from this Malohat has one hectare of fertile land, where she sows wheat for sale. 

Malohat takes a loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase steers and calves

loans.name: Gricelda Yamileth

texts.es:
Griselda se dedica  a su negocio de granja de pollos.Tiene veinticuatro años de edad, tiene un hijo de tres años de edad, está acompañada vive en casa propia, la granja de pollos le permite obtener los ingresos necesarios para sobre vivir, tiene dos años de dedicarse a este rubro, lo aprendió por iniciativa  propia  y puso el negocio con su esposo.
Esta solicitando un préstamo ya que necesita comprar pollos de engorde y concentrado, para incrementar  el inventario  de pollos para aumentar sus ventas. Sus sueños y aspiraciones  es mejorar sus condiciones  económicas  y gracias  a la inversión que realizara con el crédito  de kiva el espera que lo lograra.
texts.en:
Gricelda has a business raising chickens. She is 24 years old, and has a three-year-old son. She lives with her partner in her own house. 

The poultry business allows her to earn the necessary income to survive, and she has been working in this area for two years. She learned it on her own initiative, and set up the business with her husband.

She is requesting a loan, as she needs to buy chickens for fattening, as well as feed concentrate, so that she can increase her inventory of chickens. This is in order to increase her sales. 

Her dreams and ambitions are to improve her financial circumstances, and thanks to the investment she will make with the Kiva loan, she hopes she will achieve it.

loans.use: To buy chickens for fattening, as well as feed concentrate.

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.ru: Мукарам жительница города Худжанд. Она замужем. Ей 54 года. У нее трое детей. Мукарам на протяжении десяти лет занимается животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Мукарам в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Она берет кредит для закупа бычков, телят и коровы.
texts.en:
Mukaram is a resident of the city of Khujand. She is 54 years old and married. She has three children.

Mukaram has been working with livestock breeding for a period of ten years. She breeds cattle at her home. Mukaram mainly breeds cattle to sell in the future. She takes a loan for the purchase of steers, calves and cows.

loans.use: to purchase steers, calves and cows.

loans.name: Milagro

texts.es:
Milagro, solicita un préstamo para la compra de telas, en variedad de colores y estilos, esta es la materia prima mas importante para la elaboración de trajes, le ayudara a mejorar su atención a los clientes y los ingresos que estos le generan. 
Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio, mejorar su calidad de vida con su familia.
texts.en: Milagro requests a loan to buy fabric in a variety of colors and styles.  This is the most important raw material used to manufacture outfits.  It will help her improve customer service and the income they generate.  Her hope is to make the business grow and to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: María Lizbeth

texts.es:
María Lizbeth
Venta por catálogo 
350000

	María Lizbeth tiene 38 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de San Pedro de Poas, lugar ubicado en las faldas del Volcán que lleva el mismo nombre. Ha trabajado con el Banco Mujer Emprendedoras de Chilamate, pero en esta oportunidad, y para apoyar su nueva actividad opta por un préstamo individual. Vive con su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad quién está en primaria y secundaria.
	 Ella se levanta muy temprano,  le alista la comida a su esposo  para su trabajo y envía al niño a la escuela, luego realiza los oficios domésticos  y en la tarde se dedica a la venta por catálogo y cobro a sus clientes, así como recoger mercadería.
	Su actividad principal es la venta de catálogo, con las ganancias de este negocio ha ido comprando productos de otros catálogos. Esta  actividad que le da un ingreso adicional a su hogar vendiendo en la comunidad. Ante el éxito tenido se desea invertir este crédito para ampliar la gama de productos ofrecidos  a sus clientes.
	Dentro de sus metas esta poder organizarse para llegar a tener un negocio más grande y estable, ya que una de sus debilidades es la parte de mercadeo, ella quiere negociar mejor sus contratos y así obtener un mayor ingreso para su familia. Hasta la fecha su negocio va muy bien.
texts.en:
María Lizbeth
Catalogue Sales
350000

María Lizbeth, 38, lives in the community of San Pedro de Poas, a place located on the skirts of the volcano of the same name.  She has worked with Banco Mujer’s “Emprendedoras de Chilamate” communal bank in the past but on this occasion to support her new activity she’s opting for an individual loan.  She lives with her husband and two minor children who attend elementary and secondary school.

She rises very early to prepare her husband’s food for work and send her son to school.  Then she does her housework and in the afternoon she sells via catalogue and collects payments; she also picks up merchandise.

Her main activity is catalogue sales and with profits from this business she’s been buying other catalogue products.  This activity of selling in the community produces additional household income.  In face of the success she’s had, she wants to invest this loan to expand the range of products she has to offer her customers.

Among her goals is to become organized enough to have a larger, more stable business because one of her weaknesses is the area of marketing.  She wants to negotiate her contracts better to earn higher income for her family.  To date her business has been going very well.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, clothes, cosmetics and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two computers and a  professional digital camera for video production

loans.name: Jose Gudiel

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, debido a la buena atención que recibió y necesita comprarse insumos agrícolas, ya que está realizando una nueva siembra, comprándose 7 sacos de abono, pago de mano de obra.
Con el préstamo anterior incremento su rentabilidad, porque tuvo una buena producción de granos básicos, en su familia se encuentran bien, ha logrado fortalecer la venta de granos básicos, aumentar sus ingresos gracias al crédito con Kiva.
texts.en: José has opted for a new loan because of the good attention he received; he needs to buy farm supplies because he’s starting a new planting cycle.  He will buy seven sacks of manure and pay labor costs. His previous loan increased his profits because he had a good crop yield of basic grains.  His family is all well.  He’s succeeded in strengthening the sale of basic grains and to increase his income thanks to the Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy seven sacks of manure and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Jose Fredy

texts.es:
José, necesita invertir nuevamente en su cultivo, por esto solicita un préstamo para comprarse los materiales le ayudan a mejorar la producción, comprara 5 sacos de abono, insecticidas, y otros materiales.
Él considera que el préstamo anterior le dio un efecto positivo al cultivo ya que aumentó la producción y  tuvo mejores ingresos por las ventas, en su familia se encuentran muy bien, todo a través de Kiva.
texts.en: José needs to invest in his crops again which is why he’s requesting a loan to buy supplies that will help him improve production.  He will buy five sacks of manure, insecticide and other supplies.  He feels his previous loan had a positive effect in that he increased production and earned higher income through sales.  His family is very well thanks to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of manure, insecticide and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sandals and clothes.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, vive con sus abuelos, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, tiene veintidós años, está acompañado y tiene una niña  de dos años de edad,  trabaja en lo propio  y aprendió el trabajo con su padre.
Esta solicitado un crédito Ya que necesita comprar los insumos para el cultivo de maiz como lo es seis sacos de abono para aplicarlos al cultivo, este credito le ayudara a tener el dinero necesario para invertirlo  en la producción y sacar una buena cosecha.
Su objetivo es tener una vida mejor el y su familia, gracias a la inversion que realizara con el préstamo.
texts.en:
José lives with his grandparents, he works in agriculture growing basic grains. He is twenty-two years old, lives his partner and has a two year old girl. He works for himself and learned the trade from his father.

José needs a loan to buy materials for his corn crops; he will buy 6 sacks of fertilizer to use on the corn. The loan will help him have the money necessary to invest in production and to have a good harvest.

His goal is to have a better life for himself and his family, he is grateful for the investment that he will carryout with the loan.

loans.use: buy 6 sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda, está solicitando otro préstamo  para surtir su negocio  de venta de carne, compra de hueso, lomo de res, chorizo, hígado, y otros.
Manifiesta que el crédito anterior le fue de gran ayuda ya que aumento su inventario  y las ventas resultaron bastante favorables. La familia se ha mantenido, los ingresos han mejorado y el negocio.
texts.en:
Erlinda needs another loan to stock her business where she sells meat. She will buy bones, ribs, sausages, liver and other items.

She says that the previous loan was of great help as it increased her inventory and her sales were very good. The family is doing well and income has improved as well as the business.

loans.use: buy meat, bones, ribs, sausages, liver and other items.

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es:
Jaime, está solicitando otro préstamo para la compra de semilla y preparar el terreno y la compra de insumos para la siembra como el abono y herbicidas.
Manifiesta que el crédito anterior  tuvo resultados  positivos, ya que cultivo más maíz y hoy quiere obtener buenos resultados nuevamente. La familia se ha mantenido.
texts.en:
Jaime needs another loan to buy seeds, prepare the land and buy materials for the harvest like manure and herbicides.

He says that the previous loan was beneficial since he grew more corn and he wants to have a good outcome once more. His family is doing well.

loans.use: buy seeds, prepare the land and buy materials for the harvest like manure and herbicides.

loans.name: Esla Diosana

texts.es: Esla, tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto con sus cuatro hijos en la Esperanza Intibucá. Esla tiene más de 15 años de tener su propio negocio donde vende zapatos, productos plásticos, achinería y electrodomésticos como ser: juego de ollas, sombrillas, planchas, platos etc. Este negocio lo tiene establecido en el mercado  de la comunidad. Ella ha solicitado varios prestamos para mantener su negocio activo, el préstamo que solicita actualmente es el noveno y es por 15,000 lempiras, el cual  lo va utilizar también para compra de mercadería como achinería, electrodomésticos, zapatos y otros productos que vende, ya que viene la temporada buena de ventas y quiere tener bien surtido su negocio. Su meta es mejorar las ventas y los ingresos para seguir mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Esla, 41, is a single mother who lives with her 4 children in the city of La Esperanza in the department of Intibucá.  For more than 15 year, she has had her own business selling shoes, plastic products, trinkets and appliances and household goods such as juicers, umbrellas, irons, plates, etc. Her business is established in the market in her community.  She has requested various loans to keep her business running.  The loan that she is now requesting will be her ninth, and it is for 15,000 Honduran lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy trinkets, household appliances, shoes and other products to sell, because the good season for sales is approaching and she wants to have her business well stocked.  Esla's goal is to increase her sales and her income so that she can continue to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy products (trinkets, household appliances, shoes, and plastic products) to stock her store

loans.name: María Anastacia

texts.es:
María Anastacia tiene 39 años de edad, es separada y cuenta con tres hijos dependientes, vive en el Caserío Sialupe Baca, una zona rural situada a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque. La zona es bastante humilde y sus pobladores en su mayoría se dedican a labores agrícolas.

La actividad con la que trabaja es la crianza, compra y venta de animales. Ella cría ovejas, cerdos y aves de corral, los cuales alimenta con alimentos procesados, granos y pastos naturales. María cría sus animales en corrales ubicados en el exterior de su domicilio, los cuales están hechos de adobe y los vende quincenalmente con algunos compradores que la visitan con frecuencia.

María ha solicitado un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa, su intensión es invertir en la compra de más animales así como alimento de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas durante la temporada navideña, que es cuando sus ventas suelen aumentar. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y agradece de antemano a las personas que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María Anastacia is 39 years old; she is separated and has three children who depend on her. She lives in the Sialupe Baca neighborhood, a rural area some 10 minutes from the city of Lambayeque. It is a very humble area and its inhabitants are mostly in the agricultural field.

María works breeding, buying and selling animals. She breeds sheep, pigs and fowl that are fed with processed food, grains and pastures. María cares for her animals in yards outside of her home made of adobe. She sells her animals every two weeks to some sellers who visit her home frequently.

María needs a loan of 2500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternatva, to buy more animals as well as feed to increase her sales during the Christmas season which is when sales typically increase. This is her fist loan with Kiva and is anticipatorily grateful to the people who help her reach her goals.

loans.use: Compra de más animales así como alimento balanceado.

loans.name: Mirna Lorena

texts.es:
Mirna, se dedica a la venta de comida, tiene cuarenta y siete años de edad, actualmente esta casada tiene un hijo  el cual está estudiando en la universidad, el joven tiene veinticuatro años de edad.
El comedor tiene diez años de poseerlo trabaja de lunes a domingo durante las tardes, la ventaja es que esta en una ubicación adecuada.
Está solicitando un crédito el cual lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas y otros productos para la preparación  de las comidas.
Esta compra le ayudara a mantener  más ingresos e incrementar su inventario, sus sueños y aspiraciones son: fortalecer más el negocio, y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mirna sells food. She is 47, married, and has one 24-year-old son who is in university.
She has had her cafe for ten years and works every day of the week in the afternoons. Her cafe's location is an advantage.
She is requesting a loan which she will invest in the purchase of drinks and other products for preparing her foods.
This purchase will allow her to make a greater income and expend her inventory. Her dreams and aspirations are: to strengthen her business and to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy drinks for her cafe.

loans.name: Veronica Guadalupe

texts.es:
Verónica, ha decidido optar por otro préstamo, para aumentar la venta de frutas, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de: sandia, melón, papaya, mango, piña, pepino, guayaba.
El crédito anterior resulto bastante favorable, ya que se aplico al negocio y obtuvo resultados contundentes y sus ganancias se vieron incrementadas. Ha experimentado que su calidad de vida ha cambiado y que su familia se siente en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Verónica has decided to opt for another loan, to increase the sale of fruits, which she will invest in the purchase of watermelon, melon, papaya, mango, pineapple, cucumber and guava. 

The previous loan turned out to be quite favorable as she applied it to the business, obtained conclusive results and her earnings increased.  She has experienced the change in her quality of life and her family feels itself in better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon, melón, papaya, mango, pineapple, cucumber and guava.

loans.name: Norly

texts.es:
Norly tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene con 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia en una de las zonas rurales que conforman el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada al norte de Peru. La zona en donde reside cuenta con servicio de electricidad. 

La actividad que desarrolla es la venta de utensilios de cocina y accesorios del hogar, saliendo a recorrer la zona en donde vive y algunos caserios aledaños donde ya tiene clientela establecida. Se dedica al negocio hace aproximadamente más de 1 año. Cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja, el cual le apoya  en las actividades que realiza. 

Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de más mercadería para seguir ampliando su negocio. Ella ya ha tenido un crédito financiado a través de Kiva y se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que en su momento le apoyaron. Del mismo modo agradece de antemano a las personas que le apoyarán en esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Norly is 38 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has 2 children. She lives in her own home in one of the rural areas in the district of Tambogrande, a farming area in northern Peru. The area where she lives has electricity.

Her activity is selling kitchen utensils and home accesories, going out in the area she lives in and in some nearby communities where she already has regular customers. She has been doing this business for approximately a year. She has the support of her spouse, who helps her in the activities she does.

Right now she ias asking for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles that she plans on useing to buy more merchandise  to keep expanding her business. She has already had a loan financed through KIva and she is very grateful to the people who supported her. She is also thankful in advance to the people who will support her this time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to expand her business selling kitchen items.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia, está acompañado, tiene dos hijos uno de ocho años y otro de nueve años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para  compra de insumos para obtener una mayor cosecha comprara abono, herbicidas, todo lo necesario para obtener mayor  productividad.
Sus seños es sacar adelante su hogar, mejorando la calidad de vida de cada uno de los  miembros del  núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
José lives with his family. He has a partner and two children ages 8 and 9. He works in agriculture in order to provide for his family's daily bread.
He is requesting a loan for the purchase of supplies so that he can have a better harvest. He will buy fertilizer, herbicides, and everything necessary for better productivity.
His dream is to get his family ahead, improving the lives of every single member of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Clara Maribel

texts.es: Clara,ha decidido solicitar otro préstamo para mejorar su negocio de merienda y aplicar insumos a su siembra de maíz y pipián, compradose como lo es leña, gas, y demás insumos para el negocio para la siembra de pipián, con el abono y semilla, manifiesta que el crédito anterior mejoro  positivamente el negocio de merienda y mas ventas  y más clientes espera posteriormente una buena cosecha en las siembras de pipián.
texts.en: Clara has decided to improve her business selling dinners and buy materials to plant corn and squash. She will buy firewood, gas, and other materials as well as fertilzer and seeds to plant the corn an squash. She says that with the previous loan she positively improved her business selling dinners with more sales and more customers. She also expects a good squash harvest.

loans.use: to buy firewood, gas, fertilizer and seeds. .

loans.name: Manuel Armando

texts.es:
Manuel, está casado, no tiene hijos, su actividad es taxista, se dedica a dicha actividad desde hace mucho tiempo, el realiza viajes express su horario desde 6:00am a 7:00pm.
Esta solicitando un crédito porque necesita darle mantenimiento a su moto taxi y no  tiene dinero es por ello que ha optado por este préstamo, ya que lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos para continuar con sus actividades diarias, y este le traerá beneficios para que su medio de trabajo se encuentre en optimas condiciones.Con su trabajo lo que busca es ir mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is married and has no children. He has been a taxi driver for a long time. He makes express trips and works from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm.
He is requesting a loan because he needs to provide maintenance for his moto taxi and he does not have the money to do so. For this reason, he has turned to this loan. He will invest this loan in the purchase of spare parts in order to continue with his business. This will ensure that his vehicle, his work tool, is in top shape. With his work he hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: with vehicle maintenance and the purchase of spare parts for his moto taxi.

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Norma, es casada vive con sus hijos, uno de trece y el otro de catorce años de edad,Posee una tienda la inicio como una fuente de ingresos para su familia , Está solicitando un prestamo porque necesita surtir la tienda y por obtener mayores ingresos , con el cual comprara productos de la canasta básica tales como: azúcar, frijoles, arroz, leche, cereales, detergentes entre otros.
Sus sueños y aspiraciones es mejorar su negocio, para vivir mejor y tener todo lo necesario como salud, educación y alimento para su familia.
texts.en:
Norma is married and lives with her children, ages 3 and 14. She has a store which she established in order to provide a source of income for her family. She is requesting a loan because she needs to stock her store and make a better income. With this loan, she will buy basic staples such as: sugar, beans, rice, milk, grains, detergents, and other items.
Her dream and aspiration is to improve her business in order to have a better quality of life and all of the necessary things such as health, education, and food for her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, rice, milk, and grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood, corn and gas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy marañon seeds.

loans.name: Elvia Noemi

texts.es: Elvia, está solicitando otro crédito por que necesita seguir mejorando en su negocio, el cual es de confección  de hamacas, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de hilo de seda, para la confección de hamacas y tener mas materiales para trabajar, le ayudara a tener ingresos para el sustento diario de su familia, no ha cambiado  sus circunstancias familiares ya que el negocio es de subsistencia
texts.en: Elvia is requesting another loan because she needs to improve her business. She makes hammocks. She will invest this loan in the purchase of silk thread for making hammocks, and to keep a better stock of materials for her work. This will allow her to have a greater income for her family's daily bread. Her family circumstances have not changed as this is a subsistence business.

loans.use: to buy silk thread.

loans.name: Blanca Yanira

texts.es:
Blanca, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder aumentar el nivel de inventario en la tienda, comprara artículos de primera necesidad para el negocio, como aceite, arroz, frijoles, pastas, entre otros productos de igual demanda.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo en el negocio, ya que mejoro las instalaciones y aumento el inventario, esto le ha permitido atender más clientes y tener más variedad en el negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca is requesting a new loan in order to increase her store's stock. She will buy basic staples for her business such as oil, rice, beans, pasta, and other items in demand.
Her previous loan had a positive effect on her business. She improved her store and increased her inventory. This has allowed her to serve more clients and have more variety in her business.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, beans, pasta.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 42 years old and married with three children.

Nora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Nora has been in this business for eight years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Nora aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
This is Roberto. He previously accessed a 9,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase stocks of fish ball products and ingredients needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another loan, this time for 11,000 PHP, to buy additional stock of fish balls, squid balls, and other ingredients that he will need in his business. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Roberto hopes to be able to expand soon. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of fish ball products and other ingredients needed in his business.

loans.name: Reina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Reina, tiene 22 años de edad, vive con su esposo, ella se dedica a confeccionar hamacas, tiene cuatro años de experiencia en el negocio, lo aprendió  de su suegro, está dedicada a tiempo completo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de hilo de seda, que será utilizado en la confección de las hamacas, esta compra le ayudara a que Reina tenga mejor disponibilidad en el negocio para seguir fabricando.
La aspiración de Reina a través del préstamo es tener el negocio fuerte, a futuro tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Reina, age 22, lives with her husband. She makes hammocks and has four years' experience in this business. She learned it from her father-in-law and works full time in this business.
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of silk thread. She will use it to make her hammocks. This purchase will allow her to have more capacity in her business to keep making hammocks.
Her goal for this loan is to have a strong future. In the future she wants to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy silk thread.

loans.name: Reina Doris

texts.es:
Reina, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, administra un chalet de comestibles, como jugos, boquitas, pupusas, este negocio lo tiene ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, ya tiene un número de clientes.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de boquitas, dulces, materiales para hacer las pupusas como el quesillo, maíz, chicharrón, aceite, este crédito le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio, pues se acerca la feria en la localidad, tendrá la capacidad para atender a los clientes.
Su aspiración es mejorar el negocio, ayudar a sus hijos en todo lo necesario y tambien en el estudio.
texts.en:
Reina lives with her husband and three children. She runs a food stall where she sells items such as juice, snacks, and pupusas [a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans]. Her business is located in the downtown area and she has a good client base.
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of snacks, sweets, and ingredients for making pupusas, such as quesillo [soft Salvadoran cheese], corn, chicharrón [fried pork rind], and oil. This loan will allow her to strengthen her business. The local festival is coming up, and she will now have the capacity to serve customers at this time.
Her goal is to improve her business and help her children with everything they need and with their studies.

loans.use: to buy snacks, sweets, quesillo [soft Salvadoran cheese], corn,  chicharrón [fried pork rind], and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy corn, firewood, gas, and slaked lime.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard works hard to support his family. Richard is single and has a sugarcane farming business in the Philippines.

Richard is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

He is getting the solar lamp because he wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Richard is aware that by using the solar lamp, he is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to his family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Yendry

texts.es: Yendry tiene  24  años de edad, esta casada y vive con el esposo y dos hijos actualmente. Ella con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos, fumigantes, y a su vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. Ella piensa dar mantenimiento a las plantaciones, para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y así con su proyecto cafetalero poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, ella no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ni dichos contratos, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Yendry, 24, is married and currently lives with her husband and two children.  With the loan she plans to buy supplies such as fertilizer and fumigants, as well as help pay for labor. She plans to maintain her coffee crops with special products and hire workers to help with the labor so the crop suffers no harm or loss. This way her coffee-producing project will be able to generate more profits to help her family.

She doesn't have the necessary capital for her purchase or for labor because she has a low income and no way to get the necessary money. This is why she requested a loan, and it's the first one she has received from FUDECOSUR. She had not had other loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered her a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía, vive con su esposo de 72 años de edad, tienen un hijo de 35 años, Sofía se dedica a la venta de bebidas, su hijo les ayuda económicamente para poder sobrevivir y salir adelante, a parte de los ingresos que ella recibe del negocio, dicha venta tiene más de 15 años de existir, solamente Sofía lo atiende todos los días de la semana, este negocio le ha generado ganancia y le ha dado provecho. 
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de gaseosas, jugos, gatorade, entre otras bebidas refrescantes, esto le ayudara al fortalecimiento del negocio, para tener mejores ingresos y mantener a la clientela satisfecha.
Su aspiración es crecer cada día con el negocio, colaborar con sus nietos en la enseñanza.
texts.en:
Sofía lives with her 72-year-old husband. They have a 35-year-old son. Sofía sells soft drinks. Her son helps her and her husband economically so that they can survive and get ahead. She has had this business for 15 years and she is the only one who works there every day of the week. This business has generated her an income and has benefited her.
She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of pop, juice, Gatorade, and other soft drinks. This will allow her to strengthen her business, have a greater income, and keep her customers satisfied.
Her goal is to keep expanding her business every day, and to help with her grandchildren's education.

loans.use: to buy pop, juice, and Gatorade.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
This is Jerry, who previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan that he used to purchase the scrap materials needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and for their personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan. He will be incorporating the loan into his current revolving fund that he uses to buy scrap materials. The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Jerry hopes that his business will grow in the coming years, and he dreams of baing able to give his family a good future through all of his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, and he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recycled materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Reinerio

texts.es: Reinerio, tiene 28 años de edad, es casado, tiene 1 hijo y vive en una aldea del municipio de Lempira. El siempre se ha dedicado  a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frijoles. Hace 4 años inicio con el cultivo de café. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local de la comunidad. Además el realiza trabajos de ebanistería. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado de 15,000 lempiras va aprovechar a fertilizar su finca y a darle un buen mantenimiento y limpieza para lograr mejores cosechas esperando obtener buenas ganancias. Su meta es sembrar una manzana de terreno más de café y de las ganancias va mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Reinerio, 28, is married and has a child.  He lives in a town in the municipality of Lempira.  He has always been a farmer; he cultivates corn and beans.  Four years ago, he started growing coffee.  He sells his crops in the local market in his community.  In addition, he also works doing cabinetry.  

With the loan of 15,000 Honduran lempiras that he has requested he will fertilize his crops, provide them with good maintenance, and clear the land so that he can get a better harvest and obtain good earnings.  His goal is to plant another manzana (a bit more than 1.5 acres) of land with coffee, and with the extra earnings he will improve his house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay to have land cleared on his coffee farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is 44 years old and married with three children.

He earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Roger is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for his pigs.

Roger has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and a general store.

He is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream: to build and expand his business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Morena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Morena, tiene treinta y ocho años de edad, vive con su hija quien tiene quince años de edad,estudia bachillerato, Morena Tiene un taller de lavado y pasteado de vehículo, tiene ocho años de dedicarse al negocio, su horario es de lunes  a  sábado,  posee dos empleados tiene muy buena clientela.
Está solicitando un crédito para financiar su negocio y comprar productos para la limpieza de carros  y mantenimiento de las maquinas.
Esta compra le ayudara a obtener más ingresos  a traves del lavado de vehículos, su meta es prestar un mejor servicio, fortalecer el negocio, y mejorar la calidad de vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Morena, age 38, lives with her 15-year-old daughter, studying for an undergraduate degree. Morena has a workshop for washing and waxing vehicles. She has had this business for eight years and works Monday to Saturday. She has two employees and a very good customer base.
She is requesting a loan to finance her business through buying products for cleaning cars and maintaining her machines.
This purchase will allow her to obtain more income through washing vehicles. Her goal is to provide a better service, strengthen her business, and improve her daughter's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and to maintain her machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase textiles for clothing.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima says that at first it was difficult to get the business started and build clientele, but today the business is doing well and is well known because its products and service are very good. Thanks to her work, Halima is able to help her family with expenses and also to earn her own money. She says that since the last loan, her living standards have greatly improved. She is asking for this new loan to buy more coconuts to sell. She is grateful for this opportunity, because it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
This is Olivia. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 30,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Olivia hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of giving her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, and beverages to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita had a previous loan for 14,000 PHP, which she used to purchase a variety of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Nerita is requesting another loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use  to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better because more items to sell results in increased profits, which will help her to sustain her daily needs. 

Nenita dreams a of running a successful business and hopes to have a happy life with her family. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group’s weekly fellowship* meetings where she can draw strength and inspiration God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to replenish the stock of her variety store.

loans.name: Zena

texts.en: The desire to overcome and succeed is one of the dreams of this young 28-year-old woman, who lives with her family. She has a shop where they sell basic household goods, such as basic grains, milk, flour, soaps, detergents, etc. She has been running the business for three years, and this experience has allowed her to improve her earnings. The shop is well-known in the neighborhood, and it has a clientele who like the quality products, good prices, and excellent service. Zena is a hard worker and is dedicated to working every day to build a better future. She does her best every day because she is happy with her work, and she does not want to disappoint her family.  Zena is currently applying for a loan to buy basic grains, balers of flour, snacks, bread, and drinks. This young woman has a good credit history and is very responsible. She is sure that she can pay off the debt and hopefully bring economic security to her small household.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, balers of flour, snacks, bread, and drinks.

loans.name: George William

texts.en:
George William is 30 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past two years, George William has been working hard to manage his retail business, which sells sodas, sugar, Splash juice, and cooking oil. 

To help expand his business, George William has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more commodities like sodas, sugar, Splash juice, and cooking oil for resale, and will help George William to generate greater profits and take care of himself and buy new clothes. George William hopes that in the future, he will be able to set up another retail shop. 

George William is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like George William who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more commodities like sodas, sugar, Splash juice, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto, vive con su abuela de 80 años de edad, depende económicamente de él, Roberto se dedica a la venta de CD y DVD, de este negocio él logra mantener los gastos del hogar y la alimentación para su abuela. Su negocio está situado en el mercado, lo atiende todos los días, trabaja solo desde hace más de cinco años.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de CD y DVD, además le dará mantenimiento al local donde tiene el producto guardado, este crédito le ayudara a mejorar el negocio, fortaleciéndolo para los próximos meses que se acercan, para mantener  a los clientes satisfechos y el local en buen estado.
La aspiración de Roberto es ayudar a su abuela por medio del trabajo, para proporcionarle lo necesario, teniendo una mejor calidad de vida y pueda tener más años de vida.
texts.en:
Roberto lives with his 80 year old grandmother who depends on him financially. Roberto sells CDs and DVDs. With this business he his able to pay for the household expenses and food for his grandmother. His business is located in the market and he works there every day. He has worked alone for more than five years.

He is asking for the loan to buy CDs and DVDs. He will also do maintenance on the locale where he keeps the merchandise. This loan will help improve the business, strenghtening it for the next few months to keep the customers satisfied and the locale in good condition.

Roberto aspires to helping his grandmother through his work to provide her with everything she needs with a good quality of life so she can have more years to live.

loans.use: to buy CDs and DVDs and do manintenance on his sales locale.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 36-year-old married man who lives in Ain with his wife and three children. Bilal works in construction, specializing in sanitary work and pasting tiles. He has been doing this since 17 years ago. 

Bilal is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to pay for his children's tuition fees and buy a car, which is very important to facilitate his business in moving from one place to another. 

Bilal is very excited about this loan because it will help him a lot in improving his children's educational level and in expanding his working zone. He hopes to keep on improving his business to make sure that he will be capable of covering his family's needs.

loans.use: To pay for his children's tuition fees and buy a car

loans.name: Bethiseba

texts.en: Bethiseba is a married woman. She describes herself as determined. She operates a farm where she sells farm produce, such as maize, beans, etc. Her business is located in an agricultural area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient water, which is used for irrigation on this farm. She will use the 21,000 KES loan to purchase a water tank, which will also be used by her five family members for clean drinking water. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Mercily

texts.en:
This is Mercily. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase additional quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mercily hopes to be able to expand her business and dreams to give her children a good and quality education.  She also prays for good health to be enjoyed by everybody in her house. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery items to add to her variety store.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 39 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. 

Rosalinda is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like snack foods, soft drinks, eggs, soap, and noodles.

Rosalinda has been for two years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like snack foods, soft drinks, eggs, soap, and noodles.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is 38 years old. She lives with her husband, who is a very hard worker, and their four children, three of whom are in school. Mwaka has a locale at the market where she sells a variety of products and essential goods. She loves everything she does and it has also allowed her to have a fixed income.

Mwaka is requesting a loan from Yehu so that she can better stock her locale. She will purchase food products such as flour, salt, sugar, and other basic products. Mwaka's greatest desire is being able to expand her business so that her sales increase and turning what started out as a small business into a bigger retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase food products such as flour, salt, sugar, and other basic products.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a business selling fermented fish and salt in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 21,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more salt and fermented fish to sell to her customers.

NWTF is relisting Julieta's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more salt and fermented fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
This is Lydia. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lydia hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann works hard to support her family. Mary Ann is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Mary Ann requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a 27,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Erlinda has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
This is Janet, 52, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Mario and is mother to her children. She together with her husband manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Janet operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Janet is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Janet hopes that her children will have a good future and dreams that her business will continue to grow through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 36 years old and lives in the town of Arua Hill in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children, with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 15 years, Ronald has been working hard to manage his traditional garment store, which sells traditional clothing. 

To help expand his business, Ronald has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more traditional garment clothing for his business expansion, and will help Ronald to generate greater profits and develop his family. Ronald hopes that in the future he will be able to be self-sufficient. 

Ronald is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ronald who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy traditional clothing to resell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase more clothing to sell to her customers.

NWTF is relisting Rosemarie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy goods to sell such as beans, rice etc.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 48 years old and is a widow with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Zenaida has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 5 years. 

Zenaida requested a PHP 28000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy vegetables to resell

loans.name: Naranbaatar

texts.en:
Naranbaatar is 38 years old.  He lives with his family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in the boundary area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His family consists of 5 people: his wife and their 3 children, aged 8, 6, and 3. His wife doesn’t have a job, so she looks after the children. 

Naranbaatar is a taxi driver and has been running a taxi business for 3 years. Before this, he has worked as a steel frame worker in a construction company. However, his salary was low compared to the risk he was taking.  He managed to earn some money to buy a car and a plot of land. In 2010,  he bought the land and the car, which he is using now for his taxi business. He says, running a taxi business is more profitable than his previous job, so he has a plan to continue this business. 

Naranbaatar is asking 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy a PC and table and chair for his daughters to support their education. He thinks that his daughters should have a good education in order to take high positions in society.

loans.use: buy a PC and table and chair for his daughters

loans.name: Meldrina

texts.en:
Meldrina is 42 years old and married with two children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has been raising pigs for 7 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Meldrina is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: After her past eight years in business, Zenaida is applying for a loan of 29,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase medicines and vaccines for her pigs. Her fruit vending business that she previously funded through Kiva partner NWTF continues to provide Zenaida and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea is 34 years old and is a married mother of 2 children, one of whom is in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rhea has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for three years. 

Rhea requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to build and expand her business

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Analene

texts.en:
Analene is 27 years old and married with two children.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Analene runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for four years.  She sells a variety of items such as rice, bread, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

Analene equested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.  In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria, es divorciada y tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son todos independientes, vive en una casa en anticrético, ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Cota cota de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe una renta de jubilación y también trabaja vendiendo casas, donde le pagan por porcentaje ya que con lo que gana debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar mercadería ya que desea dedicarse a la venta de ropa vestir de ambos sexos para mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Maria es mejorar sus ingresos para ampliar su mercadería y adquirir una tienda para ya no ambular por las calles.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Maria is divorced and has three children, all of whom are independent. She lives in a rented house that consists of only one room. The house is located in the District of Cota Cota in the city of La Paz.

Maria currently receives a retirement pension, but she also works by selling houses. She is paid a percentage commission and this enables her to cover expenses, such as food and basic services.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise. She wants to sell clothing for both sexes so that she can improve her income and her quality of life. Maria’s dream is to improve her income so that she can expand her inventory and acquire a store. She wants to avoid the amount of walking that is required of a street vendor.

This is the second time she has requested a loan from IMPRO, but the first time through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy clothing for both sexes that she can sell.

loans.name: Julli Ivonne

texts.es:
Julli tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en Zaña,  el cual se ubica en la región Lambayeque, provincia de Chiclayo, en un valle de llanuras un tanto retirado de la inmensa cordillera occidental de los Andes.

Julli se dedica desde hace 3 años a la preparación y venta de comida en su localidad.  Su buena sazón y su calidad en el servicio ha hecho que a la fecha tenga mucha más cantidad de clientes.  Con los ingresos que percibe cubre sus gastos y los de su familia, quienes le apoyan con el negocio.

El anhelo de Julli es incrementar su producción, para que con ello pueda atender a muchos más clientes, pero a la fecha su capacidad instalada no le es suficiente.  Es por ello que quiere comprar una cocina, además de insumos para la preparación de su comida.  Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2500 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Julli is 40 years old and lives with her husband and children in Zaña, which is located in the region of Lambayeque in Chiclayo Province. This city is situated on a remote valley plain that is west of the Andean mountain range.

For the past three years, Julli has been preparing and selling food in her town. The good seasoning and the quality of her service has brought her many customers to date. With the income she generates, she is able to cover her expenses and those of her family, who have supported her in her business.

Julli’s wish is to increase production so that she can serve many more customers. At the moment, her existing capacity is insufficient. It is for this reason that she wants to buy a stove and supplies for preparing food. In order to accomplish this goal, she is seeking to obtain a loan of 2,500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy a stove and supplies for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is 39 years old, married and has six children. She is from Panta-on, Ozamiz City. To make a living, Rosalinda grows coconuts and mangoes to sell, which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns 5,000 PHP a month. Rosalinda is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which she will use to obtain farm fertilizers. Rosalinda joined GDMPC in 2008. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase  farm fertilizers

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 49 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising hogs in the Philippines. Felipa is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Felipa has been raising hogs for 16 years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 58 años de edad, es casado y cuenta con una hija dependiente en edad escolar, vive en casa propia en el Caserío Monte Hermoso, ubicado a 20 minutos del distrito agrícola de Mórrope. 

La actividad que realiza es la crianza, compra y venta de animales, en especial de ganado vacuno. Cuenta con más de 8 años de experiencia en el rubro. Cría sus animales en corrales ubicados en el exterior de su domicilio, los alimenta con pastos naturales. Cliente vende su ganado a los compradores que llegan al caserío. Adicionalmente es agricultor, tiene sembrado maíz en terreno propio. Los ingresos que le proveen de estas actividades le ayudan a solventar los ingresos de su familia.

Francisco se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 4000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de ganado y sus repectivos alimentos de modo que pueda generarse mayores ingresos al momento de venderlos. El ya ha tenido créditos anteriormente con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Francisco is 58 years old, married and has a dependent school-aged daughter. He lives in his own house in Caserío Monte Hermoso, located 20 minutes from the agricultural district of Mórrope. The work he does is buying, raising, and selling animals, especially cattle. He has more than eight years experience in this line if business. He raises his animals in pens located outside his home, and feeds them with natural grasses. 

The client sells his cattle to buyers who come to the settlement. In addition, he is a farmer, and has planted corn on his own land. 

The income that these activities provide helps him to meet his family's expenses. Francisco is applying for a loan of 4000 nuevos soles, which he intends to invest in the purchase of cattle and their feed, so that he can generate greater income at time of sale.

He has previously had loans with Edpyme Alternativa, and has shown himself to be a punctual and responsible client.

loans.use: To buy cattle and feed for them, so that he can generate greater income at  time of sale

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
Claudio, es soltero, y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de su hermano mayor en anticretico ocupando tres habitaciones con paredes de estuco y el piso es de tablones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como chofer asalariado de microbus en uno de los  sindicatos de transportistas de La Paz   trabajando al dia,  o sea teniendo ingresos diarios. Claudio además de vivir en la casa de su hermano corre con los gastos de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora pues quiere reiniciar sus estudios en un instituto superior de contabilidad en la siguiente gestión y poder mejorar su calidad de vida
El sueño de Claudio es adquirir su propia movilidad y poder generar mejores ingresos.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Claudio is single and has no children. He lives in a house that his older brother has rented. It consists of three rooms that have stucco walls and wooden plank floors. The house is located in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz.

Claudio currently works as a salaried driver of a minibus for one of the transportation unions in the city of La Paz. He earns a daily income. Since Claudio lives at his brother’s house, he shares in the cost of basic services.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a computer. Claudio wants to resume his accounting studies during the upcoming session at an institute of higher education. This will enable him to improve his quality of life. Claudio dreams of acquiring a vehicle of his own so that he can generate more income.

This is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a computer for when he resumes his accounting classes.

loans.name: Uhuru

texts.en:
Support Uhuru in his efforts to improve the quality of customer service in the motorcycle taxi industry in Kaloleni. Uhuru saw that there weren’t enough motorcycle taxis to meet the needs of the city's busy businessmen. 

Uhuru is driven by a strong belief in the importance of customer service, and everything he does is focused on delivering the highest quality of service and comfort for his clients. He is hardworking, and tries to view obstacles that appear in his life as challenges that he can overcome. 

He is currently asking for a loan to diversify his line of operation. He is going to open a kiosk to provide general items for his customers. Uhuru plans to buy basic items like bags of flour, sugar, salt, detergents, and medicine.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, salt, detergents, medicine, etc.

loans.name: Mimoza

texts.en:
Mimoza is 39 years old and an ethnic Egyptian married mother of two school-aged children. She and her family live in a little town in southeastern Albania. Mimoza is the only financial provider for her family and she does work hard, to provide for everyone. Opportunities for her husband to find a job are most limited and he does help in Mimoza’s activities.

She has been a client of VisionFund Albania for a long time and has proved to be a very responsible person. She claims that without the institution’s help, she wouldn’t have come this far and she is very thankful to all the staff who have supported her throughout her financial ordeals.

Mimoza’s activity in the past seven years has been in buying-selling used items including clothes and shoes and the profit hasn’t been bad at all, according to her. Now she is applying for another loan to buy similar items to resell.

loans.use: To buy used clothing and shoes to sell

loans.name: Enna Milagros

texts.es:
Enna es una joven de 20 años, la cual vive en la ciudad de Nazca, la cual se caracteriza por poseer muchos lugares turísticos los cuales son muy visitados durante todo el año, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de tuna, pallares, entre otros. Enna en su tiempo libre le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual son los riquísimos “Tallarines con papa a la huancaína”.

Día a día Enna trabaja como mesera en un restaurante de su ciudad, ella labora alrededor de 8 horas al día, especialmente en las mañanas ya que por  las noches esta estudiando la carrera técnica de computación e informática; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo amable con los clientes.

Enna esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá ayudar a su hermana ya que su pequeño sobrino se encuentra muy delicado de salud y también podrá comprar una computadora para poder realizar sus trabajos ya que actualmente no la tiene, de esta manera ella podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Ser una gran profesional y apoyar a su familia”.
texts.en:
Enna is a young woman of 20 who lives in the city of Nazca, which is characterized by its many tourist spots which are very well visited throughout the year. Agriculture has similarly developed, especially the cultivation of prickly pears and lima beans, among other crops. In her free time, Enna very much likes to eat one of her favorite dishes, which is the very delicious "tallerines con papa a la huancaína" (pasta with potatoes in cheese and pepper sauce).

Day to day Enna works as a waitress in a restaurant in her city. She works about 8 hours a day, especially in the mornings, since in the evenings she is studying for a technical degree in computers and information. She feels that she is doing well in her work because she is very responsible and above all because she is gracious to the customers.

Enna is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help they have offered her, she will be able to help her sister, since her little nephew is in very delicate health, and she will also be able to buy a computer to be able to do her assignments, since she doesn't now have one.
