In this way she will be able to continue striving to be able to make her greatest dream a reality -- to have a good career and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for her nephew and a computer for herself

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 36 years old and is married with six children between 4 and 12 years old. She sells meat and she currently employs two people to help her.  She has four years of experience in this business. 

Jacqueline has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy a large quantity of meat for resale. She plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy her family's basic needs, to save money for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of meat for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita, 37, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Larson, an employee, and is the mother of two children. Together with her husband, Lolita manages their household and operates a business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income continuously, for their everyday expenses. 

Lolita owns and operates a food stall. She sells snacks, like french fries, barbecue and other street foods, which sell very well, especially from 3:00 p.m. to 7:00 p.m. She also has a water distribution business for extra income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales, every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy more of the raw products and supplies she uses to serve her customers. She expects a boost in her business income, as she expands her business.  

Lolita dreams of being able to give her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members every week, where she can share stories of her work, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and supplies she will use in her food stall business.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de 26 años, cursó estudios de instrucción secundaria, tiene dos hijos de 5 y 3 años con quien viven en La Concordia, un cantón de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas que anteriormente pertenecía a la Provincia de Esmeraldas. Es considerado un cantón muy fuerte en la agroindustria y exportación de varios productos como palma africana, macadamia y palmito por lo cual un aproximado de más de 300 millones de dólares se mueven solo en este cantón. También el turismo es una fuente de economía, pues hay lugares que son visitados y los habitantes del pueblo aprovechan este movimiento para comercializar todo tipo de productos con negocios establecidos en cada rincón como restaurantes, tiendas, farmacias, almacenes de ropa, tours, etc. Sin embargo en época de invierno, grandes porciones de terreno y plantaciones se ven afectadas por las fuertes e inevitables lluevan que llegan al lugar. Las pérdidas que se presentan en esta época del año muchas veces son irreparables, pues muchas familias viven en construcciones de caña muy débiles para resistir las torrentes aguas. 
A pesar de esto, los ciudadanos de este cantón no se dan por vencidos y para remediar de alguna forma las pérdidas, continúan trabajando buscando oportunidades para salir adelante de alguna forma, por lo cual son considerados personas emprendedoras en todo ámbito como lo es Carlos quien se dedica a la producción de maracuyá y cacao frutas muy cotizadas a nivel nacional e internacional. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y ha adquirido mucha experiencia sobre todo porque dedica al menos 8 horas cada día en las labores de sembrar, cosechar, preservar, fumigar y cuidar los cultivos de estas plantas. Su padre fue quien le enseñó a buscar el sustento de esta forma y además le brinda su ayuda en lo que pueda. Carlos se siente preparado para avanzar un paso más en este emprendimiento y cree que es posible un incremento de ingresos con la adquisición de semillas e insumos que le permitan incrementar su producción y por ende, la oferta para sus clientes. Es por esto que ha solicitado un crédito en Fundación Alternativa para poder dar este gran paso. Ellos le atendieron con mucho carisma y agilidad lo que le dio confianza y además proyección pues las capacitaciones que allí brindan son de mucha utilidad para los microempresarios de la zona. Con estos ingresos extras Carlos piensa separar un ahorro que en el futuro pueda sustentarle para comprar un terreno grande donde pueda ampliar sus cultivos y así brindar la mejor educación y calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carlos, 26, went to high school. He has two children, ages 5 and 3, with whom he lives in La Concordia, a canton in the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas which used to be part of the province of Esmeraldas. It's considered a strong region for agriculture and export of products like African palm, macadamia nuts, and palm hearts, which bring in more than $300 million dollars in this canton alone. Tourism is also part of the economy, as the locals in the visited areas take advantage of the tourists to sell all kinds of products, with businesses like restaurants, stores, pharmacies, clothing stores, tours, etc on every corner. Nevertheless, in winter a lot of the land and plantations are affected by the strong and inevitable rains that arrive here. The losses that they are facing in this season of the year are often irreparable, since many families live in structures made of sugar cane that are too week to resist the torrential rains.

In spite of this, the residents of this canton will not give up, and they will keep working to make up for the losses as much as possible, looking for opportunities to get ahead in some way. They are widely considered to be determined people, like Carlos, who grows passion fruit and cacao which are very sought-after at a national and international level. He has been doing this for two years and has acquired a lot of experience, above all because he works at least 8 hours a day planting, harvesting, preserving, fumigating and caring for the crops. His father taught him to earn a living this way, and helps him as he is able. Carlos feels prepared to take his business a step further and believes it's possible to increase his income by buying seeds and inputs that will let him increase his production and therefore the supply for his customers. 

For that reason he has asked for a loan from Fundacion Alternativa, so that he can take this next stop. The Foundation attends to him with a lot of charisma and agility, which gave him confidence and also a sense of protection from the very useful trainings for local small businesses. With the extra income, Carlos wants to start saving to buy a larger piece of land in the future where he can increase his crops and thus give his children a better education and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cacao and passion fruit seeds and inputs for their production.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
This is Virgilio, he previously accessed a loan of 15,000 PHP that he used to buy spare parts and accessories and for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit. His earnings were a big help in his personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for him to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit and also to buy some equipment in the repair shop. His profits from this business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Virgilio dreams to expand his business and hopes that his grandchildren will finish their studies. He faithfully meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work. It is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his Jeepney vehicle.

loans.name: Alozio

texts.en:
Alozio is a 35-year-old, hardworking man, living in Kagadi, Uganda. For two years he has been trading in agricultural products. He started this business with his savings, from his salary as a teacher in a government school. Like most traders in a developing country, he has challenges, like price fluctuations, and inadequate capital to meet the high demand. Alozio is requesting a loan to buy maize and beans to resell.

His family goal is to educate his children up to the university, and his business goal is to establish a food store that can sustainably supply the whole region.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to resell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
This is Arlene, She previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Arlene hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Enkhtungalag

texts.en: Enkhtungalag is 31 years old and lives with husband and two sons in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. Enkhtungalag has worked as a nurse in the hospital for seven years. She and her family live together in a small house, which they own. Her older son, Munkh-Tamir, is four years old and attends a kindergarten. Her younger son, Munkh-Orgil, is one year old and stays at home with her grandmother. Her husband is builder. During 2011, they bought land with an old wooden house. Enkhtungalag wants to repair the wooden house. She is a requesting a loan 2,500,000 MNT to purchase construction materials such as windows, tapestry, color, bricks and cement.

loans.use: to purchase construction material such as windows, tapestry, bricks and cement.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La señora Sandra vive con sus padres, en una casa con acabado de ladrillo, piso es de tierra ocupando tres habitaciones, ella es Licenciada en Abogacía, la casa está ubicada en la zona Sopocachi de la Ciudad de La Paz.

Sandra trabaja en una empresa privada como abogada; el sueldo que ella percibe no es muy alto, ya que ella cubre los gastos de alimentación y servicio básicos como luz, agua. 

El crédito lo requiere para comprar estuco, pinturas y otros materiales para terminar la obra fina en la construcción de la vivienda de sus padres.

El sueño de Sandra es mejorar calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.

Es la primera vez que tiene el crédito  con IMPRO y la primera con KIVA.
texts.en:
Sra. Sandra lives with her parents in a brick house that consists of three rooms with dirt floors. The house is located in the District of Sopocachi in the city of La Paz.

Sandra is a licensed attorney who works for a private company. The salary she earns is not very high, but it enables her to cover the cost of food and basic services, such as electricity and water.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy stucco, paint, and other materials so that the finishing touches can be performed on her parents’ home. Sandra’s dream is to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

This is the first time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy stucco, paint, and other materials for the finishing touches on her parents' home.

loans.name: Ulambayar

texts.en:
Ulambayar is 40 years old and lives with his family in a ger (a traditional Mongolian yurt) in the boundary area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He has 3 children: a 21-year-old son who studies at a university, a 16-year-old younger son who studies at a secondary school, and a 5-year-old girl who goes to kindergarten. 

Ulambayar has been managing a small internet cafe in his area with his wife since 2010. His internet cafe has 8 PCs. In winter, due to the cold, children spend their spare time participating in indoor activities--the internet/PC game cafe is one of the children’s favorite places to come. Ulambayar is planning to buy 4 new PCs to increase his business and family income.

loans.use: to buy 4 new PCs to increase his business and family income

loans.name: La Richesse 3(#1) Group

texts.en:
Jean, age 40, is not married and has one 12-year-old daughter who is currently attending school. Jean is representing the La Richesse 3 (#1) group. He sells drinks, including soft drinks and liquor. He has been operating this business for 2 years. He will use the loan to buy more soft drinks and liquor to sell in his store. His business strategy is to keep the most popular drinks stocked at all times. He keeps careful track of when he needs to order more. 
Jean has received 4 previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to expand his business and buy an ice cream machine in the future. He would like to start a second small business selling the ice cream.

loans.use: to pay for soft drinks and liquors to add to his store's inventory.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en  el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace varios años Gladys se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos, etc), su negocio lo ha colocado en el mercado de la zona donde vive, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar su nivel de vida. También cría y vende ganado caprino (cabras),las cuales vende una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo en los mercados de la zona.

Ella ya ha tenido créditos financiados por Kiva anteriormente y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual en sus pagos, los créditos le han ayudado mucho y su bodega está creciendo poco a poco. Actualmente recurre a la generosidad de los prestamistas de Kiva para solicitar un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles que utilizará para poder  ampliar su negocio comprando más mercadería, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes y para cubrir su préstamo.  Gladys es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Gladys is a 39-year-old parent. She lives with her husband and their three children in their own house, which has electricity only, and is located in the Tambogrande district, which is part of the Lambayeque department. This area is noted for its farming, livestock-raising, and handicrafts. 

For several years, Gladys has sold groceries: products used daily such as milk, rice, cooking oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, etc. She has set up her business in the market in the area where she lives. With the earnings from the sale of her products, she tries to cover all her expenses and improve her standard of living. 

She also raises and sells goats, which she sells in the local markets, once they reach their optimal growth. She has had loans financed by Kiva previously, and has shown herself to be a client who is on time with her payments. 

The loans have helped her a great deal, and her store is growing little by little. Now she is appealing to the generosity of the Kiva lenders, in order to apply for a loan of 2,500 nuevos soles, which she will use to expand her business by buying more merchandise. Her one dream is for her business to grow and  have more products to offer customers, and enable her to cover her loan. 

Gladys is a responsible, dedicated and hard-working person, who is concerned about helping her family get ahead in life.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more merchandise.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert, 25, is a single entrepreneur in Poblacion 4, Clarin. He makes a living from his retail business. He has been in this business for almost a year, and he earns 4,500 PHP per month. To improve business, he is borrowing the amount of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, which he joined recently. He will use the borrowed money to buy more products to resell in his store, such as jewelry and various food items. He hopes to be able to expand his business before long.

loans.use: to buy more products to resell in his store, such as jewelry and food.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 49 years old and is married with four children between 10 and 21 years old. She sells charcoal from 6 a.m until 8 p.m every day per week and she currently employs two people to help her. She has one year of experience in this business. 

Mariam has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more charcoal for resale. She plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy her family's basic needs, to save money for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Golibjon

texts.en: Golibjon is married and has three children, for whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. It’s for this reason that, three years ago, he began his own business -- a cafe. He cooks and sells different kinds of national dishes. Thanks to his good skills, he has managed to gain many customers. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving. Now his children are able to get a good education, and the financial challenges are being solved, little by little. He is asking for a loan of 8,000 somoni to buy equipment for making ‘shashlik.' With the new equipment, he can cook and sell ‘shashlik,’ which is in great demand among Tajik people. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy equipment for making ‘shashlik’

loans.name: Rahimjon

texts.en:
Rahimjon is 21 years old, married, and doesn't have any children. His parents live with him. His wife is a housewife, and Rahimjon is the only breadwinner in the family. He owns a disk store, which is based in the local market. Here he sells films, cartoons, music and other kind of DVD disks. 

To improve business, he is borrowing the amount of from IMON International organization to buy DVD disks from China to sell. 

Rahimjon is hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business before long.

loans.use: to buy DVD disks to sell.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.es: Con su anterior credikiva, Marlon compró hilos para tejer, accesorios de acero, pedrería, totumos y semillas al por mayor y de contado. Con ello su negocio aumentó el volumen de sus ventas y ahora está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará estos mismos productos pues necesita producir apara la temporada de navidad y año nuevo, época en la cual las ventas se incrementan y necesita tener disponible un buen inventario. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Muchas gracias, por el apoyo financiero” y les solicita seguir recibiéndolo, para continuar mejorando sus utilidades y la liquidez, así como su nivel de vida y el de su familia.
texts.en:
With his previous Kiva loan, Marlon was able to purchase weaving yarn, steel accessories, rhinestones, gourds, and seeds in bulk. He was able to pay cash for these supplies. As a result, his business experienced an increased sales volume.

Now he is applying for a new Kiva loan so that he can buy these same materials. He needs to produce crafts for the Christmas and New Year seasons. Since his sales increase during this time, Marlon needs to have enough available inventory.

His message to the Kiva lenders is as follows: “Thank you for the financial support.” He asks that the support continue so that he can keep improving his profits and his liquidity. As a result, the standard of living for himself and his family will also improve.

loans.use: to buy yarn, steel accessories, rhinestones, gourds, and seeds in bulk.

loans.name: Zenita

texts.en:
Zenita is from Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Zenita is married and has two children. To make a living, Zenita is selling personal products such as lotion, makeup and perfume in the local community. She has been in this business for two years and paid 2,500 per month. 

In 2008, Zenita joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to buy products such as lipstick, lotion, and powder to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to buy products such as lipstick, lotion, and powder to sell.

loans.name: Djamila

texts.en:
Djamila is 48 years old, married, and has three children.  She also takes care of two additional relatives. She sells second-hand clothes, working from 6 a.m until 6 p.m every day, except Sundays. Djamila has eight years of experience in this work. 

Djamila has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to buy more second-hand clothes for resale. She plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy her family's basic needs, and to pay for medical insurance.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ernelyn

texts.en:
This is Ernelyn. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her direct selling of personal products business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ernelyn fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day and hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Oyunjargal

texts.en:
Oyunjargal is 28 years old and lives with her husband and 1-year-old baby in a rental apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She is modest and responsible. She graduated from the university as an accountant in 2010 and has since been working in a private company that imports eggs. Oyunjargal's husband works as a driver in the same company. 

As a new couple with low income, Oyunjargal is planning to manage a tire repair place near the central-way with her parents because her parents don’t have jobs. She will provide all the necessary equipment that can be used in tire repair service and will check on the business after her job. 

Half of the loan Oyunjargal is taking will be used to buy equipment and the other half will be spent on the rent. She thinks that by doing this she can increase her family's income and her parents will have a job.

loans.use: to buy equipment and pay rent for her tire repair service.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 27 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 8 years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her dairy, which sells milk, bread, and donuts. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy and stock more milk, bread, and donuts for resale and will help Mariam to generate greater profits and increase capital. Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to open a bigger dairy. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mariam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy and stock more milk, bread, and donuts for resale.

loans.name: Balbina

texts.en:
This is Balbina. She previously accessed a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new 28,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Balbina dreams to have a good life with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients needed to continue the operation of her eatery.

loans.name: Cristina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Cristina tiene 26 años, cursó la instrucción primaria y es madre soltera, tienen un hijo pequeño a quien a pesar de sus escasos recursos económicos ha logrado sacar adelante, no le ha faltado ropa ni techo ni alimento pero todo gracias a su espíritu emprendedor. Esta pequeña familia conformada por madre e hijo viven  en Santo Domingo la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una provincia de Ecuador que en los últimos años ha tenido un alto crecimiento sostenido. Su capital  es una ciudad en donde lo más atractivo y llamativo son sus deliciosas frutas, y muchos lugares turísticos por visitar. También cuenta con un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Además cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos que acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. 
Cristina es propietaria de un bazar donde ofrece ropa casual, regalos para toda ocasión, cosméticos, etc. Emprendió con esta idea desde hace 2 años a pesar de la falta de capital, poco a poco y reinvirtiendo sus ganancias en este negocio, ha adquirido la suficiente experiencia para ser una buena administradora de su microempresa. Ahora requiere un crédito con el objetivo de incrementar la mercadería que ofrece a sus clientes y así atraer demanda de todos los lugares aledaños. Esta joven soñadora, anhela darle a su hijo la educación que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de terminar y espera un día verlo convertido en un profesional. Está muy agradecida con Fundación Alternativa por abrir las puertas para su crecimiento laboral y personal.
texts.en: Cristina is 26 years old, has an elementary-school education and is a single mother. She has a small son, who despite her meager resources has been able to make headway and doesn't lack food, clothing or shelter, all thanks to Cristina's enterprising spirit. They live in Santo Domingo, the provincial capital of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, one of the provinces in Ecuador that recently has experienced high and sustained growth. The most appealing aspect of the city is its delicious fruits, and it has many tourists destinations to visit. It also relies considerably on commerce, since it has turned into an important commercial center connecting the mountain and coastal regions of the country. There are a number of tourist activities for travelers near and far alike thanks to its warm climate. Cristina owns a store where she sells casual clothes, gifts for all occasions, cosmetics and other items. She undertook this idea two years ago despite a lack of capital, and little by little she reinvested her profits into the business. She has acquired the necessary experience to be a good small-businesswoman. Now she is requesting the loan with the goal of expanding her merchandise to draw in demand from the surrounding areas. This young dreamer's goal is to give her son the education she was not able to have, and she hopes one day she will see him become a professional. Cristina is very grateful for Kiva partner Fundación Alternativa for opening the doors to her personal and professional growth.

loans.use: to stock up on a variety of merchandise.

loans.name: Arline Josefa

texts.es: Arline de 39 años vive al sur occidente de Barranquilla con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 8 años. Ella se dedica a dos actividades, por un lado produce calzado artesanal femenino y por otro lado elabora amasijos de maíz llamados bollos; con estos dos negocios ella y su esposo, generan los ingresos que benefician a su hogar, pues él es guarnecedor y trabajan unidos para avanzar. Sus principales clientes son vecinos del sector, que compran en su local y que mandan a hacer diseños adaptados a la moda y a sus características personales. A ellos les vende a crédito y de contado de lunes a domingos desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, con espacios de descanso para almorzar. Su meta principal es ampliar su negocio y tener empleados que apoyen su incremento productivo y de mercadeo, sueño con el cual ha convivido durante 5 años de experiencia, pero su capital de trabajo es su mayor desafío para lograrlo rápidamente.En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará materias primas, como cuero y cuerina,  además de maíz para aumentar también la producción de bollos.
texts.en:
Arline is 39 years old and lives to the southwest of Barranquilla with her husband and their two children, ages 2 and 8. She has two businesses: one business involves making handcrafted women’s shoes and the other business involves making cornmeal buns called “bollos”. Through these two businesses, Arline and her husband are able to generate household income. Her husband is in charge of assembling the shoes and they work together to advance these businesses. Most of Arline’s customers are neighbors from the area. They visit her shop in order to buy her products, but they also ask her to come up with custom designs that meet their personal tastes. Arline sells her products on credit and for cash. She works Monday through Sunday from 7:00 A.M to 7:00 P.M. Her main goals are to expand her business and to hire employees to help with increasing production and sales. During the five years she has been in business, her greatest challenge has always been getting quick access to operating capital.

At the moment, Arline is applying for a Kiva loan so that she can buy materials such as genuine and artificial leather. She will also buy corn so that she can increase her production of “bollos”.

loans.use: to buy shoemaking materials, such as genuine and artificial leather, as well as corn for her food business.

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is 35 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Suzan has been working hard to manage her salon, which sells hair products. 

To help expand her business, Suzan has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair extensions and hair treatments that can work on all types of hair, and will help Suzan to generate greater profits and increase her stock. Suzan hopes that in the future, she will be able to have a big business. 

Suzan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Suzan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more hair extensions and hair treatments that can work on all types of hair.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Batbayar, 31 years old, has been running a taxi service for 3 years. He lives with his 2 children and wife. His wife is a bus conductor, and his older son attends secondary school. The family lives in a ger, a nomadic tent, on a small piece of land near a mountain peak. It is a very difficult and dangerous place for them to live, especially in winter. 

Therefore, Batbayar is planning to replace his land with a better location near downtown so that his family can live in a safe environment. Batbayar plans to use this loan to help pay for the land. Now, his family is living on a friend's land. In the future, he wants to build a wooden house.

loans.use: to pay for land to live on near the city.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothing inventory for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To quarry stone for resale.

loans.name: Pollie

texts.en:
Pollie is 36 years old and lives in the town of Mukono, in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Pollie has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells scarves, blouses, and baby clothes. 

To help expand her business, Pollie has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more new attire, like baby clothes, to add to the store for resale. It will also help Pollie to generate greater profits and provide a higher income for her family. Pollie  hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business and start selling in wholesale. 

Pollie is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Pollie, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more new attire, like baby clothes, for resale in her store.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 33 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi, in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Betty has been working hard to manage her retail store, which sells a wide range of things like electronics and everyday necessities. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items like pampers and electrical wires, and will help Betty to generate greater profits and be more self-reliant. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to have other stores within her area. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Betty, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more items for her store, like pampers and electrical wires.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 58 years old and is married with children. She owns sewing business and has 18 years of experience in this business. Her business is well organized and she works from 6am to 5pm every day. 

Mariam has requested a loan from Kiva lenders through Vision Finance Company in order to buy sewing machines and other materials for getting more profits. With the profits from this loan, she will be able to reinvest in her business, renovate her house, and save for her future.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines and others materials for increasing her profits.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a blacksmithing business in the Philippines.

Merlinda has requested a PHP 12,000 loan, through NWTF, to purchase additional materials for her blacksmithing business. she has been in this business for 4 years now. In the photo, you can see Merlinda together, with her husband. they work hand in hand to fulfill their dreams.  

In the future, Merlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her blacksmith business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 29 years old, married and has 2 children, one of whom is in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs, in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Maricel has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Maricel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza, a 39-year-old married mother of three children, lives in Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. For the last 12 years, she has managed their coconut farm. This gives her an income of PHP 3,000. Analiza been a member of GDMPC since 2008. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. In the future, Analiza wishes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a 45-year-old married man with six children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He deals in cocoa sales and his business has been very lucrative. He has also decided to grow cocoa after buying land, and it is now ready for harvest. 

His major challenge is the unpredictable weather changes and the terrain of the area, which makes transportation to the market hard. His personal goal is to build a permanent commercial house in town and expand his business into new areas. 

Ezekiel is requesting a loan to buy cocoa to sell, since the demand is high and his garden is not sufficient.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 37 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, with 4 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years ,Florence has been working hard to manage her salon, which sells hair and skin products. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to put more hair and skin products into her business. This will help Florence to generate greater profits and pay the tuition fees  for her children. Florence hopes that, in the future, she will be able to open another branch of her salon elsewhere. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to put more hair and skin products into her business.

loans.name: Richaman

texts.en:
Richaman is a twenty seven year old married man with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been  farming for three years and also buys cocoa from other farmers. His major customer is the processing cocoa plant in town. His main challenges are inadequate capital to meet the high demand, high transportation costs and seasonal weather changes. 

Richaman's personal goals  are to educate his children and to build a permanent home for the family. His business goals consist of expanding his business to new market areas and moving the business to a more permanent location. The purpose of the loan is to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.name: William Hernan

texts.es:
William es un padre de familia de 27 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su menor hija de cuatro años de edad en una vivienda de material rustico y de corte tradicional, la zona en donde reside se denomina Sialupe Baca y es uno de los caseríos que conforman la zona rural del Lambayeque. La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de bastante precaria, la mayoría de pobladores son trabajadores independientes en negocios de comercio y crianza de animales. Adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura como jornaleros. 

El cría junto con su esposa animales menores, en su mayoría pavos y patos, aunque también cría otros animales como cerdos y ovejas. El cría los animales en su domicilio y luego los ofrece en venta en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Adicionalmente trabaja en un Molino en la Ciudad de Lambayeque donde recibe un pago semanal. Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

William se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan implementar su negocio con la compra de animales menores y alimento balanceado, de ese modo incrementará sus ingresos y mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y agradece de antemano a las personas que le ayudarán a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
William, 27, is a father who lives with his wife and youngest daughter, 4, in a rustic house of traditional style.  The area where they live is called Sialupe Baca and it's one of the hamlets that make up the rural area of Lambayeque.  The quality of life in the community is very unstable.  The majority of the residents work independently as merchants or raising animals or in agriculture as day laborers.

He and his wife raise small animals, mainly turkeys and ducks, although he also raises pigs and sheep.  He raises the animals in his home and sells them in the city of Chiclayo.  He also works in a mill in the city of Lambayeque where he earns a weekly salary.  With his income from these jobs he takes responsibility for getting his family ahead.

William is requesting a loan for 1000 nuevos soles [PEN] from Edpyme Alternativa to set up his business with a purchase of small animals and balanced feed.  This way he'll increase his income and improve his family's quality of life.  This is his first Kiva loan and he thanks the people in advance who will help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: to buy small animals and balanced feed to set up his business

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a forty three year old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the cassava milling business for three years and with the proceeds he has been able to buy land and pay school fees for his children. He also has tree nursery beds and he supplies the tree seedlings to farmers around the area.

William's family goal is to educate his children, while his business plans are to buy land to plant more trees and to diversify his business to be able to mill other cereals like beans and maize. William is requesting a loan to buy cassava to sell.

loans.use: To buy cassava.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 36 years old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children, 3 of them currently in school. 

For the past 4 years, Robert has been working hard to manage his stationery store, which does printing, typing and sells books. To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy printers and computers, and will help Robert to generate greater profits and develop a better way to live. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to start a mobile money outlet. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy printers and computers.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 39 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children, 2 of them currently in school. 

For the past 6 years, Edward has been working hard to manage his spare parts store, which sells car wheels and other spare parts. To help expand his business, Edward has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add more stock of car wheels and other spare parts to his business, and will help Edward to generate greater profits and afford to send his children to school. Edward hopes that in the future he will be able to buy big machines which will help him to run his business. 

Edward is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Edward who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to add more stock of car wheels and other spare parts to his business.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul is a thirty two year old married man who has four children. They live in Bundibugyo,Uganda. For nine years, he has been farming cocoa and he started this business after selling firewood. The firewood sales was a business he initially did but stopped after realizing its negative environmental impact. In the cocoa business he is challenged by price fluctuations, high transportation costs, change in seasons and inadequate capital to meet the operational costs. His personal goals are to educate his children to higher levels and to build a permanent home for the family. The business goals are to land to grow crops and to expand his cocoa plantation. He intends to use this loan facility to buy more cocoa to sell as his plantation is not sufficient enough to meet the high demand.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Luis Augusto

texts.es:
Luis es un joven de 22 años, es soltero y pudo terminar la educación secundaria. Vive en Latacunga capital de la provincia de Cotopaxi, una de las provincias que forma parte de la Región Sierra del Ecuador y que los últimos años se ha desarrollado notablemente de tal forma que es considerada una de las más importantes de la región gracias a la industria florícola, minera, metalúrgica, agroindustria, agrícola y ganadera. Además existen establecimientos de negocios que generan interesantes ingresos lo que le convierte en una ciudad comercial y con varias oportunidades para salir adelante. Aunque hay un alto índice de pobreza el espíritu emprendedor de sus habitantes ha hecho que la  ciudad sobresalga. En el sector rural y urbano se puede encontrar familias destacando sus talentos para emprender con alguna idea que les pueda generar rentabilidad para conseguir el sustento diario. 
Es el caso de Luis quien a su corta edad ya es propietario de un pequeño restaurante en donde destaca su gusto y pasión por la gastronomía principalmente de la comida nacional. La necesidad y la falta de un trabajo estable lo llevaron a emprender con esta idea hace 2 años e invierte 8 horas cada día a la atención adecuada de su local. Ahora ve la necesidad de remodelar y ampliar este restaurante que tanto esfuerzo le ha costado. Está seguro que sus clientes se sentirán más cómodos y mucho mejor atendidos, para lo cual solicitó un préstamo para comprar los insumos necesarios para lograr su objetivo. Acudió a Fundación Alternativa en donde encontró una buena opción para buscar ayuda ya que aparte de entregar créditos, también capacitan para que personas como Luis cuenten con las herramientas para la buena administración de sus negocios. Luis espera un incremento de ingresos y con esto un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en: Luis is a young man of 22, single, and has a high-school education. He lives in Latacunga, the provincial capital of Cotopaxi, one of the provinces that forms part of Ecuador's mountain region, which has developed into one of the most important areas thanks to the agricultural, mineral, metallurgical and livestock industries. There are businesses that generate considerable income and have made Latacunga a commercial city with various opportunities for advancement. Although there is a high level of poverty, the enterprising spirit of the inhabitants has made it stand out. In the rural and urban areas one can find families taking advantage of their talents to launch a business idea that can earn the daily bread. This is the case of Luis, who at his young age is already the owner of a small restaurant where his passion for the national cuisine is on display. The need for stable work made him pursue this venture two years ago, and he works eight hours every day at his restaurant. Now he sees the need to remodel and expand, which despite his efforts has its costs. He is sure that his customers will feel more comfortable and get better service, which is why he is requesting a loan to purchase the supplies needed to carry out this objective. He turned to Kiva partner Fundación Alternativa, where he found a good option to look for help, since aside from the loans, they also have training so people like Luis have the skills to better administer their businesses. Luis hopes to increase his income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to expand and decorate his restaurant.

loans.name: Luis Rodrigo

texts.es:
Luis tiene 28 años, por los escasos recursos de su familia no pudo terminar sus estudios y alcanzó a aprobar la instrucción primaria. Está casado con Fanny de 26 años que se dedica a la agricultura, tienen 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando.  Viven en Latacunga un lugar que cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos para turistas nacionales y extranjeros principalmente por el Centro Histórico de la ciudad que ha sido considerado Patrimonio Cultural del Ecuador desde hace casi 30 años. Capital de una de las provincias que forma parte de la Región Sierra del Ecuador; Cotopaxi y que los últimos años se ha desarrollado notablemente de tal forma que es considerada una de las más importantes de la región gracias a la industria florícola, minera, metalúrgica, agroindustria, agrícola y ganadera. Además existen establecimientos de negocios que generan interesantes ingresos lo que le convierte en una ciudad comercial y con varias oportunidades para salir adelante a pesar de que las estadísticas indican un índice de pobreza que supera el 50%. Sin embargo las personas han buscado la forma de no estancarse y salir adelante, por lo que han puesto en marcha sus ideas y muchas de ellas de forma empírica. 
Luis trabaja como carpintero desde hace 10 años, aprendió a través de su hermano quien con amor y mucha paciencia enseñó a Luis a desarrollarse en esta actividad. Invierte en esta actividad de 8 a 10 horas, en un pequeño espacio en su domicilio, designado para este emprendimiento que es tan importante para él y su familia, pues es lo que los ayuda a pagar la educación y las necesidades básicas de sus hijos. Luis elabora interesantes muebles y adornos que son vendidos a precios considerables, sin embargo muchas veces no puede atender las solicitudes de todos sus clientes por la falta de herramienta y material, es por eso que ahora solicita un crédito con el que pueda invertir en estos insumo y de esta forma fortalecer su negocio y además incrementando sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Además Luis está seguro de que con la capacitación en herramientas administrativas que brindan en Fundación Alternativa, él fortalecerá su microempresa.
texts.en: Luis is 28 years old and comes from a poor family, so he was not able to finish school, although he did complete elementary school. He is married to Fanny, 26, who makes a living in agriculture. They have two children who are in school. The family lives in Latacunga, a city that is known for its attractive tourist sites for visitors coming from near or far, namely the city's historic center, which has been considered a national cultural center for almost 30 years. The city is the capital of Cotopaxi, one of the provinces that forms Ecuador's mountain region, which has developed in recent years to be an important area for the mining, metallurgical, agricultural and livestock industries. There are business that generate considerable income that have turned Latacunga into a commercial city with various opportunities for advancement despite the poverty level being above 50 percent. However, the people have looked for ways to make headway and not stay stagnate, implementing their ideas and starting businesses. Luis has worked as carpenter for the past 10 years. He learned the trade from his brother, who with a lot of love and patience taught Luis how to develop the business. He works between eight to 10 hours a day out of a small space in his home designated for this work that is so important for him and his family, since it pays for his children's education and basic necessities. Luis makes interesting pieces of furniture and ornaments that he sells for reasonable prices. However, many times he's not able to respond to all of his customers' requests because of a lack of tools and materials, and it's for this reason he is requesting a loan so he can invest in supplies and strengthen his business. In this way, he will increase his income and improve his family's quality of life. Furthermore, Luis is certain that with the administrative training provided by Kiva partner Fundación Alternativa his business will get stronger.

loans.use: to purchase tools and supplies.

loans.name: Elvis Yamil

texts.es: El joven Elvis es habitante de un municipio cercano a la capital Managua, siempre trabaja como secretario en una institución del gobierno, su esposa es cajera, con dificultades termino de pagar su crédito anterior a causa de problemas de salud de su hija, por quien ellos trabajan para el bienestar de ella y que pueda tener una buena educación universitaria y salir adelante en la vida. Solicita crédito por tercera ocasión para levantar un muro en la parte trasera de su casa debido a que cuando llueve toda la corriente del agua se mete en su propiedad, para el cual comprara cemento, arena, piedrines, bloques, hierro, perlines, zinc, arena y alambre, de esa manera ira reparando poco a poco su vivienda.
texts.en:
Elvis is a young man, who lives in a municipality close to the capital, Managua.  He works as a secretary in a government institution.  His wife is a cashier.  They have had difficulties paying back their previous loan because of problems with their daughter’s health. They work for the well-being of their daughter, so that she can have a good university education and get ahead in life. 

Elvis is requesting a loan for the third time to put up a wall in the rear part of his house. This is because when it rains, all the running water comes into their home.  He will buy cement, sand, stone, blocks, iron, purlins, zinc, and wire.  In this way, he will repair their home little by little.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, stone, blocks, iron, purlins, zinc and wire.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, urea and insecticide

loans.name: Matilde Gloria

texts.es:
Matilde es una mujer de 58 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, tiene un hijo a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Cosmetología, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Matilde brinda servicios de alojamiento y comida a jóvenes estudiantes, así también por las tardes ella brinda servicios de corte de cabello, todos los días desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por el buen trato que brinda a sus clientes.
Matilde se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cocina industrial, artículos de cocina, mesas, sillas y así también insumos para cocinar los alimentos; de esta manera Matilde tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado y abastecido, así ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda ampliar su negocio y tener construida su casa con materiales adecuados.
texts.en:
Matilde is 58 years old. She lives in the city of Ica, and has a son whom she loves and is the main part of her life. She is a very friendly person who is hard working, enthusiastic, and who dedicates all her efforts to the betterment of her family. Thanks to her efforts, she was able to study for a career in cosmetology. In her free time, she enjoys cooking a delicious Carapulcra con Sopa Seca (a traditional South Peruvian Quechua dish) to share with her family. 

Through hard work and dedication, Matilde offers accommodation and meals to young students.  In the afternoons, she also offers hair-cutting services.  Every day she starts her workday in the early hours of the morning, and she can work approximately 12 hours.  She believes things are going well for her as a result of the good treatment she offers her clients.

Matilde is grateful to the Kiva lenders because, thanks to the aid they offer, she will be able to purchase an industrial kitchen, kitchen items, tables, chairs and food preparation supplies.  Through these means Matilde will have a better-equipped and stocked business, and will keep working and making an effort so that in the near future she can expand her business and have her house built with proper materials.

loans.use: to buy an industrial kitchen, kitchen items, tables, chairs and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a toilet and adhesive materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, sausages, sodas, staple foods, cosmetics, cereals, plastic goods,  productos de plásticos, grooming products, home goods, vegetables, and dairy products.

loans.name: Eusebio Antonio

texts.es:
Eusebio es un hombre de 61 años, se encuentra felizmente casado, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, a quienes ama y son sus principal razón en la vida; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Eusebio no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver noticieros en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Eusebio trabaja brindando servicios de transporte, el cuenta con una mototaxi la cual utiliza para trabajar, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él sale a recorrer las calles de su ciudad en búsqueda de pasajeros, Eusebio puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por el trato amable y respetuoso que brinda a sus clientes.
Eusebio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea hacer el tarrajeo, pintado y puesta de instalaciones; de esta manera Eusebio tendrá su hogar en mejores condiciones, ya que actualmente su casa es de esteras y adobe, así el desea seguir trabajando y esforzándose para que junto con su familia puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
Eusebio is a 61-year-old man, who is happily married.  He lives in Chincha with his wife and 2 children, who he loves.  They are his reason for living.  Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic resources and a need to work to support himelf, Eusebio could not study a professional career, but he has always wished that he could.  In his free time, he likes to watch the news on television and sometimes cooks a delicious Carapulcra with Sopa Seca.  

With a lot of determination and enthusiasm, Eusebio works offering transportation services.  He has a mototaxi that he uses for work.  Every day, he starts work in the very early morning hours, when he leaves to travel the city streets in search of passengers.  Eusebio can work an average of 12 hours a day, and he believes that he does well because of the friendly and respectful way he treats his customers.

Eusebio is very grateful to the Kiva borrowers, since thanks to their help, he will be able to improve his home. He hopes to do the cementing, painting, and installation commissioning; In this way, Eusebio will have his home in better condition, since it is currently made of reed panels and adobe.  He hopes to continue working and striving so that he and his family can get ahead.

loans.use: To improve his home.

loans.name: Marisa Isabel

texts.es:
Marisa es una mujer de 32 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo con su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo pudo estudiar una carrera técnica de cosmetología, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver programas educativos y noticieros en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pato Guisado para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre, Marisa puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de patos y pavos, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por el cuidado y limpieza que les da a sus aves.
Marisa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias  a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de alimento balanceado para sus aves; de esta manera Marisa tendrá a sus aves bien alimentadas y cuidadas para su mejor desarrollo, así ella espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda tener una granja más amplia.
texts.en:
Marisa is a 32 year old woman who lives in Chiclayo with her little son, who she loves and is her highest priority in life. She is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to rise above. Thanks to her effort, she was able to study a technical degree in cosmetology. In her free time she lives to watch educational programs and news broadcats on television, and occasionally she cooks a delicious duck stew to share with her family.

With a lot of determination and enthusiasm, and thanks to the teachings of her mother, Marisa started her small business of raising and selling ducks and turkey. She gets up early every day to begin her work. She can work for approximately 12 hours dao;y and thinks that it is going well due to the care and cleaning she gives to her birds.

Marisa finds herself very grateful to the borrowers on Kiva. She is thankful for the help that will be enable her to buy animal food for her birds. This way, Marisa will have well-fed and cared for birds to better develop her business. She hopes to be able to increase her sells and her income like this, which would allow her to have a wider farm in the not-so-distant future.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her birds.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan Carlos de 48 años de edad, quien se ha desempeñado en diferentes tipos de trabajo, sigue laborando como radio técnico con 22 años de experiencia en el ramo, su esposa siempre apoyándolo con su trabajo como empleada doméstica de esa manera apoyan a salir adelante a sus cinco hijos en especial a tres de ellos que todavía están pequeños y van a la escuela a quienes desea verlos convertidos en grandes profesionales. Todos sus créditos los ha utilizado en mejoras de infraestructura en su hogar esta vez su objetivo es el mismo seguir mejorando su casa ahora pondrá cerámica y construirá un cuarto para lo que necesita comprar cemento, bloques, hierro, alambre, piedrines, arena, cerámica, masía para pegar la cerámica y el pago de la mano de obra; poco a poco Juan cumplirá con su sueño de tener su casa con todas las condiciones necesaria para vivir con su familia.
texts.en: Juan Carlos is 48 years old. He has performed different types of work and continues working as a radio technician with 22 years of experience in this field. His wife always helps him with her work as a maid because they long to see their five children, especially three of them that are still little and go to school, become great professionals.  He has used all of his loans for better infrastructure in their home. This time his objective is to continue improving his house. He will put ceramics and construct a room, but to do so he needs to buy cement, blocks, iron, wire, ceramics, sand, adhesives to stick the ceramics together, and payment for manual labor. Little by little Juan will fulfill his dream of having a house with all of the necessary conditions to live with his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, iron, wire, ceramics, sand and adhesives to stick the ceramics together, and to pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 34 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta seguir trabajando y en algunas come un riquísimo Ceviche el cual es su plato favorito.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Juan trabaja brindando servicios de transporte, él cuenta con un  pequeño auto el cual utiliza para dar servicios de taxi, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él sale a recorrer las diversas calles de su ciudad en búsqueda de pasajeros, Juan puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien porque conoce sus rutas y sabe dónde encontrar mayor cantidad de clientes.
Juan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el cercado de un terreno que ha adquirido para que sea su vivienda, así también podrá cubrir los gastos del diseño y planos de su hogar; de esta manera Juan espera empezar a construir de su vivienda, así él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar de construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Juan is a single, 34-year-old man. He lives in the city of Ica, and is a kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic individual who has a great desire to improve. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources, he was not able to go to school for mechanical engineering as he had hoped, but he would have really liked to have gone. In his free time, he likes to continue working and sometimes, he eats the delicious ceviche, which is his favorite dish.

With much determination, Juan works by providing transportation services. He has a small vehicle that he uses to provide taxi services everyday. He begins very early in the morning, traveling to various streets in the city, looking for passengers. Juan works approximately 10 hours a day and he believes his work is going well because he is familiar with his routes and he knows where to find more customers.

Juan is very grateful for Kiva loans, because thanks to this help, he will be able to build an enclosure on his land, which he has acquired for a home. Also, he will be able to cover the design and planning costs for his home. This way, Juan hopes to start building his home. He will continue working and making an effort to reach his dream of finishing the construction of his own home.

loans.use: to build an enclosure on his land

loans.name: Luis Sandro

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 29 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Luis no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Mecánica que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta seguir trabajando y en algunas ocasiones come un riquísimo Pollo a la Brasa, el cual es su plato favorito.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Luis trabaja brindando servicios de transporte de carga pesada, él cuenta con un pequeño camión el cual utiliza para su trabajo, todos los días desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por tener su camión en buen estado.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el reforzamiento de la plataforma de carga de su camión; de esta manera Luis tendrá su camión en mejores condiciones para poder transportar mayor cantidad de materiales y variedad de carga, así el espera aumentar sus servicios e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda tener un negocio propio y así tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Luis, 29, is single and lives in the city of Ica. He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to excel. Regrettably, due to a lack of economic resources and the necessity to work to support himself, Luis was unable to study the professional career in Mechanics that he wanted to, but he would have greatly liked to be able to do it. In his free time, he likes to continue working and on some occasions he eats a delicious grilled chicken, which is his favorite dish.

With much effort and enthusiasm, Luis works providing services in heavy freight transportation. He has a small truck which he uses for his work. Every day his work begins in the early hours. He can work approximately 10 hours daily, and he believes that it is going well for him because he has his truck in good condition.

Luis is very grateful for the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they provide he will be able to reinforce his truck's cargo bed. This way, Luis will have his truck in better condition in order to be able to transport larger quantities of materials and a greater variety of loads. That way he hopes to enhance his services and increase his economic income, which will serve him greatly so that in the not-too-far future he can have his own business and that way have his own house.

loans.use: to strengthen the cargo bed of his truck

loans.name: Maria Lorena

texts.es: María Lorena ahora es madre soltera, debido a que se separo de su esposo, para brindarle todo lo necesario a sus dos hijos, se dedicaba a la venta de comida para algunas empresas entre ellas zonas franca, pero algunas cerraron por lo que se vio obligada a buscar otra alternativa viable de negocio el cual es la venta de ropa, cosméticos y también se dedica a la costura de ropa. Solicita su crédito para abastecer su venta con ropa y cosméticos de esa manera ofrecer más productos a su clientela que son los vecinos de su barrio y amigas a quienes les vende a domicilio, agradece el apoyo brindado por KIVA y AFODENIC.
texts.en: María Lorena is now a single mother because she separated from her husband. To support everything necessary for her two children, she dedicates herself to selling food for some businesses between free ports, but some have closed, so she is forced to look for a viable alternative, which is the sale of clothing and cosmetics as well as sewing clothing. She asks for a loan to supply her sale of clothing and cosmetics and, in this way, to offer more products to her customers, who are neighbors in her neighborhood and friends who she sells to in their houses. She is grateful for the support of Kiva and AFODENIC.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Sorma

texts.en: Sorma is 33 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kratie Province, Cambodia. She has been selling soy bean milk for more than two years, earning approximately $10 per day. Her husband is a teacher who earns about $3 daily. Sorma is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase materials to build concrete ladder in her house. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a meant to install in her house

loans.name: Sonia Marina

texts.es: Doña Sonia de 40 años de edad, su esposo ahora trabaja vendiendo cosméticos, ella vende tortillas, refrescos, gaseosas, queso y crema; con esos ingresos a poyan a sus 4 hijos que todavía van a la escuela y su sueño es verlos convertidos en grandes profesionales. Solicita su cuarto crédito para invertir y fortalecer su negocio comprando materia prima como maseca, maíz, leña, y productos lácteos, para seguir trabajando con más rubros de esa manera prosperar y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia is 40 years old. Her husband sells cosmetics for a living, and she sells tortillas, soda, soft drinks, cheese, and cream. With this income, they support their four children, who are still going to school. Their dream is to see their children become strong professionals. 

Sonia is applying for this loan to invest in and strengthen her business by buying basic materials such as cornflour, corn, firewood, and dairy products, in order to continue working with more items. In this way, she can prosper and help her family.

loans.use: To buy cornflour, corn, firewood, cheese, cream and milk.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 22 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su pareja y su pequeño hijo, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta seguir trabajando y en algunas cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luis trabaja brindando servicios de transporte, él cuenta con una mototaxi la cual utiliza para trabajar, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él sale a recorrer las diversas calles de su ciudad en búsqueda de pasajeros, Luis puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien porque conoce sus rutas y sabe dónde encontrar mayor cantidad de clientes.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de una habitación en casa de sus padres, para así poder vivir con su pareja y su pequeño hijo; de esta manera Luis seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda tener su casa propia y así junto con su familia desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Luis is a 22 year old man, who lives in the city of Ica with his partner and his small son, whom he loves and are the most important thing in his life. He is a very kind person, hard worker and enthusiast, who has a strong desire to get ahead. Unfortunately due to lack of financial resources he could not study the professional career of mechanical engineering that he would have liked to do. 

In his spare time, he likes to cook a delicious rice with chicken to share with his family. With much hard work and dedication, Luis works providing transport services. He has a mototaxi, which uses every day from early hours in the morning when he starts his work. He comes out to tour the various streets of his city in search of passengers, Luis works approximately eight hours and believes that he is doing well because he knows the routes and knows where to find more clients.

Luis is very thankful with the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their support he could make the construction of a room in his parents' home to live with his partner and small son. Luis will continue to work and strive for that in the not-too-distant future may have his own house.  Together with his family, he wants to get ahead.

loans.use: to build a room in his parents' home.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Doña Rosa María 36 años de edad, madre soltera de dos hijos, ella ha trabajado en una zona franca, ahora tiene una pulpería administrada por su hermana debido a que ella trabaja como empleada doméstica en una casa particular, también alquila cuartos en su vivienda, de ese modo se las ingenia para cubrir con los gastos básicos del hogar y personales para poder tener un nivel de vida equilibrada ella y su familia. Para seguir progresando ella solicita su segundo crédito para construir una pared enfrente de su casa, para eso necesita comprar cemento, alambre, arena, piedrín, bloques, con todos estos materiales ya podría empezar a realizar la construcción, que le dará mayor seguridad y firmeza a su vivienda y a sus inquilinos.
texts.en: Doña Rosa María is 36 years old.  She is a single mother of two children.  She has worked in a tax-free area and now has a small grocery run by her sister.  Doña Rosa María herself works as a domestic employee in a private home.  She also rents rooms in her home.  This is the way she has devised to cover her basic household and personal expenses and to give herself and her family a balanced standard of living.  In order to continue moving forward, Doña Rosa María is requesting a second loan.  She  needs to purchase cement, wire, sand, gravel and blocks to put up a wall in front of her house.  With the purchase of those materials, she will be able to start construction.  The wall will give more security and strength to her dwelling and to to her tenants as well.
